reviews.review: Wonderful place to stroll, shop, and take in the sights. To me, the Passeig de Gracia was more the real Barcelona than Las Ramblas. Less touristy. It is a grand tree-lined boulevard lined with a wide assortment of beautiful architecture, trendy high end shops as well as moderate-priced shops, and restaurants. It was a pleasure to stroll down, even if the Gaudi buildings had not been there.
Long walk. Very nice spacious road with a lot of very nice and interesting shops. Great atmosphere, worth to visit.
An interesting neighborhood. Well worth seeing, but lots of walking for a few sites. The stores are very expensive, as expected. There is usually a crowd around the block of discord houses.

The Barcelona equivalent of Champs Elysees. A good representation of international brands lines the entire shopping street.
Great idea to locate the downtown tax refund counter near the middle of the street. An added bonus - it provides instant cash/credit card tax refunds, subject to you getting the forms stamped and mailed at the airport of coz ;)
Trendy. This is the historic street of the rich and famous. Now it is the high end fashion shopping district. Lots of restaurants and bars. Shops like Prada, Versace, Chanel.....

Great avenue with restaurants and other atractions. In particular there is what I predict will become a hot spot in Barcelona, and I refer to El Nacional, a place for gourmet food, very much like the Mercado de San Miguel in Madrid. A must go!
The heart of Barcelona. Elegant, full of shops, nice buildings, good restaurants. Higly recomended to have a walk, take a drink and watch people and buildings.

The Passeig de Gracia.. This street has, like Champs Elysees in Paris or the Fifth Avenue in New York, all the main international stores in the world. Always is crowded with tourists and Barcelona's people. Besides there are two Gaudi's best building, Casa Batlló and La Pedreda.

Quite the architictual design ... enjoyed it.. Make sure you go either in the morning or later in the afternoon to avoid line ups. The place is a bit cluster phobic with narrow corridors but for an hour or so it is a good place to visit if you are spending more than 3 days in Barcelona.. it is a day 4 attraction to put it mildly

One of the main avenues in Barcelon. If you're in city center, you'll be not far away from Passeig de Gracia. This is the avenue where you'll have the luxury shops and the famous "Casa Botlla" and "Casa Mila" (La Pedrera) from Anthoni Gaudi.
Nice walking around there or take a drink or meal in one of the restaurants, bars, ....

Designer labels at every turn!. Shopping paradise if you like your international designer brands. All of the very finest brands in one place. Shopping heaven if you have deep pockets! Exquisite window displays!
wonderful Barcelona. wonderful area to stay and explore this amazing place - close enough to everywhere but not noisy at all
Loved our Barcelona visit. Had a wonderful time on our recent visit to Barcelona. Booked a tour with Runner Bean Tours & it was awesome.

You must walk the street. It's one of the most beautiful streets in Barcelona.
Worth walking it.
Full of modernism buildings and great shops

Fabulous!. This isn't a specific attraction per say it is a long street where you find all the designer boutiques. It is a must because there are a lot of gorgeous buildings and some restaurants. Make sure you walk until both ends of it to see the whole thing. There's mostly expensive designers but some of the more typical stores like Zara too.

nice walks and archetecture. It is nice to walk on this street and take in the Gaudi casas. architecture is amazing. Parallel to this street is the Catalunya street. less crowded with nice restaurants.
Noisy. There are nice buildings and bookstalls along the passeig. But the noise from traffic is terrible. We turned left before the Diagonal into a more quiet area.

Lovely Walk. was fortunate to stay nearby so 1 day we walked Passeig de Garcia and another the Rambla. Both have their beauty and while the pedestrian areas of Rambla are a plus the shops and Gaudi houses make this street a place you need to walk. Lots of great places to grab a tapa and drink all around

interesting walk. Higher end shopping, great people watching, great architecture, can connect your walk from La Pedrera through the Passeig, and down La Rambla west of Plaza de Catalonia, to the PLaza, and down the more touristy part of La Rambla to the Columbus Monument and the harbor.....even if it takes you a few hours, it is an interesting walk with many tapas, etc along the way
a pleasant stroll. Very nice display of Barcelona's architecture (do not miss Gaudi's Casa Batllo and La Perdrera). Good place for window shopping (Lladro, ...)

Passeig de Gracia. This is such a great street to stroll. High end shops, beautiful buildings which includes Casa Batillo & the famous Palau Mansion of textile Baron that Gaudi built. Nice restaurants with outside seating.It is also nice if you walk in the left of Casa Batillo to enjoy a Garden area and more residential buildings. Very beautiful in the evening all lit up.

Excellent location. We had never been to Barcelona and wanted to stay in a local neighbourhood. We stayed just of this Main Street and experienced local living with squares where grandparents, parents and children congregated after work. Loved the experience and would come back

Cool strolling in the middle of town. Late arrival, after 9pm; start unwinding by walking through the side roads: quite, but with most al fresco eateries open and welcoming you with paellas and the rest!I domped my bag, walked back and enjoyed the rest of the evening not really doing very much!

Upscale street known for its designer shops and Gaudi houses. I loved strolling along Passeig de Gracia! On this street, there was a nice mixture of designer shops, baguette shops, bakeries, upscale hotels, and gracious architecture of multistoried buildings from the turn of the 20th Century. Tourists use this street to see two popular attractions - Gaudi's Casa Batllo and Casa Pedrera. These are easily accessed from 2 Metro stations on the street or from buses that criss cross the street. While the street has many take away baguette, pastry and croissant bakeries, it also has a stylish MacDonalds. We opted to eat breakfast there as it was across from Casa Batllo where we had a 9 am viewing of the house. Unlike Las Ramblas, there are fewer open-air patio cafes on this street. On Passeig de Gracia, the wide sidewalks are clean, busy but uncrowded, unlike Las Ramblas, and tree lined for shade. They are well lit in the evening as well so it feels safe while window shopping at the various stores with their sparkling clean windows. Although Passeig de Gracia is a busy dual-lane thoroughfare, pedestrians can safely cross the street using traffic controlled crosswalks. I preferred to stay in this area at the Doubletree Hilton hotel during my visit to Barcelona.
Best place in Barcelona.. If you are going to visit Barcelona only for a few days, make sure you stay around this area as you will find the best restaurants and shops of Barcelona there.

Attractions and Shopping. Our hotel (HCC St. Moritz) was located only one block off the Passeig de Gracia . The Passeig de Gracia has the Gaudi attractions ( La Pedrera and Casa Battlo) combined with many high end shopping venues ( Versace , Hugo Boss , Prada ) for window ,or real shopping . It is a beautiful boulevard with many cafes and restaurants available .In the evening it is packed with people !

Take your time on this stroll. Beautiful street, with plenty of shopping mid to high end...indoor and outdoor cafes. Don't rush here. If you're into this, 'El Nacional' is a posh restaurant style market. Worth a visit.

Lovely Upmarket Street. While La Rambla is attractive to first time visitors, I personally prefer Pasig de Gracia. It's more pleasant for a stroll & like the La Rambla has a wide central pedestrian walkway in the middle with trees & seats put up for business by the restaurants & cafes on both sides. Shops here are largely more upmarket & there is quite a lot of international & designer Brand’s. Most shops open late morning. It's particularly pleasant to stroll or shop at this strip early evening & go for dinner and drinks in the plentiful restaurants and bars in the vicinity after shopping.
Another beautiful Barcelona Street!. Shopping, eating, just watching the world go by--or going with the flow--this is free enjoyment. Another do not miss!

Its a shopping center. Well, the metro station is at the heart of this area. Its for luxury shopping and eating at nice restaurant. If you dont like shopping that much its not a place for you and you coukd just pass by to say you saw the place :)
Great shopping and Architecture . Great for high Street shopping and wonderful strolls admiring beautiful architecture. Although over priced and below par quality in restaurants and café...
Place of shopping heaven. If one have plenty money to spend, they will find the whole area heavenly. All the buildings are also a pleasure to view. Lots of nice restaurants to eat too.

Modern Barcelona. We got off the train at the Gracia station, and walked along this avenue, with lots of lovely shops selling a wide range of goods. Lots of hotels along the way. Very busy with traffic running through. Plenty of cafes and bars.
Fantastic shopping!. We stayed at the hotel close to this shopping area and, of course, paid a lot of attention to the neighborhood full of famous brand names stores and boutiques.
Great Shopping. In the heart of Barcelona is this wonderful avenue filled with people watching, shoppes, and great eateries. A Must!
Enjoy the walking and shopping. This place is reminiscent of Les Champs Elysee in Paris. Wide street flanked by upscale boutiques on both sides. Enjoy the beautiful architecture and people watching.

Very nice . While the rambla is the heart of touristic Barca, passeig de garcia is the heart of the modern Barcelona. The walk is extremely amazing with the designer shops. Coffee shops and restaurants are amazing. I loved it.

Complete contrast to La Rambla. In complete contrast to La Rambla, Passeig de Gracia is a calm, elegant road with every possible shop you can think of - Tiffany, Boss, Zara(!) - the spectrum is here. This is one road in Barcelona that you won't mind getting your wallet out in, and in contrast to La Rambla, you are less likely to have it nicked! Everything just seems better quality, even the coffee in the smallest coffee house tastes divine. On that note, try Divinus, which is at around 60 Passeig de Gracia and don't forget to visit the rooftop bar atop the Majestic Hotel at 68 Passeig de Gracia - with it's own outside dip pool, in good weather you'll enjoy the stunning views in a calm oasis. If it's raining it'll be closed. Beware the drinks are pretty pricey, but worth a visit 'just for one'.

An architectural delight,. This doesn't cost anything, which is quite something in Barcelona, but you are able to enjoy the wide range of buildings including Gaudi and Gaudi-like architecture available. Enjoy and look up.
Very nice. A must visit place if in Barcelona . Very good street. Amazing buildings. Many designer shops are there so you can buy different stuff. Also there are plenty of restaurants are well.
Shopping and Tapas . This road is full of shops with bars and restaurants off every crossing road . It's clean and full of great brands .You will need a map as its a long walk from end to end

A must-see, if you're rich.... The 'Rodeo Drive' of Barcelona. Marvel at the high end marques from a distance, or window-shop to your heart's content.
Or go in and browse, if you have developed the technique of exiting without it looking obvious that you were never going to buy anything.
Remember, as they say 'if you have to ask, you probably can't afford it'...
Best place for shopping. A great place for shopping and the architecture is always a treat for the eye of the traveler. It was always a highlight of my trip into the city center.

For architecture and shops. I'm not too much of a shopping person so this will be mainly for the architecture and Casa Batlló and La Pedrera.
Having said that, it is very interesting architecture compared to other places which by itself will be worth a walk down this boulevard.
Good shopping spot. Nice shopping spot for everyone looking for luxury items.Full of premium retailers.Busy and livid.Nice architecture as well.

Architectural highlights of Barcelona. Passeig de Gracia is one of the major avenues in Barcelona and contains many famous buldings including Guadi's Casa Mila and La Pedrera. The paving and some of the street lights are also influenced by his work. It's also home to many of the more expensive shops in Barcelona and is worth a look during both day and night

Best street in Barcelona for shopping lovers . All the brands and what ever you want to buy.
Biggest Apple store near Catalunya square, gree internet. GAUDI houses and ...

Look up and Down ...this street of wealth and history. This is one area of Barcelona that you should visit when time is not a problem. The opportunity to visit the museums -day or night is intriguing. Designer shops line the Boulevard. The sidewalks are eveninspired by Gaudi. The roof tops and building facades challenge your imagination and inspire additional research and reading...when you get home. The walk is easy...

Fasionable Boulevard. I believe this major boulevard rivals its Parisian siblings. It is busy but not overcrowded. Many food establishments from coffee shops to sandwich to tapas to restaurants of every stripe. Many of the modernisme buildings for which Barcelona is famous are located on Passeig de Gracia. The buildings are the main attraction. Make sure you to look at the designed tiles on the sidewalk. Also there are a few Gaudi designed street lights with granite benches incorporated. This boulevard us well worth a visit. Be sure to walk some of the side streets. Walk on Rambla de Catalunya, which parallels P de G and has incredible architectural buildings.
Gorgeous avenue . The 5th avenue of Barcelona is worth a stroll. Wonderful window shopping paired with modernist architecture and gaudi.

Nice area. We loved this area of the city, it had a lovely feel about it, never felt too overcrowded. Nice wide streets and pavements, plenty of shops mostly designer or high end but also some hidden boutique shops too, architectural heaven so bring your camera and look up!

Beautiful Street. Quite a contrast to the tacky Las Ramblas. Well worth a visit even just to window shop the higher end designer stores. We enjoyed the stroll and it felt a bit more relaxed here. A nice selection of bars/restaurants/street cafes to stop off for a drink and some tapas.

Bring your camera. The buildings along this elegant avenue are architecturally fascinating, many of them by Gaudi, so bring your camera and arm yourself with patience, as it's difficult to get good shots of those buildings without cars or buses in the way. There are also many internationally known and high-end stores.

Shopping all around!! Some iconic architecture by Gaudi on the way. The stroll down the street fulfills your shopping appetite with some good eating points along the road. U can enjoy some tapas along the way. Gaudi,s modernistic building are also on the street!!! Great way to spend an evening strolling in Barcelona !!!

Awesome architecture. This place is heaven for architecture buffs.
Casa Batllo is in this street.. but yo be honest I was more amused by other buildings.
Its great for a walk.
Stayed close to this area. Our hotel was on the corner of this street. Passeig de Gracia is a lovely area with lots of beautiful architecture some of by Gaudi. There is lots to see in this area.
Great shopping experience . Lovely street with a wealth of lovely shops to visit and architecture to admire. Well connected with both metro and bus routes.

the Heart of Barcelona. Nice walk for window shopping while enjoying the beautiful architecture of Barcelona. The mix of modern and old with the addition of some of Gaudi works make of this place everything Barcelona is all about.

A grand shopping street. We walked this street on our way to diner at a nearby restaurant. The street was near full with people all well behaved. The shops were all interesting and the window displays got my attention. The building structures were interesting. It has a certain graciousness.
Nice street . Good place and nice street ... Expensive brands locations , Gaudi 2 buildings are there ... Nice to walk and enjoy... Must visit walk and enjoy ...
Famous boutiques. You can see this street which has many boutiques all of them are famous. Expensive and nearly all of them are world wide famous. You can eat tapas etc as well.

Not bad. It is a huge high street which I can compare to Champs Elysées or any other high street really. It's worth a visit as it looks nice, has many shops, restaurants and bars but if I didn't have the time to visit here on my second visit I wouldn't be so sad.

Lovely area, many fine shops and places to eat/drink, great people watching. This is a beautiful area. There are many high end shops and almost countless places to eat and drink. People watching also is great. I would not make this a special destination give the incredible museums, parks and other attractions in Barcelona, unless you are going there to eat or drink. But it is worth passing through and perhaps spending a few minutes watching the people enjoy their lovely city, and this beautiful place.

Grand boulevard. Connecting the Placa Catalunia to Av Diagonal. Very busy high end fashion shops and boutiques. Wide in size and worth discovering both sides. Lots of tourists fast food and coffee shops. Some tapas. Attractions include two architectural master pieces by Gaudi. La Pedrera well worth a visit if queue is not too long.
Great shopping area with beautiful architecture surrounding you. This is definitely one of the fun tourist stops in Barcelona. Lovely shops, buildings and sights. Enjoy your time there.
Great. Great avenue in thz centre of barcelona leading to la placa catalunya .. i was ther cause my train station was ther and i walked later

Gaudi at his best. Second house I have visited and a good exhibition. Well explained with plenty of photographs of how the house would have looked when furnished. Lots of stairs but full of light and wonderful features.
Shopping and Gaudí buildings. Very beautiful lane with plenty of luxury shops and of course Gaudí buildings. Not to miss of you visit Barcelona. Very crowded.
High end shopping . DESIGNER Brands lovers. .its your street ... Enjoy the spread of high end fashion stores ... at your disposal
Beautiful boutiques. A beautiful street with some fantastic and wonderful international boutiques. A very nice place to go shopping!

Perfect place to stroll with the girls. Walked down here most days. Wonderful buildings to see, amazing shops ranging all budgets, subway handy. A must when visiting Barcelona either with the girls or with your other half.

Ride bike & windowshopping . If you want to buy nice things go to Passeig de GRACIA! It's amazing! Nice stores just what you are looking for! But you only have time for a ride this street has nice space to go up and down between diagonal. And gran via... With nice Windows on each stores and great smell! Add the amazing buildings around! Good city side!

Pleasant for walking. From the center of the town to two the most attractive for tourists Gaudi houses on the left and right, and many others big and beautiful houses of Barcelona, shops of world famous marks.

Food for your soul as well as for your stomach and a diet for your purse :). A street offering almost everything: magnificent Gaudi architecture, shops with the most famous trademarks, various places to eat, street furniture...don't miss those beautiful lamp posts with seats. During dark hours you will find beautifully lightened fountains and facades.

A wonderful street to stroll. This street is graced by beautiful buildings along its entire length. As well as 2 Gaudi masterpieces there are lots of others, plus the fountains and street furniture. Lots of good shops and restaurants.
Lovely area to visit. Beautiful area, many nice shops. enjoyed walking around here. many cafes and restaurants in this area. the metro station is huge. make sure you enter the right one!!
Shop till you drop. All the high end shopping is on Gracia + 4 of Gaudi's houses to tour. Take a stroll buy great clothes and enjoy lunch + people watch The most fashionable street in Barcelona !

Beats Champs Elysees & Nevsky Prospekt anyday. I have visited a few cities across the world and Passeig the Gracia is now my new favourite. It is very pedestrian friendly and entertaining to walk through. Love the vibes and love Barcelona!!
Lively. Passieg de Gracia is a wonderful street, full of great shops, bars and restaurants- as well as fantastic Gaudi buildings.

Luxury shops. The Passeig de Gracia is host to must luxury and upmarkets hight street shops. From Chanel, Louis Vuitton to Cartier and Tiffany's, you will find all you want (and can only dream of). The street is also home to some of Gaudi's most renowned master pieces, including the Casa Balto!
A place to stroll. A great place for a relaxing stroll. Beautiful tree-lined boulevard so plenty of shade on a hot afternoon. Lined with wonderful architecture and designer shops (Dior, Armani et al)

A truely interesting street . Whether coming from the metro which is very efficient and cheap with a multi ticket or just walking this the street you can shop at Desigual , a very different clothing shop for men and women , buy some beautiful tapas or just sit at a coffee shop and watch the crowds thronging along or even visiting Casa Batllo this street has it all .

Shopping til you drop, people watch until your eyes fall out. Great area to walk and people watch. High end shopping, great restaurants and lots to see and do. The people watching is amazing and this area extends down to the Las Ramblas which is just an amazing place in itself. Quick note, if your hotel is near this stop on the subway its in the center of town and a great location to stay in Barcelona with lots of walking access to everything.

Heart of the Expansion District: Gaudi, 5 star Hotels, Chic Shops.. Passeig de Gracia and Arago or Carrer Valencia are Casa Batlo, Casa Millal many other Modernista building worth a leisurely walk, especially in evening when lit up. The best of high end (big bucks shops,) multiple restaurants of all types nearby. Admire the neat street light fixtures and the ceramic benches at their base, real cool!

Better than NY or Paris. Having walked in all three cities, this Avenue in Barca is in my opinion a class act. It is a welcoming, wide open, airy and sunny version of the best that the French or Americans can muster.The stores and restaurants and architecture and people are the best in the world or at least in the world I've been able to visit. Go there and bring your spending money.

The best luxury stores in the city. You wan't miss it! The best clothes, shoes and jewels stores in Barcelona. You will also find the most renowed modernist buildings of Barcelona as well as the best hotels. If you need a break, visit The bankers Bar at Mandarin Oriental Hotel (Passeig de Gràcia between Diputació and Consell de Cent)Benvinguts a Catalunya!

Elegant avenue, great for window shopping. For those of us who do not frequent 5-star hotels and know fancy brands by name only, it was nevertheless fun to stroll here after dinner at Bar Mut. Some of the architecture was beautiful and unusual including the Gaudi La Pedrera.

People watching. Barcelona's high-end shopping with some of the best brands here. But the real attraction is the ambience, Gaudi's famous Predrera and Castile batillo are here. The many alfresco cafes offering tapas and a cool seat in the shade of an umbrella. Thousands of tourists from across the globe walk this wide avenue that ends at Plaza de Catalunya.

Nice Stroll. Walked up and down this avenue multiple times due to eating, shopping and meeting groups. The area is nice and leads to Casa Mila and Casa Batllo, as well as other tourist places. There's plenty of shopping as well as cafes. It's one of the main tourist avenues in Barcelona and it's worth taking a stroll on. To walk the entire length and back, you're probably looking at just under 30 minutes.

Very picturesque boulevard with high end shopping. The Passeig de Gracia has gone upscale. It always was a large and beautiful boulevard, but on this trip, we found many more upscale stores like Gucci, Hugo Boss and other stores. I felt like I was on Fifth Avenue with a Spanish flair. Taxis were plentiful. Most staff spoke English.

Place To Shop. if you are in Barca then all shopping desire leads to Passeig De Gracia...with all kind of shops mostly luxury...you can spend a whole day shopping and window shopping ..we spend some part of the day in this street almost everyday we were in Barca...
Great shopping. This is the Rodeo Drive of Barcelona. Great shopping. FYI no Sunday shopping in this area by still nice scenery.

Very Good shopping. One of Barcelona's poshest streets and full of the best boutiques and some of the most amazing Gaudi architecture. Dn't miss the benches by Gaudi, have a seat and enjoy the world passing by.

Wives' shopping place. The street is full of shopping outlets, such as Zara and El Corte Inglas, and it is a very enjoyable walk.
The street is full of restaurants and bars too.

What's the big deal. This is a wide street stretch between the Passeig d. Gracia station to Diagonal Ave. On both sides you will find (expensive ) brand names shops and restaurants. Plus two sites , casa Battlo and Paradera.Neither I nor the kids enjoyed it. We decided to walk down the street to mall called Court Inglis which was better as far as shopping and food.C U AROUND
nice shops and restaurants. buildings lovely, easy access to metro, near ramblas and placa catalunya, shops and restaurants also good
Beautiful!!. High end shops, delicious restaurants, and beautiful scenery. This was a nice place to walk around for the afternoon.

Shops shops shops. Wide European street, central area with trees making it nicer than most busy shopping streets in the UK. Loads of shops, from designers to Zara. (Think there are a couple of Zara's.)Didn't see a lot of food places. Gaudi's Casa Batlo is on this street too.

Shoppers heaven . This Place is my idea of heaven. It has so many shops it's a bit like Oxford street but on a larger scale. The shops go on for ages and it's literally very busy so prepare for some slow walking. Loads of high end places as well end high street stored and loads of places to eat so something for all shoppers.
Center of City. A beautiful area of tree lined street and great shopping options for all. The Gaudi buildings on this side of the street fun to see too. Not to be missed!

Beautiful street. A walk in the Passeig de Gracia is a walk in a museum of the art of architecture. Amazing buildings line the street from both sides. Shops of all types and hotels and coffee shops and restaurants. I could not help but think that the architects of the 19th and early 20th century competed to give us this legacy of beauty

Look up!. Ignore luxury shops and spend time looking the amazing architecture and constraint designs of the buildings. A wonderful street to just take a paseo. Cafes and bars bit tourist end but some authentic ones to be found.

Nice walk in heart of Barcelona . It is very nice walk in the centre of Barcelona. Close to placa catulanya so good with buses,subway,trains etc. For Gaudi lovers,like me,it is awesome,because you can see many benches etc in his style and his awesome houses that he made!
Good shopping street if you have money. Nice shopping street. Many luxus brands but also Zara, Mango etc. Beautiful hotels and cafeterias. Very recommended hotel Royal Passeig de Gracia.

Best boulevard in Europe. I'm lucky enough to work on Paseo de Gracia and I never get tired of strolling down this beautiful wide boulevard every day after work, looking through the windows of designer stores like Chanel, Stella McCartney, Gucci, Burberry, Michael Kors and Jimmy Choo, and finding great fashion bargains in stores like Zara and Mango, while passing beautiful buildings like Gaudi's Casa Batllo and La Pedrera. You can also stop for a glass of wine with tapas and people watch. This should be on every visitor's list of top five things to do in Barcelona.

Nice walk, expensive shops/restaurants. It's quite nice to go down Passeig de Gracia, for a walk and maybe a light lunch. Otherwise restaurants are quite expensive and crowded, shops are luxury range. It's a famous avenue and the good thing is that it doesn't matter how rich you are, you can take a walk, eat somewhere nice and find some affordable shops as well, amongst the high-end ones. I think it's an avenue for everyone to enjoy.

Beautiful, wide thoroughfare for shopping. The streets in Barcelona are open and inviting. This main boulevard is lined with upscale shops, hotels, and restaurants. It is a joy to stroll down to people watch and to shop. It is also beautiful because of the many trees, fountains, and statues that are on this street.

A Nice Place to Stroll. The Passeig de Gracia is one of the most popular streets in Barcelona. On this thoroughfare you can find attractions such as Casa Batllo and La Pedrera, as well as many options for food and shopping. There are many tourists there, but it is not as touristy as La Rambla. You really shouldn't come to Barcelona if you're not going to walk down this street.
Barcelona . Looking for expensive shopping Most of world markes u will find it thereThe area is just an extension to the la rambls Get you card ready and have fun

Passeig de Gracia. The Psseig the Gracia, is one of the most visited avenues in Barcelona, walking from Diagonal Aveue, down to Piazza de Catalunya Squeare,During the walk, you can visit many Antonio Gaudí´s Houeses designed over the Passeig the Gracia like la Pedrera or Casa Batlló, and at the same time going shopping , as it´s full of the most known world-wide shops alongside.This Avenue has been remodelized snce 2 years ao, and without dount one of the most beautiful walks in the city, linking afterwards from Piazza Catalunya with the Ramblas down to the sea.

Shopping, shopping and relaxing breaks!. Passeig de Gracia is an amazing shopping destination. I like the boulevard, it has plenty of good brands shops and also coffee-shops terraces (Tenorio is my favourite). I always enjoy a walk on this boulevard!

Historic street that showcased all the premier architect's works in early 1900s. Its good to be able to walk down this historic street that showcased all the premier architect's works in early 1900s. Most well-known would be Gaudi's landmarks of La Pedrera and Casa Batllo but there are plenty of others to admire.
And its free!
Nice walk. Great boulevard, for sight seeing, shopping and dining. Beautiful surroundings, safe area, chic stores and restaurants. A must visit area during your stay.

High End Shop till you drop . High end stouts from Gucci to Hermes and everything in between. The streets are also lined with an abundance of shops, restaurants, and cafes. The area was very crowded with tourists and locals, but felt very safe throughout.
Great walking street. great to walk down here and see the shops and stop at all the Gaudi buildings. Good way to spend a morning

Bright lights and delightful ambiance. Enjoy the phenomenal lights of the avenue and buildings. My family and I would always take a walk after dinner on Passeig de Gracia to enjoy an espresso at one of their quaint sidewalk cafés.
A grand avenue. Leaving from Placa Catalunya, a beautiful and elegant avenue to discover. The architecture is breathtaking all along, including Casa Battlo and La Pedrera.

Gracia festival time. Walk through the narrow streets of Gracia for an old time European feel. If you are hungry, need staples, clothes, homegoods and more, Gracia has lots to offer. We went in August during festival time, and I can't say enough about all the streets that participate in the festival. We went during the day, we understand it is incredibly busy at night.

Upmarket Barcelona. Stayed in an apartments us off Passeig de Gracia. Handy to paseo Batilo, shops, Metro etc. Beautiful ornate buildings, lots of seating areas close to shops. Just be careful of cyclists, skateboarders & roller-bladers
nice area. nice area to roam around. Barcelona is all different in different areas. Depending where you are, the architecture is different.
Great for Walking and Shopping. This area of Barcelona is fantastic for a long walk so please remember to bring your comfortable walking shoes for this.
Nice shopping street. Its a subway station. train station and a shopping street. You can find all the major luxury brands there.

Shopping!. Lots of high end Shopping available! Don't forget to ask for your tax refund form.
This is also where Casa Batlo and the Pedrera House is located. Cafes everywhere when you get tired.

Huge shopping street with Gaudi's architecture. While the Ramblas are often proclaimed to be the big shopping street, the Passeig de Garcia is the place to be if you are looking for the more common brands and clothing chains. All of them seem to be represented on this huge avenue. For those looking for something of cultural relevance: two of Gaudi's most famous dream houses are on this street which is certainly worth an additional point.

elegance. Simply the most stilysh quartier of Barcelona, located between Plaças Catalunya and Gracia quartier: it's full of luxury shops and last but not least some architectural masterpieces like Casa Batllò, Casa Millà and Casa Lleó Morera are there.

Great if you are visiting Barca for Football. Fantastic location high quality hotel with easy access to many of Barcelona treasures- the hotel is surrounded by plenty of restaurants and cafes bars etc

One of the best areas to visit in Barcelona. Passeig de Gracia is a wonderful area to visit. Plenty of restaurants, cafes, shops, markets, etc... We usually stay around here when we visit Barcelona. The main reason is the proximity to attractions as well as comforts of having everything you need at your door step.

Fabulous Street With Original Art Deco Architecture. We stayed on Passeig de Gratia and found it to be a great location to explore Barcelona. Wonderful restaurants and attraction to be enjoyed.Lively and great for people watching, all types.
good place to vist. if you want to be in a busy place defo a place to go and visit. You have some of the biggest designer shops in this place
Barcelona's own Champs-Élysées. Definitely worth the visit. Filled with luxury stores, it´s a charming, broad avenue, where you could also find two of Gaudi's masterpieces: La Pedrera and Casa Battló

Worth the Long Walk. It's worth the long walk along Passeig de Gracia, the buildings are absolutely beautiful, lots of trees along the road which gives lots of shade from the hot sun and lots of benches too to sit and admire the amazing buildings.

Famous shopping street with architecture. Famous shopping street with architecture. Good for a long walk along shop windows (maybe entering) and visting Gaudi's casa Batlo or casa Mila (La Pedrera) in same street. When tired use L3 subway
Lively shopping and eating area!. Paseo de Gracia is a MUST in Barcelona, not just for shopping, but for "people watching", eating and having a nice glass of chilled "cava" in an outdoor cafe.

Busy shopping area with architecture. Walking up the Passeig de Gracia is essential to see some of the more outlandish buildings. The street itself is an extremely busy high-end shopping area, probably good if you want that sort of thing, most visitors will probably just stare at the buildings (plenty to see without having to go into them).

Ritzy avenue!. Wide avenue of ritzy money-is-no-object stores: Rolex, Chanel, Tiffany, Bulgari, etc. It's like Beverly Hills on steroids. Don't miss seeing the Gaudi street lamps, and the exteriors of his Casa Mila, Casa Batlo, and Casa Amatller.
Take a stroll. Wide tree lined street with up end stores on both sides. Plenty of places to sit and people watch as well as many beautiful buildings.
Chic!. A beautful Avenue. Where Gaudi is everywhere. The avenue itself is chic, with the main clothing brands. Architecture is amazing.
Great shopping area!. This street has so many good brands and their prices are not that high either! Visit in the beginning of July to take advantage of their biggest sale season of the year.
Andrássy of Barcelona. Longish avenue for shopping and window-shopping. However a bit pricey. Gaudí's footprint is there. Suitable for cyclists.
Great for Shopping!. This place is just at the top of the Main Street 'La Rambla' it is easy to find and has a metro station in the centre. If your looking to shop this area is worth a visit.

One great avenue....... Take a stroll and slow down..... Slow down indeed and appreciate all the nice building in this lovely neighborhood...... It deserves a nice walk in the afternoon. You will see great people everywhere, and there are lots of nice family owed restaurants where you can stop and get a bit or a drink....... We did a nice leisurely walk of about 2hours...... It's just lovely!

Great shopping. If you have time left then go through the Passeig de Gracia and visit the shop's on both sides of the street. Great High Brand stores and same prices as most of the european bigger cities

Oxford Street in the sun. all the top name shops with Catalonia's own brands all in one place. But don't stop when the street narrows, carry on up and you'll find bizarres and boutiques out of the ordinary!

The most expensive street living up to its name . Passeig de Gràcia is the most expensive street of the city when it comes to real estate, but just one look at the names of the stores will reveal that is not just the houses. Prada, Gucci, Yves Saint Lauren, Tommy Hillfiger, you name it and they have a store in this street.There are also some great museums to visit in the street. From North to south these are my recommendations : Casa Mila (La Pedrera), Casa Battlo (from the outside), Casa Smattering ( right next door to Casa Battlo) and Casa Lleo I Morera.Restaurants in this street are super overpriced, so don't get tempted by the fladhy looking cocktails on the tables. You're better off walking south to Plaça de Catalonia and going in one of the side streets there.
Busy Street with many stores, restaurants and sights. This long busy street offers a wide variety of attractions from shop til you drop to dine at a variety of different restaurants and bars.

Very expensive street which is worth a visit. You cannot go to Barcelona and not go to Passeig de Gracia. It is THEE street in the city and has a great many of the well-known shops plus many local ones. My advice take your credit card and make sure it has plenty of "room". To be fair, Passeig de Gracia is also the jumping off point for many city attractions e.g. Casa Batllo and La Pedrera. It is also great to stop off in many of the cafes etc. and watch life pass by. A nice experience and worth a visit.

Great Main Street With Lots of Things to Discover. Everyone will find something on this street stretching through a good portion of central Barcelona. It starts with the biggest Spanish department store group and their main branch (El Corte Inglés) and later on offers some big brand stores (premium-luxury), but also many Spanish or local upscale stores with things you can not buy anywhere else. The restaurants in between are mostly nice and could be visited. I love the Torres store (of the winemaker), where you can try all the Torres wines and buy even the ones that are not carried by any supermarket.

The most beautiful avenue of Barcelona!. This is the most elegant avenue of Barcelona that still preserves the spirit of the Modernist period. When strolling along it, you are surrounded by the most beutiful architecture.

beautiful. great streets to see with stunning architecture and a variety of places to eat and drinks.The clothes shops are definitely on the pricier side. I suppose it depends on what you are looking for. Elegant and expensive are the key words.

nice walk and shopping. my husband works there, so i go with him most of the time and walk in the area, there are all type of shops clothes,jewellery.perfumes and from average to super expensive. its worth a walk and shopping if you would like.
Sightseeing with shopping. Great long wide avenue for those who like to visit the designer shops such as Vuitton, mulberry and Max Mara etc.
Shops and Gaudi. You will walk in this street if you go about Barcelona. There are some higher end shops and some Gaudi buildings. Not that exciting.

High end shopping . This is high - end shopping at its best. All the brands are here. It is a beautiful tree - lined, wide thoroughfare that is relatively quite compared to Las Ramblas ( but then you are going to Gracia for a different reason).
Nice place. Nice place to visit.. Pretty place..great architecture .. And good shopping.. Just another pretty place in a wonderful city.

You need Money. One of the most expensive street with the most exclusive brands and people visiting beautiful buildings expo etc etc and the most important thing buy and a very interesting sport for a 1000 eurista like me is read the little cards with the exorbitant prices in the store windows.
Window shopping heaven. Classy street, fabulous shops with equally fabulous price tags. If designer shops are for you then you would definitely go here.
shopping shopping shopping!!!. From high end designers to every day fashion, this area is the shopping heart of Barcelona! A good tip is to visit when there are many sales on!
shopping street. Nice street for shopping and a lot of traffic. Here you have a the expansive shops. Nice area with a lot to do.. In the center of Barcelona

Good window shopping. Impressive buildings, beautiful architecture, great shop windows and wide sidewalks. Wonderful place to window shop. Plenty of cafes. Can be a little warm on a summer afternoon so try morning or an evening walk. Lots of people watching and not as crowded as Las Rambles.
Magnificent Mile. Great people watching, fabulous architecture, high end window shopping, gelato on every corner...what more could you want?!
Nice place. A big avenue, lot of people, shops and restaurants. You can eat something and watch the world. Checked on my list

Shopping in previous upscale residential street. Great shopping in what used to be a upscale residential neighborhood in Barcelona.
Great to walk, look around, shop.
Many places to stop and some nice tourist attractions on the way.

Busy and full of tourists. If you like shopping and hordes of tourists on a busy street, then I suppose this would be fun. But in general, it's designer fashion or upscale stores catering towards tourists. If you want local shops, head a block over to the west, and you'll have a more enjoyable time.
The 5th Ave of Barcelona. No trip to Barcelona is complete without a stroll down Passeig de Gracia. Lots of upscale shops and great restaurants.

A Street that you will never be borred in. This street takes you from the start to the end of Barcelona, a huge and full of shops and some placas (Squares) that are very beautiful and some buildings that are the work of Gaudi, overall this is an open air everything, if you always walk in this street you will find at least 70% of your needs
Classy retail precinct. In the Gracia precinct, this is where you go if you want high-end retail. You will also find La Pedrera (Casa Milla) close by. Worth it if you feel like a stroll.

Shopping . My mom and I walked the passeig de gracia and found many stores for shopping both high end and some reasonable. Better to walk earlier in the day because it gets quite crowded. The subway and bus are located right there.
Great shoppping and people watching. Wondering along Passeig de Gracia has always been my favorite. The shopping is great and the street cafes are not to be missed.
Some nice stores. Many of the stores are open till 10pm which is amazing because u can go shopping after the sunset when it is not that hot anymore.
Great for shopping. Lovely street, great for shopping, cafes, restaurants and bars or just to go for a stroll and check out the beautiful buildings

Attention Shopaholics!. This wide and beautiful boulevard stretches for many blocks with every high-end and mid-priced shop and boutique you can imagine. If you love to shop (and spend mucho money) then this area will be a dream come true.
Friendly Gracia. We stayed in the Gracia area and really enjoyed walking along the Passeig de Gracia expoloring all the shops and sampling the restaurants along the way. Friendly area

Cool Street to Walk Along. This street was a stop on our walking tour. I recommend going with a guide or guidebook to learn about the different architects and styles. We didn't spend much time there, but would definitely go back to admire more.

The most exrensive stores are here!. Like Paris Champ Elysee!!A large street,with all the expensive stores,and little cafes and restaurants,Also 2 buildings made by Gaudi there,make the street a must!

Wonderful walking street. Both sides as you walk up and down you will see, smell and even taste some amazing things. From Gaudi's two triumphs to the huge El Corte Engles there are so many things to do. Just off the Main Street in the side streets where less tourists dare to tread is a further wealth of experiences. Especially dining with the locals

The place for Gaudi's magnificent houses. On passeig de Gracia you cand find Casa Bartlo and La Pedrera, one of the most beautiful hauses designed by Gaudi.My personal favourite is La Pedrera, also called Casa Milla, because the rooftop is amazing!A must go,I say:)Enjoy passeig de Gracia, wear confortable shoes and watch your bags:)

Great tourist office. It's your typical shopping street. You can find here luxury brands as Chanel, Gucci, Miu Miu and Louis Vuitton, but also much more normally priced brands as Replay, Diesel, Zara, Brandy Melville, Max Mara, Massimo Dutti, Oysho, Puma, etc. There's also COS, one of my favorites. For those who prefer going through stores instead of shopping malls, this is your street. McDonalds is waiting for you across of Casas Battlo y Amatller, if you are in need of a fast food restaurant. But, most important fact is that at the end of this street (and by end I mean the part farthest from Placa Catalonya) you will see a sign on street for a Tourist office. The sign won't be red as ones you will see around the city (!), than blue. Those marked with red are hiding behind the counter most useless people I have ever see. Oh, and they're liars too and sell tickets for double price (they tell you different story). But, this one is in Palau Robert and a woman working here helped me find some place although she had to make a few phone calls to achieve it. Palau Robert has some great exhibition for your kids, btw.

Turn of the century grandeur at its best!. What flamboyance, such extremes of "besting the Jones"! Take the AJ Jennings' Gaudi tour (Sandemann's New Europe walking tours) to see and hear how far the rich were willing to go/to spend to show their opulence.
Amazing stroll. This is an amazing lace to stroll for a while, lots f coffee shops as well as the high end shopping and the architecture by all of the famous architects.Absolutely a must
Good shopping!. Really nice shopping street, has all the designer shops but can also be a really great place to just sit and people watch!

Barcelona's Golden Mile. If you have visited the Champs-Élysées de Paris, the 5th Avenue of New York or Bond Street of London, you will also be enchanted by the Boulevard Street of Paseo de Gracia of Barcelona. Besides its luxury premium brands, international flagship stores, five star hotels with great terraces overlooking the avenue, you will also discover the art and arquitecture of the city with the main iconic buildings - Casa Batlló, Casa Milà (La Pedrera), Palau Robert, Casa Ametller, Casa, all built by prestigious architects like Gaudí, Domenech i Montaner, Puig i Cadafalch, Josep Vilaseca and Casanovas. This is a 1Km walk into history, shopping, art and leisure with plenty of nice restaurants and coffee bars along the way to spend a nice afternnon in Barcelona. Both for locals and tourists, it is a must if you visit Barcelona.
Classy walk. Very good decent neighborhood .nice restaurants , cafes and stores in the area. Restaurants with outside sitting . Very clean

Great Shopping . This street has some of the best shopping in Barcelona. We always walk both sides and enjoy looking for bargains on products not available in the USA. Also, a great assortment of cafes and restaurants at various price points. Yes, even the McDonald's has sidewalk seating...!!!

LOVELY- MUST SEE!. Amazing area, packed with loads of things to do, restaurants, artisan stalls, shopping, right near the fountains! If you walk down a few minutes you're in Placa de Catulunya, the heart of Barcelona and then you can keep walking to Las Ramblas. Definitely would recommend coming here!!!!
Love Barcelona. A nice trip at Barcelona should pass by Passeig de Gracia. Nice atmospher, nice people, nice food, nice, nice, nice...

What a fantastic street. This is pure class from the architecture to the vast width if the avenue to the upmarket hotels (Mandarin, Majestic)and stores. (Rolex, Channel, Gucci etc) This is the opposite to the sometimes tacky Ramblas and compares very favourably to London, New York etc
Great for an amble. . There's a good selection of shops, although most are high end and designer. As with most of Europe, not a lot happening here on a Sunday!

Beautiful place for a stroll. Tree-lines walkways, shops, and restaurants with periodic fountains make for a lovely stroll in Barcelona. While the area is touristy, you can also get a good sense of Barcelona life, especially for lunch or dinner.
Beautiful and elegant promenade. The Passeig de Gracia is one of the most exclusive area of Barcelona with beautiful shops as well as the Casa Batllo. You can feel the asmosphere of the city there.
Very nice walk. Enjoyed walking in Passeig de Gracia and seeing Gaudi's Casa Batlló and La Pedrera along with the well known shopping series. Many restaurants available and very comfy walking areas.

Great City walk or stroll. The heart of modern, retail Barcelona and an elegant avenue for tourists and locals alike to meet, shop and walk. Serviced along its length by a number of metro stops. A nicer walk, much more refined than Las Ramblas.

Smart shops, high prices - as expected.. A nice walk up and down the Passeig de Gracia popping in and out of all the shops is always good. Surrounded by designer shops and nice restaurants/ bars its well worth while. The odd Gaudi building dotted throughout is a nice touch although the entry prices seem a little steep.The restaurants are over priced for what you get but what do you expect when they are right next door to a Gucci or Louis V shop?Recommend the trip but don't expect to much.
Buzzing Location. Great place with lots of high end stores and filled with lots of cafe and restaurants leading down to Plaça de Catalunya.
Shop as a local. Passeig de Gracia is known by locals to have most ofnthe stores to find affordable decent clothing. But it is also packed with tourist competing with locals.
great place to wandering. passeig the gracia was great to wandering and shopping things, it has a cafe and many stores, Casa Batlo and Casa Milo too. It's not too crowded compared to La Rambla
Lots of shops. Good deals in the Spanish based retailers.. Good selection of shops, lots of sales and some good bargains to be had. Plenty of pleasant places to snack or lunch (or drink).
Great shopping. Good selection of quality shops and some good restaurants. Side of road cafes and slight more upmarket passers by. Less noisy than main town.

High-end shopping. Great pedestrian street that offers a quiter alternative to busy La Rambla de Catalunya - yet just one block away. We explored Passeig de Gracia from begining to end and enjoyed the shops and restaurants along the way. A nice stroll with less tourists than La Rambla.

Interesting selection of stores. The area has a vast selection of stores to fit any budget, whilst having a large variety of stores targeting tourists it doesn't lose its shine of locality as it also has a few local cultural stores along with some fantastic eateries.
A bit more than shopping. Typical (exclusive) shopping hub. However, two of Gaudi buildings are found here a couple blocks apart, La Pedrera and Casa Batllo. Nice place for dining at night.

Wonderful shopping, even on a budjet. The best shoe shops of Barcelona can be found from Passeig de Gracia. Plus fashionable clothes, bags, cosmetics, books, etc. Great selection even if you are not going to spend hundreds. There's many cafeterias and terraces for a quick drink in between the shopping.
Nicest Shopping experience in Europe!. Take your time to walk up and down! grab an Espresso at one of the cafes in the middle of the passeig!
Commercial square. I was staying in a hostel on that street. Restaurants and bars are everywhere. A really impressive street and nice squares at each ends. Nice place to buy some accessories too.
A good place for a stroll. Definitely enjoyed the benches and opportunities to window shop and people watch. Some great stops and shops along the way.

Good Restraunts and shopping. We made the walk twice and found it enjoyable. Nice selection of high end stores. I would not say that there are bargains, but we found the prices here better than you will find in the States, especially items that qualify for Tax Free.

It's full on shop till you drop. Pretty much shops from the top all the way down as far as you care to go. Lots of very high end boutiques with the big names and big prices interspersed with the normal household names in Spain such as Morgan, Zara etc. Added bonus two of Gaudi's tourist spots Casa Batllo and Pedrera are also on this street on either side.

Great shopping. Some very posh shops down here if you like that sort of thing. I would compare it to Knightsbridge in London. I really liked it for Casa Mila and Casa Batllo. The paving stones are lovely but do be careful of the taxi lanes as they cross the pavements.

A must in Barcelona!. The avenue is good to take a night walk, in summer is completely full so, I would recomend to go there early in the morning or late a night so you can really appreciate the architecture.

Really busy avenue. The main reason for walking up or down this road is either shopping or to see the the architecture notably the "Block of Discord" which shows of the modernista style. Further up is Gaudi's La Pedrera. Consequently the pavements are crowded with shopper, sightseers and beggars and the usual pick pockets. When we walk the length of the Avenue over a couple of days there was a very heavy police presence apparently due to an increase in pick pocketing. So keep your valuables close to hand.

So many things in one place. This road is a must to anyone coming to Barcelona. In one place there are so many things to photograph that makes it a central point for architecture lovers.Casa Batllo, La Pedrera, Casa Amatller are examples of the attractions located in this road and that are very popular attractions.There are also other unknown buildings which are worth shooting.

Hmm..posh and styled how I like. This beautiful walking passage is full of brand shops and grace. We were looking for some nice special backpack and clothing. At Michael Korks we found nice staff that helped up and bought 2 beautiful hand bags and backpack. We entered almost everywhere except Dolce and Gabana and Hermes because I hate to stay in line just to enter the shop. They will take in only 2-3 people at a time .It is an amazing passage which is worth visiting as well .

A wonderful avenue for sightseeing, strolling and shopping. This key avenue stretches from Placa Catalunya northwards and includes two Gaudi buildings worthy,of a visit. Casa Battlo and La Pedrera. It also has the iconic Hotel Majestic which I have reviewedIt is a tree lined avenue, shady in summer heat, in Autumn it was looking a little starker but still gorgeous.Shops and more shops you can find anything and everything from big international brands to top Spanish clothing stores

Sensible, affordable shopping is possible on Paseo de Gracia.. While high end shopping is certainly available here, I really like to shop at Zara and Zara Home. Their merchandise is moderately priced and appeals to a wide range of shoppers. I like the classic look of many of their jackets, blouses, and dresses. On this trip I found three items to purchase within the first 30 minutes in the store. Nearly all of the gifts that I take back home come from Zara Home. I love the way they color code a lot of their merchandise. Hopefully, I'll be shopping there again next summer!

Shopping, shopping, shopping! . If you're looking for big box or premium shopping look no further. Unless you have a black Amex most of the store you won't be able to afford. Yes there is h and m and an Apple Store along with other very high end retailers most are very expensive. Plenty of places to eat and a ton or people. Wide streets and lots of room to walk. Worth walking down to experience it and if you want to see gaudi sites there are two on this street. Great for people watching too and just relaxing and enjoying a drink.

High end living and shopping boulevard. Except for the awesome Quadrant Dor and some fine Modernisme structures including the La Pedrera / Casa Mila, it is a fine upscale residential and shopping center. Cafes are very pleasant. If you have time, you can consider a stroll.

Shopping Heaven!. Our hotel was based on this road, so walked up and down it every day! If you have plenty of money to spend, this is the place!Shops from Chanel, Stella McCartney, Prada, Gucci, Lonchamp - you name it, they have it. They also have the standard high street shops, Zara, Mango, Bershka, Nike etc etc.

Fashion designer capital. All the big designer names, Ferrugamo, Chanel, Michael Kors, Louis Vuitton are located here. A feast of fashion set amongst the magnificence of the architecture. If your man doesn't like shopping, there are plenty of coffee spots for him to enjoy the passing parade.
A place for shopping in barcelona. Led a large group in this long large road with plenty of shops and homes of fashion like zara , bershka , channel and others
Must walk through in Barcelona. We stayed at the MO Barcelona right on Passeig de Garcia. It is a long Avenue with many shops, hotels, restaurants alike and is a must visit in Barcelona

A main intersection filled with shops and restaurants. You would definitely walk through Passeig de Gracia on your way to the Casa Batllo.The stretch has numerous nice architecture, shops, cafes and restaurants.Nothing much to shout about but its a nice stroll along this stretch of road.

High street shopping. Walked around this beautiful boulevard stretching from Plaza Catalunya to Carrer Gran de Gracia. It was green trees along the avenue. Noticed historical architecture of Catalan Art Nouveau such ad Majestic, Block of Discord, Casa Mila.
Passed by the high street shops of Valentino, Prada, Louis Vuitton, Max&co and others

Inspiring. Don't miss it because it is touristy...it is astounding and almost overwhelming. Long lines but certainly worth the tome and the wait. I believe there is an easier way to bypass the waiting time by scheduling an appointment.

Central location. Close to all famous sites.. Stayed at Renaissance Hotel in this area. Excellent connections to all public transport that take you to every famous destination in this city. Casa Battlo is right out of the train station and Casa Mila(or La Pedrera) a little walk away.

Fantastic Boulevarde. Really wide streets with a few notable landmarks including the Casa Batlo and Casa Mila both Gaudi masterpieces. Ends at Plaza Catalunya, a hub for tour buses, hop on hop off, taxis etc. Lots of boutiques for the shoppers. The streets leading off are filled with tapas bars, all good.

Nice place to walk around. Very nice street, full of history, shopping and tourists. The architecture is beautiful. There are lots of famous stores to shop in. There are lots of people walking up and down but side walks are very good making it comfortable. Nice place to eat some tapas too.
Not a big deal. There's nothing special about Passeig de Gràcia. You'll probably go there just to get to other places without even noticing.

Wonderful walk on a sunny day. While I would suggest veering slightly off this street to eat (Cerveceria Catalana nearby is my absolute favorite), there is much to be had in terms of high end fashion and architectural viewing pleasure. As with much of the city, my strongest advice is to stroll through without any time constraints, and see where your interests take you, as there is much to be discovered nearby. While it doesn't carry the same clout or international recognition, Passeig Gracia could be Barcelona's Champs Elysées.
Stunning street. We walked this a few times, and it is such a stunning Sstreet to behold; wide, majestic, incredible buildings, including La Pedrera answer Casablanca Batlo.
Beautiful area. It was so much fun to go walk around the Passeig de Gracia area. Tons of shopping and eating. Also, really pretty and cool to get a glimpse of the culture.

Spains Oxford Street. Amazing place, good to go strolling, eating and shopping, the deals that i saw on offer there for european cities is mind blowing - half the price of any London store thats for sure.Mango had as 50% sale on and made the UK version of Mango look like D&G Prices!

Nice shopping and roadside cafe!. Nice commercial strip for brand name shopping (clothes, shoes, hand bags, etc.). There are benches on the roadside so that you can rest to wait for your love one while she/he is busy shopping in the stores. There are also nice roadside cafe that your party can take a break out from shopping and relax for a while. Was surprised to see that even the McDonald's has the roadside table setup nicely :-).

Fabulous shopping and restaurants!. We thoroughly enjoyed walking down this street shopping and viewing the beautiful buildings.The restaurants are varied and have outdoor seating. We enjoyed the food and people watching. Everyone was very well dressed. This street seemed like Barcelona's 5 th Avenue!
Interesting. We lived near that location.The Passeig de Gracia is a very popular area. There you can find a lot of restaurants and exlusive shops.

Better than Les Champs Elysées. This is an absolutely wonderful discovery. I'm used to French high end fashion and have to say it has the appeal of the Champs Elysées with a much smaller mass of people crowding the streets. You can find all the world known brands and discover less known but very good local ones. Provides for a very nice walk. I had the bonus of finding a perfume no longer available in France in one of the boutiques.
Avenue of the Stars. Great cosmopolitan parade in a city made for walking. At the head of La Rambla and Plaza de Catalunya with all the stores and grand hotels and benchs for people watching.

Beautiful area with high end shopping. If you have time to wander and take in the high-end shops, beautiful architecture (including some Gaudi) and love to people watch then this is a great place to explore. Beautiful street lights, clean wide streets, and one of the nicest areas in Barcelona.
Gorgeous street!. So many restaurants and shops and metro accessible! Lots of Gaudi architecture worth seeing! If you have some free time stroll the streets!

Shopping galore . Clean tidy streets with plenty of space and shops to walk about. I come from Manchester and the best shopping here (and in London) is NOTHING compared to what's on offer here. The wide streets, the friendly people, the lush green trees - amazing atmosphere.

Nicer than Champs Élysées. This is the most grandiose boulevard in Spain, if not in Europe. It's not as crowded as Champs Élysées in Paris. The architecture is amazing. I suggest a walk from Diagonal all the way to Placa Catalunya. It's a feast to the eyes.

One of Barcelona's major avenues. Full of high-end shops and restaurants, and decorated with ornate street lights designed by Pere Falqués i Urpí, here on this lovely avenue one can see the Gaudi landmarks Casa Milà and Casa Batlló, and connect to other parts of the city via the Passeig de Gracia metro station.

Where Chic meets Beautiful Architecture. We stayed one week at the hotel Royal Passeig de Gracia in June. Although there was nothing special about the hotel, Passeig de Gracia itself was interesting. It offers great high-end shopping, and beautiful architecture. There was a lot to see, with two Gaudi buildings, and the Place de Catalunia at the bottom end. It is also within walking distance of many Barcelona landmarks and is on the route of the Barcelona Touristic bus. Enjoy a stroll along this beautiful avenue.
Nice shopping promenade with high-end stores. Two Gaudi buildings can be seen along this street and it connects two subway stops - or you can cross Placa Catalunya and continue on to the Ramblas.
BCN shopping centre. The best place where to go shopping in Barcelona. Beautiful, long & wide street with restaurants, boutiques, jewelleries etc.

A culturally rich and vibrant environment.. I walked from the Catalan Parliament to this place. From here I took a Hailo cab back to my hotel. And I loved my 1/2 an hour or so of walking around this beautiful part of Barcelona. It can get crowded though. I was working so I kept a low profile and saw shops etc when walking. I did stop and drink and eat at cafes in the area. The Caffee leche in barcelona is just too good. And most all cafes offer free wifi. The people are warm and pleasant. Cafes have chairs and tables by the street walk and one can drink coffee and enjoy the beautiful architecture.

Best place for shopping . You can enjoy walking, shopping or just having some drinks at Passeig de Gracia.There are all brand boutiques as well as Zara, H&M, Benshka and others. Definitely have some time at Tapas.
Shopping restaurants. Love this street , full of life ! Less busy than la ramblas yet still tons of people, stores and places to eat, aTho the better restaurants are on the small side streets.

The best street to view Barcelona's amazing architecture. My husband and I absolutely love Barcelona's distinctive architecture and pedestrian-friendly boulevards. If you want a glimpse of the wonderful buildings, Passeig de Garcia is one of the best streets for wandering, watching and taking pictures. It's not as famous as Las Ramblas, but it is less crowded and has spectacular scenery, street lights and famous Gaudi buildings. Start in Eixample at Diagonal and work your way down to the Gothic section, have a nice lunch, come back on Las Ramblas.
gracia. barcelona equivalent of 5 ave, but much cleaner, beautiful, safe, alot of well to do guests in this part of the city
Beautiful. It's a beautiful walk with lots of beautiful buildings, some made by Gaudi (as La Pedrera) and lots of things to see. But you need good physical condition and a pair of good walking shoes!

A mini Bond Street.. Smaller versions of high-end global brands (Tiffany, Giorgio Armani etc.) punctuated by High St. chains (H&M, Mango etc.). No bargains with the £ as low as it is. Walk down past Cortes Ingles on Pla Catalunya towards Avinguda del Portal de l'Angel for a better atmosphere. Although a lot of repetition - there are about 3 Zara stores within 200m.

Strolling through history. A beautiful avenue in Barcelona. Take your time and see different gems every time you walk it. Gaudi buildings, cafes, shops, a vista foe everyone. Lovely to walk it early in the morning before the crowds hit.

Grand Boulevard of Barcelona. A wide boulevard lined with couture shops and residential apartment architectural gems, several by Gaudi.Urban Barcelona living at its upper crust best. Reminiscent of Paris or Buenos Aires. Locals seem to take the architectural beauty for granted, symptomatic of those who have a surfeit of beauty to gratify their visual senses.It is left to visitors to marvel and appreciate this grand street. Walk or bicycle down it - plan on a couple of hours, grab a light bite or cafe along the way, and soak it in.
Stay in Dreta de L'Eixample. The neighborhoods lining Passeig de Gracia are very nice with good shopping and great restaurants and is not overrun with tourists like La Rambla
Interesting butt overrated. There are some real gems in this section of town but no need to make it to the top of your must see list especially if your time is limited.

It's Barcelona's Champs Elysees . I don't know what to say about this area other than, if you have a lot of money to spend, want some stuff from Barcelona, then head there. It's super crowded, and I was warned by employees that there are many pickpockets on the Passeig de Gracia. Just be aware of your stuff and your surroundings. Personally, I didn't think this was very special.

Beautiful Chic Tree Lined Wide Boulevard. Much nicer than La Rambla which is quite tacky in my opinion. Lovely wide footpaths filled with cafés, lined with trees, places to sit and rest a while. Amazing architectural features on each side including Gaudi's Casa Battlo. Chic shops. Great people watching street. Fountains at various intersections. Lovely. Delightful.
in the centre of things. Perfect for shopping - lots of big brands and great collections. Very conveniently located and accessible by metro.

Romantic ambience . I love passeig degracia so much! Its one of my favorite places in barcelona! Its got a lovely atmosphere with great places to eat in the centre! You can stroll hand in hand, then stop have a little something to eat and watch the world go by then have a little shop after! Its just a lovely place to spend the afternoon. Ladies just dont leave you bags/purses on the table.

Place to shop until you drop. Try going from top of the street down, easy on your legs, there are pleanty beautiful shops restaurants and cafe´s avoid the sun specialy in August it will burn you alive.
Very busy Crowded Avenue. Large avenue with most shops of well known brands, also look for Batlló house and La Pedrera, worth the visit.
we just got to look and view. nice area, much to see and do and shop. We particularly enjoyed the little street shops that seem to be no more than 10 feet wide.

People, shops, cafes and buildings watching.. Locals and tourists, thousands of them. Plenty of posh shops. Hundreds of cafes and restaurants. Lots of nice iconic buildings. Scooters and motorbikes everywhere. Very busy area. Great for people watching. Many sets of traffic lights , but no roundabouts. Quite a few benches if you want a sit down. Wide roads with non stop motor vehicles. Access to metro if required. Enjoyable walking area.

Very enjoyable stay!. Great Location in a major street in Barcelona, with all the designer shops and nearby metro stations available! Very professional staff greeted us upon arrival, we had a premier room booked that was big and spacious on the 6th floor with a great bathroom and a view of the square behind the hotel but without a window to open which is important to us, so we fortunately upgraded at not much extra cost and hassle free for our remaining 6 nights, we then had a fabulous terrace room 803 on the 8th floor which I strongly recommend! A panoramic view of Barcelona and the street the hotel is on but no noise to hear at night! The room was cleaned to a high standard everyday! The bathroom is amazing but the only small criticism I have is that there is no main bathroom door, there is an inner toilet door that doesn't close tight and a shower door! Open plan is the style, see photos! But most wouldn't worry about this minor thing! The breakfast area is very pleasant with cooked food, cereals, fresh pastries and fruit, we opted to pay for this service upon arrival as cheaper than booking with your stay! Again the staff very pleasant and helpful and you can opt to eat outside in the garden area or inside the restaurant, we were very lucky to have good weather so sat outside everyday .The terrace rooftop bar can get very busy but a stunning view and well worth going to, the bar staff are very friendly and busy but will do their best to look after you! You can't book a table so its first come first serve! Cocktails are great and would recommend the burgers! Julia and a very tall young man (whose name I forget) are great! As are the rest of the reception staff who are always there for advice and help regarding your stay or where to go. The hotel is a good location for the city, for sight seeing, restaurants and shopping, runs parallel to Las Ramblas, also easy train ride to the fabulous beach! Would definitely recommend hiring bikes and doing the bus tour around Barcelona! We will hopefully return to Barcelona soon and stay at this hotel again!
Lovely to stroll. If you have an indulgent spouse, this is a great little place to wonder and shop. There are many great tapas spots and places to people watch, as well as to shop!

Wonderful walk. A beautiful boulevard thru the central Eixample District to stroll down in the early evening. Lots of stores and hotels, but the stars here are the buildings. Amazing architecture by Antoni Gaudi (don't miss Casa Batlló!), Josep Puig, as well as others. Check out the street lights with benches, beautiful!
Wide street, many shops . This is a beautiful shopping street, very wind with some amazing architecture. It's home to many designer shops and it's worth a walk up the entire street

Best shopping in town. Stick to window shopping unless you have deep pockets. All the top names line this tree lined street, but there are also some great sights - Casa Battlo, La Pedrera etc and some nice places to stop for a shady drink. Keep walking north and as the road narrows it turns into a more villagey, local shopping area. A really good walk.
glorious. i loved the grory of this street.beautiful stores and restaurants. interesting buildings and very clean.gaudi style places to sit and enjoy the city

Great atmosphere. Good for people watching. . Great place to do some high end shopping and people watching. You can find just about anything on this street. Also has some great architecture. A must visit if in Barcelona. Bring your walking shoes.
Shopping and eating. Lots of expensive high end designer stores like Chanel, Cartier, Louis Vuitton and Bvlgari. Also lots of pavement restaurants to choose from. And of course Casa Batlló and Mila.

Fantastic . The staff were welcoming. Phillip the concierge was delightful and helpful. The rooms were lovely, we also had a terrace which was an added feature. Plenty of toiletries and very comfortable bed. Breakfast was plentiful and delicious. There was a daily afternoon tea free of charge at about 4 or 5 pm , this was also delicious! A beautiful smell was always in the foyer!

Fun & Interesting Stroll. A must when visiting Barcelona! Lots to see --- great architecture. Nice restaurants. Also a good place to get souvenirs. Entertaining to see street vendors packing up their ware when a cop comes by and setting up someplace else.

Style everywhere you look. Go to Passeig de Gràcia to visit some of Barcelona's top sights such as the Casa Battló or the Casa Milà (also known as La Pedrera) or you can just go window-shopping as all the major luxury brands have their shops here. Enjoy the atmosphere and watch the stylish crowd passing by.
Best street for strolling and shopping. In my opinion the better (mid-range) shops are all on this road, not nearly as busy as La Rambla, beautiful views of Gaudi House, highly recommend this street!

Impressive . Impressive monumental street great for people watching, luxury shopping and architecture enthusiasts. Great place to stroll and there are several tours on foot, bike and segways are available to book. Note that cafes and bars are more expensive than the side streets but there is a lovely and impressive range. Can get very busy during shopping hours.
Madison Avenue of BCN. Beautiful avenue with many fine shops and ok restaurants. Looks like a mix of Paris and BA from an architecture look and feel.
street shopping. very long and large street for shopping and touristic stuff. However do not dine or have lunch here are everything is expensive.

Splashy ritzy fun. Bring money. Dazzling with top brand names in the fashion world, this street gives Fifth Avenue a run for the money.Better to leave your wallet at home and just admire the scenery. Jammed with tourists but not as bad as the Ramblas

Great place to see all the big Spanish brands. Perfect for a stroll, window shopping and serious shopping, dining and people watching. It rained though when we were there so we had to go inside one of these burger joints to let the rain pass so we can continue exploring what this place can offer. You can also have a good view of some Gaudi architecture while exploring all this Spanish brands.
Heaven for my wife!. Shopper's heaven!! All high end shops, restaurants, Guadi everywhere. Nice to walk around and take in a cappuccino and smoke a cigar and people watch.

Best Shopping Street in Barcelona. This is probably the 5th. Avenue of Barcelona. Many brand name shops are lined up on this fancy upmarket street.You can also find El Corte Ingles, the Spanish Department store giant, is also here. You can have beautiful views from the top floor. You should spend some time along this street if you visit Barcelona.

Lovely avenue. I'd recommend a stroll down Passeig de Gracia if you have a bit of time. If you're a high-end shopper, this is the place to go, but even if you're not, it's a lovely tree-lined avenue with historic architecture. An easy walk from Placa Catalunya brings you to Casa Batllo and Casa Mila (La Pedrera), two of Gaudi's creations. You can admire them from the outside, as they have fascinating facades, or opt to go in (both have admission charge). It's a nice change of pace from the tiny alleys of the Barri Gotic (which are also a highlight, just quite different).

All the famous Gaudi Bldgs are here plus a great FREE aerial view. This is the fancy shopping street and also contain La Reresada and Casa Batillo. At Playa de Cataluna (square) go into the large dept store El Corte Ingles and take lift to top floor (9th) for light snack and fabulous FREE view from three sides
spend all you're money. one of the most expensive streets from europe, good to go buy some fashion and have a city break. not good for rainy days

Great Shopping Paradise. Perfect shopping paradise, street markets, upmarket boutiques, cafes, restaurants, Gaudi houses, etc.Beautiful Christmas lightings, active street lives and many shoppers. Two of Gaudi's Houses are Casa Mila (Casa Pedrera) & Casa Batllo also located along this street.
