Top brands boutiques such as LV, Chanel, Prada, Hermes, Longchamp etc. Local boutiques such as Zara, Mango, also available. Also Spanish Departmental Store El Corte Inges. The nearest subway station is "Passieg de Gracia", near Casa Batllo.Many good cafes located on this street too. Hard Rock Cafe is located at the end of the street near La Ramblas.Whatever Spanish food you wish you can definitely find along this street (Tapas, Paella etc).Really enjoyed.

Fifth Ave of Barcelona. Fanciest stores line the streets . Clean and safe with major attractions to see (Gaudi buildings and others as well). We walked to gothic quarter and Los ramblos and took cheap taxis when we got tired. We stayed in Hotel Cas Fuster up the block so this area was right ouside our hotel. Central location.

Busy street with some lovely shops. All the main streets in Barcelona are noisy with traffic but most are also tree lined and there are some wonderful shops, bars, cafes and sights to see. Amazing architecture throughout the whole city - don't forget to look up!

A nice street for a stroll. This street starts from La Rambla and makes its way up to Diagonal. Along the way there are many shops and cafes, as well as Caso Batllo which I recommend seeing if you're a Gaudi fan

Excellent location - great shopping!!!. This street is very classy. Lots of designer shopping with a few select shops that aren't as pricey. Lots of restaurants. Our hotel was located on this street and it was MOST convenient to walk to Plaza Catalunya, Las Ramblas, Gothic Quarter, and we even walked to El Born. Very safe, very clean, main Gaudi sites are located close by.

Gaudi and Shopping. The Airbnb apartment that we rented was a block from Passeig de Gracia and Casa Batllo so we walked it every day. Its a beautiful street with several Metro access points and is much less crowded than Las Ramblas. There are high end shops on the street and two Gaudi buildings. I recommend taking the time to stroll this street to see all the amazing architecture.
Highly recommended. Take the time to walk down Passeig de Gracia, Great for shopping, have a drink or some tapas and people watching.

we stayed here. a beautiful street where we stayed when i visit Barcelona in may.we stayed NeXT to la pedrera and tube stop just 5 min walk also only 15 min walk Down to start of La Rambla.excellent.if you like luxery shops and shopping THIS is the street for you.Eldorado for shopping beautiful and clean street.

Lovely place for a gentle stroll!. Walking along this wide street is better than being at Las Ramblas that is just packed with tourists. It doesn't feel so overcrowded because of its size. The buildings especially the Art Noveau ones are great sight for those who love architecture. Two of Gaudi's masterpieces are in Passeig de Gracia and if you continue walking to Gracia you will find his house Casa Vicens that's currently being restored.
SHopping street. if you want to go shopping , then this is your street, it has all the famous brands and it is aclose to one of Gaudi's building you can also visit it on your walk

Best shopping in Europe. You spend a lot, you get back a lot at the airport with the tax-free program that Spain offers. Pretty much all the most famous shops you would want. So many great restaurants and landmarks. You pretty much walk around for a couple of hours and just enjoy the sites and sounds of beautiful Barcelona here.

Famous shopping street in Barcelona. here you can find almost all famous high-fashion brands, like Gucci, D&G, Chanel and so on. closer to Plaza catalunya cheaper brands - Stradivarius, H&M, Zara. Also, famous Gaudi architecture - la Pedrera and Casa Battlo can be found here. a must see when in the city!
Shoppers paradise!. Every designer imaginable! Checked out the new Prada store. Biggest one yet. Also loved the Longchamp store right next door.

Shop till you drop!. We were looking for nice leather goods and found everything and more! This is a prime shopping area, very elegant. I don't speak Catalon, but they understood my Spanish and several people had enough English.
Perfect for a stroll. Cafes, restaurants, designer shops and people watching. What more could you ask for? This was a really nice area to walk around.
Great for shopping. Great street with many of the best shops on it. Also one of gaudi's most famous work on this street.
Great stroll . Nice wide sidewalks and upscale shopping make for a relaxing and enjoyable walk. One block off has better bars and restaurants.

Lovely walk!. On our latest stay in Barcelona, my boyfriend and I were lucky enough to walk down here on our way from the hotel to Las Ramblas! Plenty of things to see with the Gaudi buildings and plenty of shops to spend your holiday money or to Window shop in! Beautiful!

Enjoy the walk and take in the atmosphere!. The whole stretch is just above the metro station and you can find a variety of shops, cafes, all sorts of things along this road. There are alot of famous places to eat as well!Other than plaza catalunya, this was where i spent most of my time in barcelona. Explore the neighbourhood at your own pace, you can easily spend 2 full days here!

Great street for shopping!. Had a great day walking along this street enjoying the architecture and some great shopping. Even our 11-year-old son enjoyed the experience, but that could be something to do with the abundance of cool sports stores. Plenty great cafes in and around the area if you get tired with the shopping! Take plenty of money with you if you want to enjoy it to the max!!!

Main shopping street in centre of Barcelona . Passeig de Gracia is the main shopping street in the centre of Barcelona. Here you'll find all the big designer stores alongside cafes and restaurants. More affordable retailers also have a presence here so you don't need to spend a fortune if you're on a budget. If you like shopping Passeig de Gracia is well worth a visit.

Luxury shops, wide footpaths and street. I was lucky my Hostal was located in the middle of this marvellous street. It is also close to La Pedrera and a 15 minute walk to Palau de Musica and Explore Catalunya Tourist Office. An avenue which is very much high end with expensive shops but lots of wonderful Tapas Bars where one can just sit, sip and people watch. Also close to a post office when you've bought too much and need to mail, things home!

Upmarket part of the city, not a passage at all!. More attractive in the evening when lit up the street houses up market international array of shops but also some very interesting architecture. Plenty of street seating to rest and enjoy the atmosphere.

Walking the Passeig de Gracia. I liked this street very much the street itself (Gaudi inspired sidewalks) which is wide and lovely to the shops and restaurants on the street. It is less congested that the Ramblas so I liked walking and shopping here very much. There are larger stores of the designer variety and also many tiny boutiques by Spanish designers.

Beautiful. Very nice to walk around during the day or night. A lot of restaurants and shops in the area. Our hotel was one block away so we were able to enjoy a nice walk after dinner each night. Very busy area, but it felt safe at any time.

Up market street near to all attractions. When I say near I mean 5 to 15 mins walk. Basically walkable to Catalunya Plaza, Las Ramblas, Sagrada Familia, Barcelona church and is where all the luxury boutiques are located ala Hermès, Rolex, Cartier, Chanel, Christian Dior etc. You also have 2 big Gaudi buildings which are the Casa Batllo and the La Predera. Best place to stay, best place to do ur shopping!
Great Barcelona Neighborhood. We walked many neighborhoods in Barcelona. All of them just unique and full of history. This was no different.

Fun stroll down a classic street. Great tapas bars and cafes for people watching, lovely fountains, grand plazas, and fabulous architecture ( including some buildings by Gaudi).
A fun and free way to enjoy Barcelona.

very pretty. one of the prettiest streets of Barcelona. You must see it to grasp the essence of modern Barcelona and see some pretty great architecture. Here it is obvioust that people love their city and are proud of it

Great run of great shops. I'm not normally a shopper on holiday but this stretch was a great run of excellent shops and restaurants, including the Gaudi properties of Casa Batllo and La Pedrera. You could spend a full day here....just bring your wallet!

Great shopping and sightseeing combined. A beautiful street to be able to see amazing architecture such as Casa Battlo and stroll around. The shopping is amazing, with lots of variety of stores, boutiques, and restaurants. Perfect for a casual day of walking
Better Than Average Street. Loved walking up and down this street with the great architecture and lots of restaurants to choose from.
Shopping & eating street in heart of Barcelona. Had come to eat almost every day for lunch while in Barcelona. Wonderful restaurant selling pintxos called Txapela.

Lovely street not over crowded. We stayed just off this street so I am a little bias but it is much better than la rambla. So much to see, clean, not AS busy and overcrowded, full of nice hotels, designer shops and restaurants/cafes.

Love with architecture . If u love history and love works of renowned architects . This is the place to be. Passeig de Garcia has some of the best works on display . U will see some inspiring works of gaudi here besides the many other piece of art. This place also has some high end luxury brand stores close by. The metro is the best way to reach there
Exquisite!. You can take a very nice walk since the beggining of the street until you reach Plaza Catalunya.. you will see all the nice brans located there. Also the Gaudi's houses are there.
Elegant. Another upmarket beautiful locality I. Barcelona with stunning architecture and beautiful buildings with pretty Windows and great iron lattice work. Big broad roads.

the avenue with Casa Batllo and La Pedrera. this very important avenue of Barcelona begins in the Placa de Catalunya and it is on this avenue that Casa Batllo and La Pedrera,the two world famous houses designed and built by Gaudi are located;so to see them we have to walk upwards this avenue from Placa de Catalunya;among others,we can find here a lot of boutiques of world famous brands and five star hotels;I even discovered the very famous Manolo Blahnik shoe brand,by the way,which can't be seen in every city and at every street corner...there are naturally lots of street cafes and restaurants with outdoor tables: when coming from Placa de Catalunya,we arrive first at Casa Batllo,which is on the left side and then,further up the avenue,on the right side,at a street corner we arrive at la Pedrera;
High-End High Street in Barcelona. Beautiful avenue for a stroll. Great architecture and wonderful shopping. Passeig de Gracia has it all.

High end shopping in Barcelona. Do you fancy D&G, Versace, Chanel, ... this is your street. All designers are present , friendly staff, at prices that are not cheap of course, but are better than London or Paris.

Luxe Shopping. Very nice up here. It's still very touristy, but a cut above Las Ramblas. Great for some luxury shopping. Take chance to explore the back streets, as there are some fantastic cafes a block or two either side of the main drag.

The Beautiful People. Main shopping area, very exclusive, several designer shops and top hotels including my favourite the 5* Majestic. Very expensive but worth it. Passeig de Gracia also see the restaurant Divinus, quality food, very efficient and great staff. A must visit.

Oh my!. We rented an apartment on Passeig de Gracia through 'air bnb'. You cannot go wrong being in this location. Lots of food and shopping. However, I was disappointed in the stores around town. It was just like shopping at home. All big brand names we see in Chicago, NYC, Scottsdale, or LA. A few odds and ends but not many. Hard Rock Cafe is in this area as well as many Starbucks, McDonalds, KFC, Duncan Donuts, Burger King, etc. If you want local merchandise, there is a little travel across town. Pretty ruff looking neighborhoods but some beautiful workmanship. Beware...hard to find AUTHENTIC fans & shawls. One must go to El Corte Ingles department store for the REAL thing. None-the-less, we have been loving every minute!!!
Excellent place to stroll!. This elegant avenue is lined with myriad shops and restaurants. It's well-lit in the evening, making it a very safe and comfortable place to walk and enjoy the ambiance.

Beautiful walking mile. We started off from the subway station and just walked along the lively road. Casa Battló and Casa mila are located there. Also there are many stores which makes it a perfect combo of sightseeing and shopping!
Great Avenue. A grand avenue with shops and restaurants which is not as busy as Las Ramblas. Still busy, but more space to breath. Very ornate lamp posts.
Great shopping. Great shopping and a wonderful walk along a beautiful Boulevard in Barcelona. Plenty of restaurants and coffee shops too. We will be back!

Lovely street and atmosphere with amazing shops. Have to say didn't dare browse in many as the doormen were a bit intimidating nevertheless the ambience was bustling but not too busy. There were some lovely restaurants and cafes where you could relax and soak up the atmosphere. Orange and green buses can be caught here too though beware to get the tickets in advance from your hotel.

This magic word - Shopping. Great place for shopping.
You can find all boutiques and mass market shops. From H&M to Prada & Versace.
I believe each city visitor has been there!

Gaudi designed buildings. A stroll down this road is a must if you would like to view examples of Gaudi designed buildings. It is possible to go inside but it is pricey and you may need to book ahead. The exterior of the buildings are very different and interesting. The wide road means you can fet a food view from a distance before crossing to get a closer look. Well worth a stroll.
Chic and Upscale. Stay here or Born district. Chic and high end shopping with great food. Good shopping. Gaudi creations in the center.

Favourite!. Passeig de Gracia is one of the best stretches for retail therapy. We loved it! It offers really vast variety from the really economical to luxury shopping. You won't get enough of this place even if you have 3 full days there I'm not kidding Its one of my favourite retail belts having been to a couple of European countries. I dare to declare that Passeig de Gracia is officially my favourite!

Walked it all. I have decided to walk this entire street after reading some review of how many things one can find here starting from attractions and even shopping shops. Moreover, it is easy accessible to go there via the metro.

Main thoroughfare from city-centre to major sights. This wide avenue offers retail therapy, lovely bookstores, picturesque cafes with al fresco seating, tapas bars (maybe not the best in terms of food quality but appealing to the average tourist); AND access to lovely destinations such as Casa Battlo and Sagrada Familia (albeit quite a walk). This is a boon to direction-challenged adventurers like myself:)
Shopping, beautiful Avenida. Just off the Metro , get a 10 trip pass for the buses and trains. Good shopping area, restaurants and bars not far from La Rambla.
Shopping. If you want to shop this is where all the shops are. Again must admit the sidewalks are huge and very child friendly if you have a pram and plenty of shade and benches to relax.

A Grand Boulevard. The grand boulevard of Barcelona - a busy thoroughfare lined with top retailers and a few small restaurants. Best bet is to take a side street if you are looking for serious food. Walking down the street towards the water, the boulevard will connect with Las Ramblas at Plaza De Cataluna. Along the way, you will pass 2 of Gaudi's masterpieces as well as a number of other architecturally interesting buildings. A fun, safe and interesting place to stroll with great people-watching!
Great stores. Loved walking up and down this street. Stores range from high end to mid price. It's a tree lined beautiful street with shops be tapas restaurants.

Shopping area. Full of the usual high quality brands and affluent hotels as well as some of Gaudi's amazing designsEasy to get to on the metro crammed with bars, restaurants and cafes as well as fountains and squares.

A lovely central avenue. This is a lovely street which includes the Gaudi buildings Casa Batllo and La Pedrera.It also has many other stylish historical buildings which give an idea of the city's past.

Designer goods street. This is for you if you are into branded luxury goods. The tax refund scheme in Barcelona is the biggest in all Europe. But..... The brands is not that much, some luxury brands are not here as well as the collection is not as wide selection as Paris or Milan

Belo passeio (Nice walking). Caminhar pela Passeig de Gracia é muito legal! A avenida é linda e também bastante luxuosa. Duas paradas obrigatórias: Plaça de Catalunya e Hard Rock Cafe. Pra quem gosta de compras, tem desde roupas, Apple Store, etc... Pura diversão!(Walking through Passeig de Gracia is very cool! The avenue is very beautiful and luxurious too. Two obligatory stops: Plaça de Catalunya e Hard Rock Cafe. And for those who like shopping, there are many stores, from clothing to Apple Store, etc... Pure fun!)

Great shopping and Gaudi's buildings there. Wide streets and sidewalks, lots of shopping, got to see both Gaudi's buildings, a nice place to walk. Found a great tapas place off one of the side streets. Our hotel was less than 15 mins. from PdG. Barcelona is a very nice city to visit.

Shop to drop. I did not but good spot to grab a hop on off bus or tickets. Restaurants to the side. Wide Street with entry to Ramblas, if you must! Access to Gaudi homes too. Or stroll to main square. Wander!

Shop Till You Drop. This is Barcelona's main shopping street where you can shop from Apple to Zara... with H&M or Hermes and most brands to suit your budget in between. It's an elegantly spacious, boulevard...where even the paving stones are beautiful....that offers a welcome respite from the horrors of Las Ramblas and a great day of shopping. It's studded with street furniture to rest your Manolos and a typically Bareclona selection of bars, cafes and restaurants to refuel before your next shopping frenzy. Shopping apart, it's also where you'll find the astonishingly bonkers Casa Batlló and Casa Amatller. The latter is one of the aforementioned fuel stops with a pleaseant garden out the back and a little shop offering a tempting array of beautifully packaged chocolates.....just to make sure yiu can't squeeze into those size zero jeans you were eyeing up along the road.....

Champs Elysées of Barcelona. Our boutique Hotel 62 is on Passeig de Gracia - very conveniently. The big name stores like Chanel and Louis Vuitton are here and some tawdry tourist cafes and restaurants but it is the tree lined side streets leading off that provide little cafés and restaurants, shoe and clothing boutiques where one finds unique and interesting items.

Shopping with some Sights. This is the equivalent of Oxford Street or Orchard Road depending on your part of the world. The famous name brands are all here and at the moment the pound is strong and good value. However, whilst walking the street it's also possible to see some cultural sights ending at the heartbeat of Barcelona - Cataluna Place.
Luxury all the way. One of the luxury streets of Barcelona, all the designer brand shops with nice cafes and restaurants and of course thousands of people walking :)

City's most celebrated pieces of architecture. Nice posh neighborhood a safe place to be. Here you can find nice shopping stores all the big brands are here and also visit symbolic buildings such as casa mila and casa batillo.

Wonderful shtreet for window shopping. Ty walking up the left-hand side of Passeig de Gracia from Placa Catalan as when you walk back down the other side you can finish at the fabulous Restaurant/Tapas Bar ''El Nationale''. The design work, lighting and general feel of this historic building is truly breathtaking.All Along Psg Gracia there are a whole range of designer clothing shops, Antiques, Historic buildings, like La Pedrera, Battlo, etc. Just ruinnig parallel to Gracia is the ramblas Cataluna which is also worth a walk as the sdhops are smaller and more individual. Also this ramblas you can walk down the centre and onluy have to worry about the cross streets as it is traffic free.
Best Center in Europe. It is by far the best centre in European city. Here you will find good place to dine, fantastic bars and great shopping place

Must see !. Like all the best-known streets around world's big cities, this is where you can go shopping and eating in nice places, and even visit symbolic buildings (casa mila, casa batillo) while having a nice walk in the heart of Barcelona
Shopping it is. If you came to Barcelona for shopping you shouldn't miss Passeig de Garcia. All the big brands are here with the best offer.Relax in the coffee shops for a break between shops.

The best part of town. The best part of Barcelona. 15 minute walk to Sagrande Familliav 10 minute to Plaza Catalunya and Las Ramblas and close by to Casa Battlo. Perfect for all of the best parts of the city.

Beautiful street! . Passeig de Gracia is the perfect place to take a stroll, it has everything you can ask for- high end shopping, cafes, tapas bars, monuments like the Casa Batllo and La Pedrera and amazing architecture!

A nice high-end area to explore. Lots going on, on this street and the surrounding area. Some is typical high end stores, but nice sidewalk cafes (pretty touristy, but great people-watching) and some local (high end) shops. Worth a walk.

Shops sights and restaurants - well worth visiting.. A busy street with atmosphere. Plenty of high quality shops (bring your credit cards), many restaurants of varying quality and price, plus Gaudi's architecture.

Upmarket after the overwhelming bustle of La Ramble. An elegant boulevard with stylish shops, bars and restaurants.Well worth a visit should you yearn for an alternative to the tackiness of over-hyped La Ramblas
Monumental building. Dominant building catching the eye every time you passing by, but not by beeing surprisingly ugly like others Barcelona famous buildings 😃

Beautiful street for a stroll. Passeig de Gracia is a wonder for the eyes. Unique architecture, stately residences, high-end boutiques, cafes and tapas bars. There's something for everyone here and you can easily pass several hours along this beautiful street.

Location Location Location. Stayed here during my visit for two weeks. So very convenient to everything. The surrounding neighborhood has great restaurants and is just a nice place to walk around. Big name stores are in the area as well if you have to shop.

A nice stroll . It was a nice walk, beautiful street with beautiful architecture. The Zara flagship store is here and is great for those looking to shop.
It starts or end at Plaza Catalunya.
Beautiful. A great walk. Wonderful sites so easy to get around clean safe and locals are so kind. Barcelona is a real gem. Web stories are outdated. Nothing was accurate. This is a great city

In My Opnion, a Better Place To Spend Time than Las Ramblas. A walk down Passeig de Gracia will reward you with excellent people watching, excellent Gaudi sightings from street level, and interesting spots to eat and drink--as well as truly high-end shopping if that's your aim. For the tapas novice, Txapela, just after you begin your stroll from Placa Catalunya (on the right hand side) or farther along as you continue to stroll (also on the right hand side), is a good place to start. You'll be given a paper folder with pictures of 51 tapas (each about 2,00 euros) and listing the ingredients. For those who prefer to know what they are eating, this popular stop is an excellent place to begin. The atmosphere is lively and the people are friendly. As you proceed down the street, you'll see the Block of Discord on the left side of the avenue--you'll recognize it, never fear--and a few blocks farther on, you'll find La Pedrera, a UNESCO World Heritage site. The avenue has many cafes, most with sidewalk seating, at all price levels--including a MacDonalds.  It's quite simply a delightful avenue to explore.
Luxury is the name. Like the localities call it "5th avenue" of Barcelona, you can find all major brands here. Find a place to go to the shopping outlet village too from here.
Only nice.No comparison wtih Champs Elysées and others.. Obviously has its charm, but it is a wide avenue with famous stores as you can see in many cities in Europe.
Nice buildings, shops and walk way.. Very elegant boulevard, with fantastic buildings and expansive shops. There are many people, but is very confortable to walk.

Barcelona's Champs-Élysées. A beautiful tree lined avenue that features some of the most celebrated and recognisable architecture in Barcelona such as Gaudi's Casa Batlló and Casa Mila as well as a number of other "modenista" townhouses and hotels. Great display of city planning and architecture spoiled by outrageously expensive brand-name shops that line the avenue. Despite the shopping, highly recommended
Many shops and bars. This is a great street to walk down on route to Placa de Catalunya. There are many shops and bars, and it is a must to walk down.

Street for designer shopping!. This street has impressive architecture, including Gaudi's magnificent Casa Batllo. It also offers great designer brand shopping, cafes and restaurants. This is the "5th Avenue" of Barcelona.
Shop till you drop. Stores galore - from H&M and Bershka to Prada, Adidas and Nike to Louis Vuitton, it has it all, packed in beautiful, unique, photogenic architecture. Best of both worlds

The rodeo drive, champs d lycees,Oxford st of Barcelona.. Upscale shops,(Gucci,Louis Vuitton,Montblanc etc). Nice hotels casa fuster and hotel majestic. And a metro and rodailes station which will connect to almost everywhere in area.

Elegant Street. Clearly one of the top streets in Barcelona, with many high-end shops and elegant buildings. It leads into the central Placa de Catalunya and is close to many other of the main streets you are likely to want to visit as well as being near to a couple of Gaudi designed buildings (a must see!). It is a wide boulevard, giving both people and vehicles a reasonable opportunity to get around without bumping into each other. As with most parts of the city we visited, we found it very pedestrian friendly with plenty of crossing points and with good time allowed to cross the wide streets, so that you didn't have to be Usaine Bolt to get across before the lights changed!
Expensive shopping street. If you want to make your wife happy, then don't forget to shop here in stores like Hermes, Chanel, Christian Dior, Yves Saint Laurent, and.... and ....
Great street. This is the street to walk along in Barcelona. Everything seems to be here or radiate from here. Great buildings, restaurants and tour buses all are here.
At the centre!. Catalonia square is at the top of Las Ramblas lots of well known shops, eating places all around, good transport links and central location.

Not to be missed. We enjoyed walking down here, lots of bars and restaurants, the perfect place to sit for lunch and people spot. Just be careful when you sit down for a drink as you can get a large filled baguette for 5 euros but what they don't tell you is that your drink will cost you double that just because of where you are so be sure to ask.
street art. If you like buildings this street is a must. It is amazing to consider the buildings. Very qwerty wonderful.

Rodeo Drive of Barcelona. Very nice area to walk and window shop all the high end stores. Much nicer than Las Ramblas, but not really representative to the Spanish culture. If you looking for Cartier or designer merchandise, then this is the place. Also two Gaudi buildings on this end of town to check out. You can find the almost identical street in all major cities.

Good for browsing. The shops on this street are too pricey for my taste, but it is a wonderful place to stroll and people watch. We were staying just a 2 minute walk off Passeig de Gracia and came over there many times to stroll and or get a bite to eat. There are many nice, reasonable restaurants on this strip. Two words of caution though, first many restaurants charge an upcharge if you sit in their patio section and second, because of the high end of this area it is a magnet for pickpockets etc. Be cautious, even though it is an upscale area. We saw two crimes committed on this street in our first two hours in Barcelona.
A pleasant place to stroll. Full of high end stores but a pleasant place to have a stroll or linger in a tapas bar outside to people-watch

Glorious. This is one of the most -- if not THE most -- pleasant walking streets in the world. The low scale -- most buildings are no more the 8 stories high -- and super-wide sidewalks make for perfect strolling with dozens of tapas café along the route. You may or may not care for the overpriced shops -- Tiffany, Chanel, Bulgari, blah blah blah -- but the architecture reveals one exquisite surprise after another. And a huge plus: the crowds are friendly, polite while crime is very low; never did we have even an instant of uneasiness.
Good looking. Interesting looking buildings, including Gaudi designed, but, for my taste, full of too many high end stores and expensive bars/restairaunts
great shopping experience. you can find almost every brand you want to visit here. the price is good, so much better than it is in China, and the tax rate is really nice.
Got there just as the shops closed. Lovely avenue to amble along, unfortunately the shops closed as we arrived for their siesta but just ambling and having a coffee was nice
Lovely walk, eating and shopping. This street is amazing. You can spend half day just along, eating and shopping from the luxurious brands :) we really enjoyed it

Luxury and modern comfort. Lot of luxury boutiques on this very chic avenida...Also lot of beautiful people and even some of the very best work of Gaudi...A quality melting pot in a classy presentation...An experience not to be missed when in Barcelona

Gorgeous street. This is a bit of a 'wow' of a street if you like architecture - Gaudi buildings (which you have to queue and pay to visit), other gothic and more modern ones. It's wide and spacious, green with lots of trees and very busy with cars seemingly everywhere, tourists and locals and tourist buses.Lots of areas to shop and eat.Great to spend time wandering

Unusual and Very Cool Benches, Great Architecture, Shopping and Tourists.. Yes, you'll see a lot of tourists and a lot of shops, the prices are high for Barcelona, but maybe not for other places in Europe. Go in the morning and see the buildings before everyone gets there. Check out the Casa Milà, Casa Batlló and more. Pay attention to the benches and the street lights.

Alone for the ladies. Beautiful wide street with all the famous stores and more, with shaded seating around, pop down one of the side streets for a cool drink or a light lunch or alternatively if your flush one of the restaurants on the main drag.
Good shopping belt. Good shopping, lots of shops. Went again on a Sunday and all shops were closed. Was visiting London at same time and found the luxury goods here slightly cheaper than London.
Great street!. Lovely street. Get lost in the side streets and see how many cute cafes, shops and restaurants you can find...Barcelona is a place for beach and city lovers alike.
Excellent famous shopping street. Excellent famous shopping streetThe surroundings are also very good for shoppingSome of the shops are very expensive

Can't avoid it. A very crowded shopping street but you have to go there to go to Casa Mila and Casa Battlo. Absolutely full of tourists and tour groups and I am told pick pockets but we had no problems, just be careful. All the big Spanish brands are represented and are really no more expensive than anywhere else. I wouldn't eat or drink anywhere along the street however as there you will really be "pick pocketed" by the bill.
Cosmopolitan and chic. Do you feel like shopping? Do you can afford it? walk around, look, desire, shop, books, clothes, accesories... just ramble around.

Fancy stores & grand architecture/streets. This area reminded me of Paris with the grand, fabulous buildings & fancy stores. Check out Casa Battló while in the area, and Casa Milà. There are a lot of good places to eat just east or west of here, but you will pay a premium to eat on this street.

Modernista treasures. Strolling down Passeig de Gracia is a wonderful opportunity to see modernista treasuries up and down the street. Casa Battlo, Casa Lleo I Morera, and La Padrera are just the highlights of this street. These great sights aren't the only highlights of these streets. Many other buildings along this route are visually appealing.

The Rodeo Drive/5th Avenue of Barcelona - with Gaudi thrown in..... This is one of the main roads in Barcelona - home to multitude of designer shops, glorious architecture - including Gaudi's Casa Batllo and Pedrera - and more tourists than you can shake a big stick at!!! Get there early, before the shops open, when it is peaceful and nice - wait until the shops/cafes/restaurants are open and you'll be vexed as you try to look up to admire the architecture and have people running into you!!! I did not shop here or dine here - but enjoyed my early morning ambles....

Look up! Look Down!. This is real Barcelona. The wonderful houses along this street -- Casa Batllo, Casa Pedrera to name two you can visit -- show how the wealthy lived during Barcelona's golden years. This is still a wonderful street to wander on.

One of the nicest streets in barcelona. Well if u like international Brand’s shopping, it's here! For me, the prices are lower than where I come from and with the additional VAT refund, it's just too irresistible! And being adjacent to la ramblas..makes it even more one of the must be places in bcn!
We love Barcelona. Great place for shopping, eating and people watching a memorable have lots of great arquitecture features.

A nice Avenue. Passeig de Gracia is a street filled with high end brands, some restaurants and some architecturally inclined buildings. When we visited, the weather was perfect. It Was sunny and cool with some wind. A great place to walk around and taste some local spanish tapas in the roadside cafes. Although during peak hour you do have to be careful about your belongings due to pickpockets.

Designer Alley!. A wonderful wide avenue, stretches for miles! Populated by many designer shop but also street cafes where you can watch the world, or people go by. Seemed to get longer every time we walked it!
a replicate of big shopping streets in europe. beautiful shops ,one along the other expose their expensive article at the Champs Elisée de paris,but lacks international flair a bit!

Amazing area to shop. So beautiful, the sun was shining, this street has it all, 'designer shops', nice restaurants and cafes, there are buildings by Gaudi, the Pedrera and the Casa Batillo, amazing architecture, this tree lined avenue is just a must visit
Elegant shoping. The best place for elegant shoping. You must visit Apple shop and next walking all street with the best world brands shops. Don't forget about Gaudi's houses!
Passeig de Gracia. Toured around this and it is gigantic....Not sure about the inside we were on the move so much didn't have time to enter in.

Garcia is designer shopping heaven - the Passeig is an interior mall with some great shops. Think of a designer label and they will have a shop on Gracia. The Passeig is a small mall in the centre with some interesting mid range shops. Certainly worth a visit if you are there but not a destination in its own right.

5 th Avenue of Barcelona. A grand boulevard lined with luxury stores in beautiful buildings. Stroll up the hill and imagine this elegant area 100 years ago. The block of discord with three modernista houses is on the left and La Pedrera is a few blocks further on the right. Get tickets online before. Lines are long.
Good - average shopping visit. I wasn't terribly impressed but it is a nice stroll and some of the shops are much cheaper than say NYC.

Shoppers delight. A really great street full of all the best clothing and jewelry brand
Not the cheapest avenue to visit but if you are into having a good shopping day then this is the place to be
Perfect!. I must say, this is my absolutely favorite place in Barcelona, not just for the boutiques, or the several restaurants, it's because their lovely and creative architecture
Shopping and lots to see. Its a very busy part of Barcelona, often you pass through here to change trains, lots of shops including the Apple store!

Passengers de Gracia. Wonderful . We ate in Gaudim for a really sumptuous dinner.
It was enjoyed by everyone and a great place to spend all your remaining eoros

World Class. Up there with the world's top thoroughfares. It has extra wide tree-lined footpaths so it caters for pedestrians who want to stroll & look at the many upmarket shops. Dotted along it are Gaudi's famous residential projects such as La Pedrera the facades of which add to the whole streetscape. As usual for Barcelona it has many cafes & restaurants that people can enjoy sitting at to watch the passing parade. On sunny day you feel alive walking down Passeig de Gracia with the many other lucky people.
Designer label shopping. Your designer label shopping area with its typical stores and expensive gelatos. Great if you're looking for that sort of thing.

Great Street for Walking and Gawking. Our hotel was right on the Passeig and we found that this street was wonderful for walking. There are buildings by Gaudi and Domenech i Fontaner to look at as well as upscale shops and all sorts of restaurants.
Great place . Great place to shop, a lot of variety. The place was full of people shopping. You can seat on a bench and people watch for hours.

The fancy area of town. This is a street that runs between Diagonal Street and the Catalunya Square. It is lined with the more expensive shops, like Hugo Boss, Armani, and other designer stores, as well as some of the finer dining restaurants. Two of Gaudi's buildings are situated along the street, the Pedrera and Casa Batillo, both amazing architectural wonders. You can take tours inside.
superb . the best shopping around Barcelona is in this street looks like the Champs élysées open till 9 pm n has lots of things to do museum cafè restaurant n shopping

A must see street in Barcelona. A beautiful, up market and clean very long street of beauty and high brands. We didnt shop there, we just adored the elegant facades, the laid back splendour of the shop fronts and the wealth of things to window shop and savour from one end to the other.
Best place for shopping in Spain.. Long avenue with a lot of brand name shops. Mostly open until 10:00pm. It's the best place for shopping in Spain. But may closed on Sunday.
Rodeo Drive of Barcelona . We walked on this road to and from La Pedrata. We didn't stop to buy anything, though, at the upscale stores. The area is very clean and litter-free.

Nice to wander. This street is directly parallel to the start of las ramblas in placa catalunya. This street reminds me of oxford street but is way more spacious and there was no problem of having to push past people.The street is filled with all types of shops with everyday brands aswell as the luxury ones. There are plenty of restaurants and cafes with a few metro stations. And of course the street features some of gaudis work like la predrera, casa battlo and casa mila. It is a great street to combine shopping aswell as culture and sightseeing.

Favorite location. My hotel is across the street on Gran Via and Paseo. Best location. One block from Plaza Cataluña. Easy to catch trains and buses. Great shopping on that street and Rambla Cataluña which runs parallel to it.

Littered with beautiful architecture. The block of discord is a must but also Casa Mila further up the street. Some fab places to eat and transport links. It makes a nice stroll. Casa Battlo is the best for me.
Parks. Parks on the streets for kids, laid back and much quieter than Les rambles. Shops are varied and there are plenty of metro stops along the way and things to look at.
Great stroll. Nice boulevard with top shopping. Need to walk it and see the area. Modern, like NY's 5th avenue. It is long but let's you learn the city.

You simply can't avoid it. If you are in Barcelona, you simply can't avoid this avenue. There are luxury brands shops, restaurants and cafes there and the avenue is in the top centre of one of the most touristic cities in the world. Sure you will be there :)
Best,
Artur

Shopping. A wide street so away from traffic with wide pavement so no pushing through crowds. Excellent range of shops Gucci to pharmacy for all your needs or just window shop. Remember to look up so not to miss the architecture.

Forget Las Ramblas, this is where you should go shopping. I will whisper this for fear of offending. I really don't like Las Ramblas. It is very touristy and busy. Yet just across the lovely Playa Catalunya is the wonderful Passeig de Gracia, which is Barcelona's version of say, Regents Street (it is classier than Oxford Street and much wider and grander than Bond Street).It is a lovely place to shop with a good range of stores from upscale brands and high end jewellers through to the normal chains. It also has a particularly nice Zara Home. Also on Passeig de Gracia are two of Gaudi's masterpieces: Casa Batillo and Casa Mila. Both are worth viewing. If you do plan to visit, consider booking tickets in advance as there are often long lines outside Casa Batillo in particular.Also, take a moment to look at the pavement. The tile design is by Gaudi. It was apparently originally designed as an interior tile for Casa Batillo, but used in Casa Mila. The design was inverted (for wear) and laid as pavement in 1997. Another little touch that adds to the class of the place.

amazing passage, breathtaking buildings, alot to see!. one of the better places i like to go while im in barcelona.yes. a bit pricey, but alot of options.boutiques, food, clothing, pretty much everything.

Must see. Nice main street for shopping. Many shops to visit and the fountain is also a good sight. It is lit up after dark. There is a place where you can buy grains and feed the pigeons in the center just besides the fountain, especially for chirldren.

The "Champs Elysees" of Barcelona. Starts from Placa Catalunya and reminds a lot of the famous French Champs Elysees boulevard in Paris. Along with Gaudi's Casa Batllo and Casa Mila, one can find the most popular expensive shops - Chanel, Jimmy Choo, Gucci etc.

Wonderful stroll with interesting attractions. Passeig de Gracia offers visitors to Barcelona a taste of upscale living. High-end shopping opportunities are coupled with everyday vendors, such as local pharmacies and cafes. This strip is similar to Rodeo Drive or the Champs Elysees, with stores such as Louis Vuitton, Tiffany, Michael Kors, Hugo Boss, and many more. It is dotted with local eateries and Gaudi architecture, among other architectural oddities.Staying on Passeig de Gracia is quite pricey, but the service is much higher than in other areas of the city.It makes for a nice half-day of walking and is accessible from numerous train stops. There are also plenty of taxis in the area due to the host of luxury hotels.
Best street in Barcelona!. Explore one of the best streets in Barcelona. Stop at one of the outdoor cafes for a bite to eat or a drink. Browse through the shops and have fun.
A point of convince. Passengers de Gracia is a point of convinient travel all around the Barcelona .Gaudi park can be easily reached from Passeing de Gracia .Bus service also available .A busy place

Beutiful walk. We walked along the Passeig de Gracia, you can see a lot interesting buildings some made by Gaudi. A lot of nice stores and a lot of very nice places to sit and eat or drink some great Sangria.

Shopping Capital of Barcelona . Its the shopping capital of Barcelona. From high end shops, to local labels. Many restaurants, bars and cafes. The atmosphere is very lively and vibrant. Perfect place to stroll, window shopping or to just people watching.

The Champs Elysees of Barcelona.. Each central city has its high street or its mainstreet or avenue(s). This avenue has nothing to envy from its more famous sisters: wonderful and historic buildings,including two houses conceived and built by the great architect Gaudi (Casa Batllo and La Pedrera) and shops representing all the leading brands (but shopping is not compulsery) .Walking here is not only a pleasure,it is a must too.
Lovely boulevard for a stroll. Lots of high end stores for windowshopping .Lots of bars and restaurants. Very busy but clean and bright. Highly recommended for people watching.
Great for shopping, walking, museums. Very nice street with Shops and museums, not to be missed either :) Very very crowded. I bought a wonderful purse from Desigual here :D hehe, my fav
Great place for shopping. This street is very lively and has a lot of great high end shops. The services at the high end shops are decent. I like how they don't follow you around.

Make time to walk it. Seems to remind visitors of other spectacular streets - the Champs Élysées, 5th Avenue etc.Has two of Gaudi's architectural masterpieces - La Pedrera and Casa Batllo.The side alleys present a challenge for the unwary - bicycles riding the wrong way, cars etc.

Barcelona's Rodeo Drive. This is a beautiful grand street with Gaudi buildings and spacious sidewalks (some of the cement has Gaudi designs). The major international shops are in evidence here. It's a nice stroll during day or evening - Casa Battlo is lit up at night. Different atmosphere from Las Ramblas which seems older b/c of the smaller side streets. I didn't buy anything here but did enjoy a stroll in the evening while coming back from the museum - simply stopped at Diagonal and walked about 1.5km to my hotel on the waterfront along this street and then las Ramblas.
Family travel in December. Road is so well lit and has so many fun restaurants, shopd that you can easily spend a few hours on it.

Part of the city tour but went back because of the activities there and nearby.. There is a lot going on here design wise and art wise. Gaudi architecture is much in evidence and the overall atmosphere of las Ramblas is exciting. Not to be missed

Barcelona's Fifth Avenue. The first two nights we stayed near here and loved strolling around by day and by night. The streets are nice and side and side corners are designed to let light in. The section of the city features many upscale shops, nice restaurants, amazing buildings (a few by Gaudi) and is parallel to the Rambla Catalunya which is another great place to walk around. This is the most spectacular part of the "new" town (as opposed to the older gothic quarter)
nice architecture. excellent for a stroll at any time of the year! Restaurants and shops ok... better if you search on the side streets

Spain's equivalent to New York's 5th Avenue. Lovely neighborhood for shopping and eating. High end department stores, boutique shops, designer name-brand stores and expensive but excellent eateries.Also home to La Pedrera and Casa Battlo, two Guadi residences worth visiting.

The most beautiful street of Barcelona!. Luxurious shops, beautiful buildings and gorgeous lamp posts. We walked this street every day to get to and from our apartment. Just gorgeous! There are some great apartments, part of hotels on that street as well.
great street. A great street full of hotels, cafe's and shops which will satisfy shopping lovers, great experience
Love this wide street. One of the main central roads in Barcelona. Wide street and wide pavements good for walking, interesting shops, elegant boutiques and restaurants.
A huge avenue. There are a lot of nice buildings...some Gaudi's masterpieces like LA Pedrera or Casa Batllo...Then ideal for shopping!!
Champs de Elysse of Barcelona. It looks like Champs De Elysse of Paris where wide avenue with nice buildings both sides and all high end brands stores there

2 of Gaudi's masterpieces are on Passeig de Gracia. Even if you're not a shopping addict, Passeig de Gracia remains a must see. First because it is very pleasant to walk there on a sunny day. Second, if you go to Barcelona, La Pedrera and Casa Batlo are there and you can't miss them, a bit expensive to visit, but worth every cent.

Majestic hotel. Excellent location. Services from check - in through check - out is very good. Pricey room rates. Big variety of breakfast which was not in included in our room rate but you can join in at crazy Euro 37.00/person.
If you are looking for a downtown stay then then look no further!

The heart of Barcelona. Passeig de Gracia is a main thoroughfare - very busy both for traffic and pedestrians. There are some lovely buildings on both sides if you take the time to look up. There is a good vibe and lots of outdoor cafes - but be careful as they can be very expensive with a cup of coffee costing more than double what it would in less prominent locations.

window shopping. lined with designer stores this is a must for the fashion conscious. cafes and restaurants can charge big prices here so be careful if you are on a budget. costs more to sit on terrace having your coffee.

A lovely stroll on a sunny day. This is a great place to stroll and appreciate the beauty of Barcelona. The buildings are wonderful, specially the Block of Discord which contains the fantastic buildings of the Modernisme period.
Nice street, lots of brand name department stores. It is a nice street, but there are others nice streets. Two of Gaude's masterpieces are on this road as well as a lot of designer labels.

Rich Person shopping street. Walked down this street just to have a look at how the other half live. Lots of fancy (expensive) shopping on this street for the people that like to have "badges" on their clothing. Not really my thing - but still quite a nice walk down a wide tree-lined thoroughfare. The street runs down to the Plaza de Catalunya - which is the top of La Rambla - so joins up quite nicely with the most famous area of Barcelona. 3 Gaudi designed houses can be found on this street if Gaudi is your thing.
Shpping's heaven. Passeig De Gracia is the best open air shopping venue in Barcelona.The streets are large and you don't feel like it's too crowded.
Shopping. Shopping streetA lot of expensive shops.It's always full. People of all countries.If you want spend money, it's perfect
top shops and designer gear if you can afford it.. All the top stuff and designer gear is here kept myself to the adidas shop for sports gear but everything is here.
A must see street. Walk up and down both sides and make sure you keep looking up, can't believe how many beautiful buildings there are on one street.

beautiful thoroughfare, lovely for strolling. This is an elegant and wide street with plenty of top-level shops and eateries, as well as several of the key Gaudi residences, namely La Pedrera and Casa Batllo. We only stopped to view the outsides of these but would like to go in on another trip...Nice road for a stroll down to Placa Catalunya and beyond (we were making our way back to our hotel on Via Laietana).

Shoppers dream. I love love love this area. Not only are there shops galore (from high end to Gucci, Cartier) to normal (like Zara) to strictly European (Desigual, Mango), there are also countless eateries, cafes, and places to sip sangria. Also, you can enjoy this area on a nice day if you'd like to spend no euro at all..it's just beautiful. The architecture, the flowers & trees, the fountains..it's definitely worth a trip! There's a metro stop here, but, as with everything Barcelona, I say WALK & take it all in.
Super!. Large pavements where to walk, Nice buildings to look at, good shop sur, two Gaudi museums, this avenue is a must!)
Keep walking on this road and you'll see some of the great attactions. It's in the heart of the city which no one misses. Just walk on this with your friends and family and you'll enjoy a lot.
Nice Walk!!. Very fancy avenue in Barcelona, quite a nice walk including the possibility to see the best buildings created by Gaudi, better in the morning!!

Shopping in Barcelona? why not!!. WIth no doubts walking on this street is like the Champs Elysse of Barcelona, you can find all the top brands of the world and is perfect if you have a good budget to be spent in mind.

Shopping Paradise. The place to be, if you like shopping. The variety is endless, from expensive boutiques and fashionable brands to affordable stores and restaurants. I did not mind walking up and down this strip of shops all day

Beautiful, regal avenue perfect for strolling and shopping. Don't forget the parallel streets to it as they have lovely shops and restaurants too.This main avenue is arguably one of the most important streets in the whole city.Very wide, perfect for walking, cultural visits, cycling, shopping, coffee, dining etc. You could spend hours here and not get bored.It feels very regal and immediately explains the history and wealth if Barcelona. Don't forget to look up at the stunning facades of all the buildings.

Get Lost: Finding Passeig de Gracia By Mistake. We were returning to our hotel from Sagrada Familia and crossed this large street by happenstance. We couldn't believe our luck to " discover" we were upon the campuses Gaudi building. Always as usual, the line was long fo the inside tour. We did find that you can book a tour and no have to stand in line! Next time.
Excellent!. Beautify street with lovely stores!! It is a pleasure to walk by in both sides of the avenue. Very long but nice to walk.Beautiful stores.
shopping galore!. for those you likes shopping above anything else, this is for you.all you need is your travel money, and bingo... you're in. enjoy the adrenalin rush...
Gaudi and Modernism. Great fun just to walk up the street, checking out the Gaudi and other modernism buildings. Not like a lot of city blocks. And when that bores you, you can always shop.

Shopping, Shopping and more Shopping! :). Passeig De Gracia is filled with shops..from high end fashion to little boutique shops! We always come here as there are so many restaurants/cafe's/sites/shops to see! You can easily spend 4-5 hours here as the strip is just endless! :D
Best place to visit.. Wonderful houses, fashion stores, stylish and iconic. Take time to wander down the road, don't eat here - is the most expensive place to eat in Barcelona.
Good for shopping and Tapas. Nice area to stroll and shop. There are so many Tapas restaurants to enjoy after shopping. Worth the time while you are in Barcelona.

one of the streets in the world with the best fashion shopfronts. Walking along this street is a real show of innovative ideas about fashion. All the best fashion brands are present in this street and restaurants offering is very high.
I like to visit especially when it starts to get dark because is the moment when all the shopfronts begin to shine.
Delightful. We loved the shopping and restaurants. The open and relaxed feeling was enjoyed by the many happy tourists.

Local flavor and excellent restaurants. we are staying off Passeig de Gracia in an apartment for a week. There are many small grocery stores, pharmacies and restaurants on every side street. After the hectic pace of the main streets, walking along these streets is a delight and you feel very much at home. Seems very safe as long as you pay attention crossing the street, scooters can go very fast!

Fashion central with a lot of culture. If you are looking for some high end shops to part with some hard earned cash; then this is the street for you with all major bramds represented. If shopping isnt your thing then fear not as there is also a number of architectural sites along here to keep you entertained. We took the metro to Diagonal and then walked all the way down to Placa Catalunya taking in some shops and sites along the way.
Fascinating for a walk along. We really enjoyed our stroll down this road. Some incredible architecture and interesting history on show.
If you like your designer fashion this is the place for you. Basically this place is full of all the major posh shops so if this is for you then enjoy as the choice is massive

Gracefully shopping. This street is famous for its expensive shops and haute couture. Located close to Placa Catalunya it is easy to reach by subway or strolling through the city. You will also find here famous Gaudi architecture.

Lots of history here. Love it every time we visit.. Wonderful architecture, and a tremendous history in this, one of Barcelona's more interesting areas. We love coming here when ever we visit Barcelona.

Great shopping. Nice broad street with interesting architecture including two of Gaudi's famous buildings. Browse in some of the brand name shops and walk up to Hotel Casa Fuster and enjoy a drink, coffee or cake in their historical Cafe Vienes.
a nice stroll. Probably the nicest street in Barcelona. With Goudi's masterpieces and the numerous shops of the best (and most expensive) chains. Benches along the street allow a leisurely stroll.

A must when in Barcelona. No trip to Barcelona can be complete without a stroll along Gracia. This is where you can see some of Gaudi's finest works. From the outside Guadi's inspired buildings are a wonderful sight. You can explore most of them inside too.
Wonderful experience. The most beautiful street in Barcelona. Worth spending several hours just looking at all the wonderful stores. Also, the Gaudy buildings are lovely.
Good walk. Found this street by accident. Walk around looking up and great buildings as well as more upmarket shops

Good Walking Street. Very expensive stores, so unless you have a black AMEX, you probably won't buy. But fun to see the streets, people, architecture, especially since two Gaudi houses are on this street.
Elegant area. Elegant shops, lovely wide boulevard, great cafes, and the gaudi buildings on the same street. Much nicer than La Rambla.
Posh shopping. Plenty of shops to browse and eating places. A large busy avenue with fountains and transport links .

Designer shopping paradise!. If you appreciate beautiful architectural buildings then go,plenty of beautiful shops with a few general mixed in between.Its like London Oxford Street only cleaner and classier.

Typical Luxury Shops. This is a wide boulevard with the major shops you will find in most cities. Since I am from NYC, it wasn't a place I was interested in. If you have been to Manhattan, think of Fifth Avenue. Cartier, Gucci, Hermes, etc. But if you live in a smaller less cosmopolitan area, you'll love it. Me, I prefer the small boutique shops in El Born and Gotic with the Spanish designer clothing I can't get at home!

A luxury shopper's paradise!. Designer shops up/down this street. Louis Vuitton, Chanel, Tiffany, Gucci, Chopard, Armani, Burberry. You name it and it's most likely there. Also on this street are Casa Batllo and La Pedrera. I loved that we lived a block away from this because we went shopping every day we were there.

Very pleasant walking. A great way to spend a few hours by strolling along the Passeig de Gracia. Both La Pedrera and Casa Batllo are located along this really nice wide boulevard. Plenty of food options as well.

Great shops, restaurants and people watching - also Gaudi looking. The block of discord is amazing viewing. We enjoyed waking along this street as we went back to our hotel every night. Lots going on day or night.
Elegant Shopping. This wide boulevard has the most elite shops as well as some wonderful spanish designers. This is for expensive goods.

Major Avenue with designer shops - same as any large city ! . This is a very elegant long Avenue with every designer label you can think of ! Gucci, Prada, Chanel , Jimmy C, Burberry , Mont Blanc etc. Has some lovely buildings on the way. Same as many large city designer streets !

Lovely architecture. It's great to walk along and admire the architecture on a lovely broad avenue. Lots of art nouveau buildings including two gaudi masterpieces. It's very pricey with top fashion names but also has some of the best tapas bars in eixample even if you can't afford the handbags .
great place for shopping and sightseeing. elegant and charming, great for shoping and for peoplewatching. there are a lot of luxury shops and elegant terraces and restaurants

Hustley & Bustley.... If you're visiting the main city streets it would be hard to avoid this area, we visited in December and it was busy with wood huts selling local produce and had a great vibe, the square was busy with groups of friends and families and balloon sellers, it had a really great vibe and was worth a visit for sure.
A busy Strett. Just up from Placa Catalunya this is a broad avenue with a range of shops and bars - it is what it is and not the best location in the city

My first contact with Barcelona. The very first time I got to Barcelona I had to get to Arc de Triumf and my friend decided to get off the Metro at Passeig de Gracia which was a good way off the desired destination, but hell we're in Barcelona, right? (as in we should walk to see the city as much as we can).It was a tiring decision which I will never regret! Paseo de Gracia , from the moment I stepped out of the Metro station with its Casa Batllo and its unique to Barcelona floor tiles and huge bike roads, makes for one of the best first city impressions I have ever had.Walking southwards one can get to the famous Plaza Catalunya after crossing huge roads with enormous impressive buildings and intersections with glowing fountains, straight from Utopia hahaha.It was an experience I will always cherish as the first impression of Barcelona and I believe you should too! At least pay it a visit. It is well worth your time!
Take a walk through the well-heeled city neighborhood. Enjoyed strolling down the avenue after our visit to La Pedrera. Fantastic architecture, along with the expensive shops along the avenue.

Fifth Avenue of Barcelona. All the shops you see on Fifth Avenue in NY, you will find on this long street. Chanel, Gucci, Prada, Adidas, Zara, Longchamps, etc! Plenty of Tapas Restaurants to choose from and hotels. I actually got a place thru AirBnb on Passeig de Gracia. It's all about location location location.

Pleasant walk. Good place to walk and see the architecture. If you want to see inside the more famous buildings book ahead. Shops of course high high end but worth popping in and looking in the lladro shop if you like porcelain

Shopping and houses. The Paseo de Gracia has all the upmarket and luxury shops so dear to a rich shopaholic's heart.It also has the Mandarin Oriental top hotel with its two Michelin starred restaurant "Moments".The main tourist attraction however is the amazing architecture of the Gaudi designed houses on the south side.
Shopping in astounding buildings. Not only full of shops in this street (plus the near ones are full of them too) but also the amaizing building that one can explore there,

Shopping. Lovely wide street with very wide pavements and beautiful shopping for all.It also has some fine architecture so it pays to look up and admire the elegant roof tops and cupolas. There is a famous Gaudi facade here.

Wonderful boulevard. This boulevard was built when planners knew what they were doing, there are the great gems of the known architects along with the combined street lamps and benches by Pere Falqués, the high end shops with eye watering prices, but its the overall ambiance which makes this place worth a visit. Also worth a stroll is the street to the west - Rambla Catalunya and if you have time head up over Diagonal on Passieg de Gracia pass the lovely Casa Fuster Hotel and into C/Gran Gracia and then lose yourself in the lovely neighbourhood of Gracia.

Beautiful. Beautiful Gaudi architecture and lovely warm climate. This street has high end shops, and restaurants.
Unfortunately we noticed the pervasive perfume of Barcelona of sewerage below the ground level, assaulting our nostrils. This was putting us off our food.
A beautiful walk on a pleasant day.. One of Barcelona's great avenues including nice places to visit and great places to eat (on side streets).

Walk and walk. It is Barcelona most glamouros avenue, it’s easy to reach Passeig de Gràcia because it’s very well linked by public transport from almost any point in the city.The Casa Batlló and La Pedrera – Casa Milà are two sights you shouldn’t miss, they are made by the great architect Antoni Gaudí.You have around 1.5 Km of stores(Cartier,Escada,Mont Blanc,Salon TORO.....) ,culture,good food (La Paradeta, La Venotica ... Torres) and Mediterranean lifestyle.

A nice walk for shoppers and architecture lovers.. Our hotel was just a few meters away from Passeig de Gracia in the Eixample district of Barcelona. If you are into shopping, this is where the expensive brands are located. Moreover, there are also remarkable architectural finds, which can be examined and admired in detail, in particular, Gaudi's amazing 'La Pedrera' located on 92 Passeig de Gracia. At the end of Passeig de Gracia, you will come to one of the busiest avenues of Barcelona, Ave. Diagonal, which is also worth looking at, if you have good walking shoes.
Must visit. This is a must visit for anyone in Barcelona. The avenue is lined with trees all around and is a 5 min walk from the La Ramblas
Shopping . Best place for high end brands and shoppibg plus loads of caffes and restaurants... Not to forget le perdera and othe guadi buildings to see while strolling this great street.
elegant and chic. A very nice boulevard to stroll around. It is impeccable and very wide. You do not bump into anybody. Shopping for all kinds of pockets.

Very expensive stores . Very clean, very easy to walk through. Stores are the very elite, although known to be very expensive great prices I'm comparison with other countries. Lots of gaudi sites to see. Very nice restaurants.

Shopping shopping shopping. All the most expensive brands in the world are there. It s just the "Champs Elysées" of Barcelona. But in the same street you can admire that Casa Mila which is something nice for the people keen to see something else than shopping

The best place for "window shopping". The best place to do your "window shopping" :)you can watch all the top brand from prada to gucci to michael kors and pretend you have money to buy somthing there

wonderful shopping. This is a wonderful place to visit or to stay in. It has wonderful shopping with many big brand names in this area. Beautiful tree lined street so as to stay in the cool while walking as Barcelona can be very hot and humid.

TIME FOR TAPAS ?. You are certainly hungry now. But before lunch, walk on Passeig de Gràcia and admire the facades of the "Manzana de la discordia" (apple of discord) where the three most famous modernist architects, Gaudí, Montaner and Cadaflach, argue your Warning.
Passéig de Gracia. Lovely street to walk. It is where upscale boutiques like Chanel and Cartier can be found. Restaurants and iconic buildings of Gaudi and Montaner can be seen.

Shopping. This is the main shopping sherry in Barcelona, brilliant for window shopping. There are also 2 of Gaudi,s buildings on the steer. The subway and train station are there as well. Loads of cafes and restaurants as well. It is the centre and you can get any where n the city from here

Luxus-Shopping in Barcelona!. This is one of the streets in barcelona which have to be visited once. I never bought here anything -the majority of the stors are too expensive and the cheap ones are really overcrowded, but it is interesting to walk down the sreet and watsch the tourists from different countries. Tipp: if you need a bathroom, go to the Burger King (Arago 259) -it is always empty ;)

Nice stroll, a little less touristy than the Ramblas. The Ramblas are totally touristy and this boulevard looks more like "normal" main street. It has some regular shops and functional buildings as oppose to tourist traps. So if you have some time - this definitely a place to go and feel a bit more like a local.

Wonderful to walk along. Shopping or no shopping, Passeid de Gracia is a must visit and must walk along. I went there almost every day I was there and just enjoyed strolling through this wide avenue and the side streets. Wonderful shops too.

Great shopping, walking and people watching. This huge wide Street parallel to Las ramblas runs from the water up quite far beyond diagonal and then becomes a more residential streets. With wide sidewalks and a wide center most of the way it is easy to maneuver, great people watching, wonderful shopping and eating. A core of Barcelona central and fewer pickpocket gypsies and tourists than other places.

Shopoholics . Went walking along this beautiful street once for almost a whole day. Walk in and out of shops and enjoy the architecture. There are both high fashion and regular stores along the sides. We stopped for tapas and cava along the road here and there it was a great day.

Strolling this famous boulevard made us feel like Barcelonans!. Towards the end of our weeks in this beautiful town, we decided to devote an afternoon to a long stroll up this famous boulevard. We bought lovely gifts along the way for our grandchildren and ourselves. The stunning architecture consistently amazed us. The smiling happy faces of the people we encountered along the way did much to reinforce our view of Barcelona as one of the most pleasant cities we've ever encountered.

Elegant shops, a busy square with fountains and wide streets.. Start at the Placa de Catalunya and the huge dept store of El Cortes Ingles, wander around the square, walk up the Passeig de Gracia until you reach Gaudi's Casa Mila building. Lots to see, and so many shops to explore too!

Lovely stroll. This is truly a good street to walk on as one would find a range of fashion from high street right up to the high end of fashion. I visited here during February and the weather was lovely to have a stroll. Look out for the small alleys where there are local Made in Spain fashion/accessories outlets. Worth a visit if you like shopping!

The best shopping in Spain . Barcelona and Paseo de Gracia is very unique for shopping especially when it comes to luxury retail . Streets are spacious , weather is amazing , plenty of restaurants and coffee places make the whole experience very unique . Architecture on the way and fabulous choice from collections makes it all 5*+
Centre of Barcelona. Good place for luxury goods shopping and some food around Eixample. Long street with 2 Gaudi buildings on it.

A great shopping area. The Paseig the Gracia is one of our favorite street. If you love to shop then do not miss the Paseo de Gracia especially after a visit to the Batlo' and Pedrera house.It is a must see street if you visit barcelona

Over priced. Amazing place to be and roam around go look the brands do some window shopping. If u wanna do shopping go to diagonal Mar area there are some shopping centers there with good pricing and all

Nice walk for lovers of Gaudi and shopping. It's the main shopping street for luxury items and you can find Casa Batllo and Casa Mila in a short distance. There are also other architectures of modernismo which are interesting to see. If you are in a hurry, just take a walk from Casa Mila to Casa Batllo and you will feel the beauty of this elegant street.

Shoping and eating . Every city there is one road which is very famouse, here it is gracia All famuse big brands are placed on the street, mean while nice buildings of goudi yoûmay see, very good tapas restaurants are here you may eat

Posh shops and great bar. The expensive shopping street, with all the big fashion names.Look out for el nacional bar down sidestreet around number 24, built in an old car park, now several stylish bars under one roof. We only stopped for lunch,but imagine would be very busy at night
Shopping!!. It is the shopping street of the city, where are the best shops. A pleasant walk through beautiful terraces and fabulous windows.
Wide Avenue with many opportunities to shop . This wide Avenue leads to the old part of town that lends its name to this road. This is also well worth a visit if you're all shopped out.

A grand avenue. This is a much nicer place to walk than Las Ramblas, There is much more to look at with beautiful and highly unusual architecture, lovely stores and great people watching. It is also much wider so better view of the city around you.

Upmarket street, great architecture, famous Gaudi buildings, upmarket shops. Great street to walk, lots of interesting architecture including Gaudi buildings and upmarket shops. Large wide street with attractive seating and lighting.

Bustling Street. We stayed at a hotel just off this busy street. The wide pavements tempt the pedestrian to look at the high quality shops and the tourist is satisfied by the architecture and the interesting houses - Casa Battlo, Casa Amatller and Casa Mila. There are good restaurants, tapas bars and fast food, as well as coffee shops and snacks. There are plenty of places to sit and people watch, so this is definitely to visit when in Barcelona.

Luxury, architecture and shopping. In this iconic street of barcelona , you can shop , see iconic builings of the city , such as: Casa Batllo, La Pedrera , ( both the architect Gaudi ) You can also enjoy great cuisine. Essential visit in Barcelona

A small Champs-Élysées. Not good for shopping on a budget but well worth a walk down regardless. All of your high-maintenance shops such as Hermes, Louis Vuitton, D&G, Armani, Jimmy Choo etc. Fabulously built buildings to house such foods, and a main connection point to the Gothic Quarter & Las Ramblas.
Shopping. Beautiful street lined with shops and restaurants. Walk down towards Placa Catalunya and into las Ramblas for an entire Barcelona experience!

Grand Avenue. Much like the Champs Ellysee in Paris. Grand rue with top of the line shops. Great place for a stroll. Two of Gaudi's must sees are on this stretch: La Pedrera and Casa Battlo. Looks pretty in the evening when all lit up.

The fashion street of Barca. High end shops and super good boulevard to roam be it day or night. If you are up for it, would totally advise running early in the morning and soaking in the architecture on both sides of the street.

Window shopping!!!. Spend an evening strolling around this big street!!! You will find all the expensive brands and their impressive stores. The street begins at Placa Catalynua where Apple store is located....

Mostly High End Shopping, with 2 Important Gaudi. This wide boulevard is Barcelona's Champs de Elysee. It is fine if high end shops, including all the well known chains and brands, is your cup of tea. The street is wide, the sidewalks are wide, there are many cafes, and restaurants too. The Gracia metro stop makes this easy to access. Gaudi's Casa Battlo sits at the same intersection as the metro and it is a wonderful site and a wonderful tour. A couple of blocks higher is Casa Mila, or la Pedrera, another iconic Gaudi creation that may be toured. The street is also central to the Eixample neighborhood, an extension of Barcelona over a hundred years ago, and there are many beautiful residential buildings, and good shops and restaurants. It is great for strolling to take in the sights without the concentration of tourists that you encounter in Old Town. We spent two weeks in an apartment in Eixample and were very glad that we chose this neighborhood.

Great long beautiful road. The whole walk way is tiled with small hexagonal decorative tiles. This is kept immaculate at night after every has left the area by the local 'council' spraying the paving with jet-spray water. There is no litter as everyone takes there rubbish home or to the large recycling bins provided. The road ranges from the high end designer shops through down to the Plac Catalunia main round about tourist gathering plaza. Many houses, museums and shops to visit. Even the seating along the road is influenced by Gaudi in mosaic decoration!

Great shopping spot. You will find here almost all brands you can think of and between 15 jan and 1 march they all have up to 70% doscoubts, just take into account, if it's a gucci store, 70% off may still be too much for you! :) i know i did mainly windowshopping :)

A nice walk, but if you're on a budget that's about all. This is a bit like walking down 5th avenue in New York. Lots of upscale/very expensive shops but a nice window shopping experience.We were able to see Casa Battlo from the outside which is beautiful.We stopped and had lunch as well. Worth a stroll if you have time. Nice shopping if you have time and money.
Shopping. If you have shopping on your mind, this is the place to be. For bar hopping and a happening nightlife, go into the sidelanes and you won't be disappointed.

Side streets are more fun. We stayed on Passeig de Gracia and there are lots of upmarket boutiques along the street which is nice to window shop along. The real gems are actually in the streets that branch off the streets especially towards Rambla de Catalunya and they are full off local boutiques and wonderful eateries and bakeries.
Wonderful street of shops and restaurants. Stroll along this street and enjoy the multitude of shops and tapas restaurants. La Pedrera and Casa Battlo are on this street.

A luxury avenue. A very broad and elegant avenue, full of light and beautiful gotic buildings, I'd like to own a flat there, where to spend holidays and weekends. It's full of fashon stores and malls.
Architecturally impressive and great shopping. Passeig de Gracia is a wide boulevard with beautiful buildings including Casa Battle and La Pedera by Gaudi.

Leading street to the hart of Barcelona. Beautifull large and wide street with many expensive shops. Most of the famous brands are situated here but there are also the other big commercial shops have a store in this presteges street.
Lovely boulevard lined with trendy stores.. This is a beautiful, wide, pedestrian friendly boulevard with some of the great international stores and high level Spanish stores as well.
Wonderful for shopping. We stayed on the street, amazing experience, a vast range of shops with plenty of eating places. Amazing.
Inlove with. Inlove with Barcelona, especially with this prospect (street) So marvelous architecture, medieval building, some Gaudi building, many shops and cafeterias what can be better?
Great shopping . This place is alive. Nice to walk and great shopping all the way around it. Lots of great restaurants and cafes. It's a must visit if you're in Barcelona

Shopping Place- Rodeo Drive of Barcelona. Long stretch where you find all high end stores in Barcelona. I can compare it to Rodeo Dr. in Los Angeles CA. Good place to walk since there are a lot of restaurants, cafe. The hop-on hop-off bus stops at this location ( green/ orange line).
