If you're up for walking, you can walk from Passeig de Gracia to Las Ramblas.. Approx. 30 -40 mins depending how fast you walk. Make sure when you buy at the expensive stores to ask for the Tax Free form for VAT. It's a bit tedious getting your money back since you have to stay in line at the Guardia de Civil at the airport before you check-in then get your refund money. Just give yourself ample time like what I did.

A walk to remember. fantastic! I can't get enough of Barcelona's architecture, of which Passeig de Gracia is one of its most florid examples. Besides the eye candy, it's wide, it's clean, there's lots of brand shopping, expensive but classy dining as well as a mac donalds and a starbucks, and it all leads down to the glorious Placa Catalunya. Great energy.

Elegant buildings. This is the place for high-end shopping, elegant buildings and expensive cafés and eateries for tourists. Several international chains and businesses have stores here, and you'll find Modernist masterpieces such as the Casa Batllo and La Pedrera. I wouldn't recommend the street as an attraction in itself.

The Luxury Promenade (1.5km). Middle of Barcelona Shopping Line!. Staying at hotel along Passeig Gracia, has its plus point. You are already on the Luxuary Promenade. You will see 10 cultural sites including Casa Mila (labelled #9 on map). While visiting these monument, you get to pop by fashion shops. Kill 2 birds with one stone!

for the real shopaholic!. This street in the centre of Barcelona has everything. All the top brands are located in this 5 km long avenue. Also two of Gaudi s masterpieces, La Pedrera and Casa Battlo are located here
Shop til you drop. Unless the sky's the limit with your budget, use caution! One can get in SERIOUS trouble: there is endless selections of high-end shopping & endless dining options!
stayed in the area terrifc jumping off point. Lots of restaurants, very central - be careful of belongings as is the case everywhere in Barcelona.
good location. you are in the city center, you have near of you plaza Catalonia, paseo gracia, and lot of shops where you can buy luxury clothes

Beautiful residential neighborhood. Beautiful and residential neighborhood. Full of nice little places to eat and spend awesome time. Very safe to walk at night. There are a lot of good hotel options, as well as independent apartments.
The most fashionable street. Great window-shopping site. The avenue is beautifully made and hosts a great number of famous brands.
Great shopping!. Wonderful street for all the luxury stores you can imagine. Prada, Gucci, Hermes, Swarovski, etc All in one place.

Fantastic architecture and shopping. The day we went here we walked miles because there was so much beautiful and different architecture coupled with the high end shops. We went into the Lladro shop and bought some keepsakes for our sons. The two members of staff were absolutely lovely, couldn't have been more charming and helpful with no pressure to buy. It really is a long and lovely street to walk along. You can get to it via the metro which is a very good, cheap and regular service. We just love walking about places as you get to see so much more and, you can choose to stop whenever you want to browse, to admire things or just to watch the world go by. Do keep looking up as the architecture is quite different in places. Some superb examples of the uniqueness of Gaudi.

Amazing. One of the most popular roads of Barcelona! If you are interested in shopping this is the place to go! You will find all the famous designer boutiques! It is magical when the lights go on in the evening.
Fantastic. We stayed just off Passeig de Gracia. It is fantastic for shopping and there are some lovely coffee shops to stop off in on your travells

A Grand Shopping Vista. This one of the must go main avenue and shopping precinct of Barcelona. Many top hotels, brand name departmental stores are situated on this street. The fountains and broad boulevard are lined with majestic buildings. Antoni Gaudi' famous Casa Batllo is on this street too. You can enjoy the spirit of the modern Bacelona and shop till you drop here.

A lively and beautiful street. There are tons of shops here, many rather high-end. But even if you don't want to shop, there are several gorgeous buildings along this street, including some of Gaudí's works. We also found a Pans & Company with a large outdoor seating area, and we enjoyed sipping our drinks and people-watching for awhile during a break from sightseeing. Definitely take a walk here on a visit to Barcelona -- though you'll probably end up here on your way to see a Gaudí building anyway.

Worth the stroll...watch where you are going...but look up!. If travelling by metro...get off at Passeig de Gracia and walk down one side then up the other..so you can look at marvel at what's across the road. Recommend to buy any tickets online to go and see the Gaudi attractions as the lines even in the low season often extend around the corner. Lots of expensive shops to look at (or indeed...spend in). However, it is the architecture that is the icing on this cake and not to be missed. For your cafe break I suggest you move off the main street and onto one of the side ones....to hopefully avoid exorbitant "tourist" prices. Have a cafe con leche, por favor (spanish) or the same thing in Catalan is cafe amb llet, si us plau . Photo ops are numerous. Really quite a magical place to wander.

Good for high end shopping and visiting Gaudi's Batllo and Miro. Huge boulevard of high-end luxury shopping. Amidst it are two of Gaudi's famous casas - Batllo and Miro. Both different but worth visiting!

Great street with great shopping. Very wide street with all the branded shops on both the sides of the road , very beautiful street ! I enjoyed walking . Very nice historic monuments on this road for sightseeing The shops are closed on Sunday's in whole of Barcelona except the Mara magnum near the beach as they have special permission So enjoy ur stay in Barcelona

One of the highlights of the city. It's always pleasant to stroll up and down the Passeig de Gràcia - it's probably the city's classiest street and it knows it. Wide but not especially imposing, there are many examples of Barcelona's unique architecture on either side. Some of these buildings you can pay to go in and have a look around or go up on the roof for a different perspective. Plus there are tonnes of high end shops and smart hotels. Probably not the best value place to eat or drink but it's the real heart of the city and I'd say a must for first-timers.

The most glamorous avenue of Barcelona. This is one of the top 10 shopping streets of Europe, and when you visit it, you realize why. This avenue is incredibly charming. It has everything: incredible architecture,beautiful shops, nice restaurants... It is difficult to imagine Barcelona without this magnificent avenue!
Most important shopping street in Barcelona. Beautiful boulevard. It is the Champs Elysee or Park Avenue of Barcelona. Famous architecture and shopping line the street. Very upscale.
High end shopping!. If u have the cash, this is where you should shop instead of Las Ramblas.Fewer people and more designer brands!

5th Avenue of Barcelona !. If you like luxury shopping ! This is the place to be. You can get lost here for hours. Make sure you visit a great restaurant called El Nacional Restaurant, on Paseo de Gracia. Although medium to high end it is open all day and has 4 restaurants inside focusing on different cuisines eg Fish, Meats, tapas etc... Great food and they have a great cocktail bar !

Modern Barcelona at its best. Passeig de Gracia is one of the main avenues in the modern part (19th century) of Barcelona. Wide, with boulevards, and with many old trees. We walked all the extension from the Avinguda Diagonal to Placa de Catalunya, enjoying at each step. In a single day you can see the best of Catalan modernist architecture. You can find lots of restaurants and cafés to rest all along.
A beautiful area of Barcelona. Great shopping, strolling the streets and beautiful architecture. Very central area of the city and popular with tourists.

Interesting architecture stroll. If you start at the Placa de Catalunya (airport bus/double decker tour buses), and walk up one direction and down another on the Passeig de Gracia, you'll have enough pictures to fill a photo book when you get home!Casa Batllo and La Pedrera (also known as Casa Mila) are located on this street--beautiful during the day and at night--along with many orange trees.

Shopping heaven. An almost endless avenue of shops from designer to high street fashion brands, it takes a lot of will power not to actually buy anything. Lots of cafés, bars and restaurants too, so you can just sit there, chill and relax and just people watch. Oh and some of Gaudi's works of art are located here as well so great alternative to shopping!
excellent avenue for shopping or just walking,. Gracia is very wide and beautiful avenue, you can find all great firm such us Geox, Rolex,.. very romantic for night promenade.

A great place to be in!!!. I walked around Passeig de Gracia during the night. It is a great walk, My impression is that if you don´t walk in Passeig de Grácia, you have not been to Barcelona, you missed a great place. Two fantastic houses designed by Gaudi and lots of beautiful buildings to see and stores too.

Not to be missed in Barcelons. If you enjoy tapas bars, shopping, entertainment or just relaxing at a bar and people-watching, Passeig de Gracia, one of the great Boulevards of Barcelona, right there with New York's Fifth Avenue and Paris' Champs d'Elysee, is not to be missed. Enjoyable at any time if the year, I have been there in Winter and Summer.

The Place To Go Shopping. Passeig de Gracia is the place to go shopping when in Barcelona.With its Designer top Brand shops and boutiques you will be spoilt for choice.And of course places to eat and stop for a coffee or a drink too.Word of warning:Watch out for the pickpockets.

Stunning thoroughfare. Running north from Plaza de Catalunya, Passeig de Gracia is a must see. A beautiful wide avenue with stunning architecture on both sides. Elegant lights, paving and street furniture complement the experience. Great for people watching, high end shopping, street dining.

Shopping with style. The most important shopping and business street in Barcelona was once just a rural lane connecting the city with Gracia, which was than an independent village. The new 42 meters wide avenue was designed according to the urbanization project led by Ramon Plana in 1821. Today it is a city’s high street with exclusive shops and restaurants, lined with famous modernist houses.

Barcleona's Fifth Ave. Passeig de Gracia is a magnificant broad ave with elegant shops, Gaudi homes and designs. It is beautiful in every season but especially in December all lit up for Christmas. At the top end it reaches the Diangonal. Ave. One special mostly unknown place is called Palau Robert, It has a beautiful garden for relaxing and inside there is tourist information about all of Catalunya. There is always a unique free exhibition upstairs, this year about the history of great Catalunian actresses of the 20th century.

Exclusive street, a must see!. Good developed shoppingstreet with lots of restaurants for getting ur energylevel updated! The street is wide open and clean. Beautiful buildings in Art Nouveau style.. Catalan style ;-)The aprox. 3km of lenght street, between Av. Diagonal and Pl. de Catalunya is known for fashionbrands like Chanel, Louis Vuitton Malletier and Cartier. You will also find Casa Batlló and Casa Milà (now a museum) by Gaudi, but also Casa Lleó-Morera and Casa Amatler. Aside these eyecatchers, also enjoy the food and local entertainment.

Barcelona's High Street. Paseo de Gracia is a beautiful wide boulevard in the centre of Barcelona. It is home to most of the city's name brand shops and some very nice places to stay and dine. It is broad, wide, and lovely to walk at almost any hour.

Our first stop. We come to Barcelona for two things: Shop and eat. Passeig de Gracia is always of first stop. We start at Zara, and walk down to El Corte Ingles, and then all the way back to the Marina. Great street!

ATTENTION!!!DO NOT SHOP ON SUNDAYS-ALL SHOPS ARE CLOSED.REMINDS SOVIET UNION ERA. really nice street to shop/stroll or windows shopping 6 days per week.BUT ATTENTION:on SUNDAYS-nearly everything IS CLOSED ...ITS not a LINCOLN ROAD IN MIAMI...its a BARCELONA-with SOVIETIC era ATTITUDE to TOURISTS (on SUNDAYS).not only tourists a suffering but local people too !!! THE MAYOR of barcelona decided long time -SUNDAY IS DAY OFF-and still in the economy continues to keep down -CLOSED everything...the only MALL IS "ANECBLAU" in castelldefels -opensecond: i would say BARCELONA-ESPECIALLY PASSEIG DE GRACIA IS A CAPITAL OF THIEVES IN EUROPE...THEIVES OPENED a bag of my wife while we were walking ...imagine! its a training camp-in europe IN BARCELONA for THIEVES!!!! why not to take a sample from miami -where 18 years ago was the same...but now in LINCOLN ROAD-YOU CAN LEAVE A TELEPHONE ON THE table and go to the toilets (try to do so in barcelona !!!!!)

Extremely busy shopping area missing the real soul from Barcelona. The avenue is too broad to be cozy . Too much traffic to be the Ramblas and only high end retailers and design shops offer their products . No middle class customers I guess . It misses the grandeur from the Champs Elysees, the pleasant business from Oxford Street but pretends to have it all. A little more south, behind the Placa de Catalunya starts the Ramblas, the real deal without the chessboard pattern of streets as in this Passeig de Gracia .
Shopping heaven. What a beautiful vibrant part of the city. Designer shops a plenty. Definitely a must when visiting Barcelona, even if only to people watch.

Very classy. A very classy shopping area in the heart of Barcelona with a myriad of designer shops for those not on a budget. This very broad avenue mixes retail shops, hotels, bars, cafes and residences.

Visit Gaudi's Casa Batllo and La Pedrera. A long, smooth road with some great scenes and big brands on the high street. Also has tube connections underground and two of Gaudi's houses (Casa Batllo and La Pedrera) as well as many other museums for those who have the time. The first place you should visit!
Shopping Area. This is the main shopping area in Barcelona. There are many restaurants also. This area is pedestrian friendly and we felt safe at night when we went for dinner in this area.

Beautiful shops. Great street for shopping, people watching or just enjoying the architecture. Case Mila, Majestic Hotel (go to the rooftop bar) and the lovely El Palauet Living, a wonderful boutique hotel.

Lovely area. This area contains many of the cities important architectural features,La Pedrera for one as well as being important for business and fantastic shopping with all the big names and brands. Easily accessible on metro.
shopping. one of the best place to shop and dine. strongly recommended to stay around this area. also within walking distance to some attractions.
Great Shopping. Beautiful buildings and great shops. Lots of places to eat and great places to buy souvenirs, clothes etcetera.

Great street to walk around. This is a fantastic street to walk and sit in the heart of Barcelona...you will admire the magnificent building (such as la Pedrera, casa Batllo...amount others). They have benches where you can relax and contemplate the life around there. This is a street you must make the point to walk around while visiting this great city!!

Lovely street - beautiful shops but expensive ones!. Lovely street - beautiful shops but expensive ones! A wide avenue full of name brands mainly, we loved walking and looking at the architecture though.

One-stop shopping street built for shopholics!. You will find international brands like Chanel, Gucci, Prada, Bottega etc alongside Spanish brands like Loewe, Desigual, Zara, Berksha. Plus lots of great restaurants to try out and rest those tired feet after a day of shopping

You can get trains to Airport from here. Nice location and close to city center. This place is a good place for tourists as they can get metro and also0 Renfe trains which take you directly to airport.
shopping area. This is the main road for shopping : The higher you walk this road the better the brands you will find. If you are interested in shpping this is the place to go.
Lots of shops. If you enjoy shopping like i do, then you will love this area. Eventhough it's not as famous as other shopping areas in another cities, i really like shopping here.

An exciting cosmopolitan shopping experience.. This area is full of great designer shops with loads of choice however their are less expensive shops in this part of the city too and the El Corte department store.

luxury shopping street. This street is quite spectacular at night when lit up with Christmas lights (I visited a fortnight before Christmas). There are a lot of luxury shopping outlets here as well as quite a few restaurants at the top end. There are also some Gaudi buildings too view too.

Very expensive shops. If you want to a very important shopping experience you have to go along this amazing boulevard. It's shopwindows are so luxurious and important that you can't stop looking at them.
Nice luxurioius shopping street. Nice luxurioius shopping street. Also perfect for a leisurely lunch in good weather. Don't miss Casa Mila!

See many Gaudi structures AND shop til you drop. Start at the Place de Catalunya and head up. You can't miss the Guadi structures and the shops are most definitely high end.I was participating in the Free (contribution) Walking Tour offered by HostelCulture and was glad of it as our guide had knowledge of each structure which I don't think I would actually pay to go inside even if I had another week to visit the inside of all of them. Highly recommend their tours, we took two, loved them both.
It's just a shopping area. I am not into shopping and I am spoilt for choice living in the UK therefore to me it is just a street where you get more or less the same shops as I would get in London.

Luxury and Popular Brands Shopping in Barcelona. A pretty avenue lined with major luxury designer brands and internationally popular ones. Start at the south end and walk north. Along the way are some of Antonio Gaudi's most famous architectural works. At the north end of Passeig de Gracia is the Diagonal, a boulevard, which will take you northwest into fashionable neighborhoods.

The City centre for me!. One of the best streets in Barcelona, I prefer it even to Las Ramblas but my favorite street is the street which runs alongside Passeig de Gracia.Passeig de Gracia has all the main international and famous brands booming with high end retail stores and restaurants alike, both in the street and the buildings.Start your trip here and work your way around!
Enchanting. A walk through the Passeig de Gracia is a must in Barcelona. The winter landscape, people watching, the atmosphere is perfect.

Great street to walk and window shop or to sit and people watch.. Beautiful street with grand historic properties that showcased unique Barcelona architecture. We stayed at a hotel just off this street and walked it daily. We always felt safe.

champs elysees, fifth avenue and passeig de gracia. all are great shopping strips for the wealthy. you will find all your favorite stores here, louis, cartier, valentine, monte blanc, and more. passeig de gracia is a very wide avenue accessible by metro and leads into a square where la rambla begins on the other side

Great shops and restaurants . We came here when on holiday on Barcelona. Passeig de Garcia is one of the main avenues in Barcelona and has lots of shops and restaurants on it. It also has gaudi's la pedrera and museum on it. Lots of designer shops such as Hugo boss, prada, Gucci and Cartier are down here and there is a massive el corte ingles department store here as well. The road leads down to a big square at the bottom with two beautiful fountains on it.And the start of las ramblas. Well worth a visit.
Upscale Walk. Despite being loaded with shops, Passeig de Gracia offers lots of interesting buildings, nice people and lovely trees.

Nice place to walk. This is a great area to walk around. There is nice shopping, cafes, and restaurants. It's a nice area to include in your trip to Barcelona. The side walks are very wide and it's less crowded than near the water front.

I would call it the Main Street . A great street it has all the main shopping shops and a lot of nice restaurant I would stay in a hotel in this area next time a lot of the historical attraction in walking distance and the rambala in a walking distance and does not have the type of crowd u would face their

Barcelona on elf my favorite cities. The architecture in Barcelona is awesome!! Everywhere you turn you are dazzled by the facades on the buildings and the statues in the squares. passeig de Gracia is mesmerizing . Upscale, entertaining and tapas to die for!!!!
Window shopping. The chique brands and the more 'middle class' brands go together on this avenue. Just looking at the windows of the big names is a joy. Don't need to buy anything ;-)

Great shopping & restaurants . A nice walk up from Plaza Catalunya along this road you can shop & eat for all tastes. We found a fantastic restaurant for burgers of all things in Barcelona & topped it off with delicious Churros on the way back. My wife especially enjoyed the shopping!

THE Shopping Street in Barcelona.. Once described as "The Camps d'Elyse with charm" this street is packed with the requisite high end stores and tree lined atmosphere that dares you to not get out a credit card. There are some wonderfully historical buildings here famed for their architectural splendor. The best shops are here-- Chopard, Louis Vuitton, etc. And some great places to stop and have a cocktail along the way-- the Mandarin Oriental is the best.
Nice to walk through. As nice as other large avenidas... Nice but not a must-see. Some nice statues, good sidewalks, a few good places to eat. Goes to the formerly new burough of Gracia
The street to stay at. Excellent views on the Gaudi house, great bars and restaurants. Fantastic wide pavements, only a 5 min walk to Place Catalunya!
A lovely stroll. I definitely recommend taking a long walk on this long street. It is filled with beautiful shops, restaurants, bars, cafes, and gorgeous people.

A walk through modernism.. Many of Barcelona's most glorious examples of this movement are present in this street, which is a delightful, ample avenue. As well as enjoying the splendid houses, I wouldn't miss the modernist charming lamposts with built-in bench.

Wide, beautiful avenue to hang around!. Very beautiful, green place, with a lot of shopping places and cafes. You can admire wonderful architecture of the buildings, not only the most famous ones, but also less known.
Thanks to the tourists this place is very vibrant, although crowdy.
Another beautiful site. In Barcelona we had take hop on hop off bus.....and such sites like these were treat to the eyes.....looking at the elegant designs and structures was beautiful
nice place. It" s important to see the architecture to this place, to visit also in the evening. Clothe to bus and metro stations

Still gracious. Once the place to live, the Passeig de Gracia is still gracious, lined with beautiful buildings which include La Pedrera and Casa Battlo. Much nicer than La Rambla which is far less sophisticated.

El modernismo en Barcelona. Modernism is one of the things that I like Barcelona. Antonio Gaudi left us unique wonders in the world as the Sagrada Familia, Parc Guell or the emblematic buildings in Paseo de Gracia. My habit to spend Sundays in the street as its name suggests is a wonderful walk. The most elegant and beautiful with buildings, restaurants and shops known street.
An avenue. HIGH end boutique shops, restaurants, cafe's and everything is here. Feast your eyes with a lovely view while walking. A perfect way to end the day by spending in one of the cafe's here.

Birthday shopping . We visited passeig de gracia twice during our visit the shopping in Barcelona is amazing the streets are clean lots of cafes resturants and fashion shops. I enjoyed it more then la rambles.
Nice place to walk. Very nice place to walk and shoping ,coffeshops and resturants are spred along the street . Old buildings and nice views and famose trademarks are there.

Walk the mile. A splendid avenue for a shopping frenzy or just for a long walk to look at extraordinary architecture or just enjoy the sea of people. Don't miss the 15 month old El Nacional, a great place to enjoy local food, wine and drinks in an old factory and parking garage!
Fancy Area of Barcelona. Nice to walk but do not venture into eating there. It is very expensive. Combine the walk with a visit to Casa Batlo and it will be worth it.

One of the best places in Barcelona. This street is my favorite in Barcelona: not as crowded as La Rambla, to as narrow and old-fashioned as Barri Gotic. The architecture is rather various, not boring at all. A nice fusion of modern energy and historical beauty. And all the best shops are here...

Nice walk. This is a magnificent walk passing La Pedrera and people thronging to and fro. It has great shops and wonderful characters. Someone dressed up as a monkey man but not as friendly. You get all sorts.

Nice walking and shopping street. After touring all day we strolled on this street and went into some beautiful designer shops. With the dollar being so strong the prices were great. Should have bought a bag at Lowes.
The most Chic place. The paseo de Gracia is amazing ,you can walk and visit the most chic shops ,as Chanel,Prada ,Louis Vuitton etc etc and with TAX FREE !
Good for shopping. It is just next to plaça catalunya and las ramblas, this boulevard is the main shopping area. You can also find cafeterias and restaurants.
Best Street in Barcelona. This is the best street in Barcelona. It is clean and has the best shopping stores, hotels and restaurants. Just get ready for a long walk on this street.

Wonderful stroll.... wonderful shops. If not for the unique architecture, you could be walking 5th avenue. All the high end boutiques and jewelry stores can be found here along with some very nice outdoor seating restaurants, perfect for tapas and a drink. Casa Batllo and La Pedrera are on the avenue. Perfect for people watching and very safe even late at night.

Take a stroll. Take a stroll down this beautiful Avenue in Barcelona. Filled with trees and shops and a relaxing atmosphere and one of the delightful streets in Barcelona. A great way to experience this lovely city is on foot

Very nice street. This is really a very nice street. The way the main traffic is put afar from the pedestrians while very slow traffic uses a special sidewalk lane is very interesting. The buildings fit perfectly with the street view.

A beautiful focal point for eating, shopping or just walking about. We walked up and down this visually stunning street many times and noticed new things each time: designer shops, specialty stores, restaurants of all kinds.The architecture is amazing and the people very friendly and helpful. There are more delightful areas of interest which branch off from Passeig de Gracia; in nine days we covered just a few. Plan to spend lots of time in this diverse area.
Modern Barcelona!. I have stayed in this area twice now and totally different from the rest of the city. Very modern and square but still filled with life and history.

Hustley & Bustley.... If you're visiting the main city streets it would be hard to avoid this area, we visited in December and it was busy with wood huts selling local produce and had a great vibe, the square was busy with groups of friends and families and balloon sellers, it had a really great vibe and was worth a visit for sure.
Seriously Cool. Everything you could ever imagine and more ... boutique shops and hotels, endless culinary choices and sidewalk cafes, full of life and vibrancy.

Strolling for fashion or architecture. This street delivers beautiful buildings and clothes. Allow plenty of time. I recommend coming once the Christmas decorations are up for a wonderful start to the season.
Shops for thick wallets. There are nice shops and a lot of people. It was interesting to see this avenue, but I could hardly enjoy the buildings beacuse of the shopping zombies....

Nice. A nice place to walk but unfortunately, like many places in Barcelona, it is overrun by tourists who make it difficult to walk and admire the architecture. I am avoiding it every time I go back to Barcelona
good place to visit. Good food and interesting shops. In this central location, one can find many good eats and drinks. Have fun!
Fancy luxurious outlets.. I actually preferred this street to Las Ramblas. Less people and more room to move. There are some great shops leading down to the Gothic quarter.
The trendy shopping street in Barcelona. Amazing street, hosting all big fashion designers in the world. But you need to have a big wallet. You can walk nearly > 2kms for shopping around.

Beautiful boulevard. It's a wide, light filled street with broad sidewalks, home to many cafes and features two Gaudi houses-Casa Batilo and Casa Mila (La Pedrera). High end stores-Chanel, Armani and their ilk.It has two way traffic and also frontage roads for the taxis and delivery trucks. Bicycles share their lanes. Drivers obey the signals so you won't get confused and think you are in Chicago. Brilliant city planning has a the streets in a grid and on this one all the corner buildings sit at a 45 degree angle to let more light in.There are benches for the many strollers along this beautiful airy street to rest their legs and admire the splendid Barcelona architecture.You'll also find buses and subway stations and the HoHo buses have stops along this boulevard. Taxis wait in ranks on the frontage roads. It's all very civilized. Enjoy!
Interesting Bulevard. I recommend walking and enjoying visiting Gaudi's artistic architecture such as Casa Batlo & Casa Mila while have a good chance for shopping among famous brands.
Great street to take a wander. Runs from Gracia to the sea. I love wandering down this street, plenty of shops (mostly very high end), but broad street makes it pleasant.

Nice avenue, chip and relaxing, with Gaudi houses as a bonus. Really nice, elegant and relaxing street. With the most beautiful villas by Gaudi and others to visit. The shops are really classy, there are some nice cafes/tapas bar also if you need to stop to eat or have a drink. I found it really more pleasant and beautiful than the Champs Elysees in Paris for example (and I'm French!)

Very chic but take a big wallet. . Barcelona's Bond St. has everything for the discerning shopper. Cartier, Rolex, Gucci and Burberry, all nestled in amongst Mango, Zara and an endless number of restaurants and cafes. Sit outside and people watch whilst nibbling anything from pastries to tapas at a very reasonable price. Plenty of scope to spend if you've got it but still easy to enjoy of you haven't. Busy all the time but not crowded and something for everyone. If you're going to Barcelona, go to the Passeig de Gràcia.
Luxury shopping paradise. The luxury shopping district, everything from Chanel, Longchamp, Louis Vuitton, Valentino, Ferragamo, Lacoste and many, many more!!!
A good area to stay for your trip. Quite central, you are within walking distance of 3 of Gaudi's famous building. Plenty of terraces and easy access to transportation.
Nice decorated street. This is one of the main street for upscale shopping where you can find Louis Vuittons, Pradas and Guccis. In late November the street was beautifully decorated with lights.

Best shopping street. We stayed in this area and it's the best. Great by day for window shopping and being wowed by the great architecture and by night the cafe society is fabulous. Got to be the best part of Barcelona for staying in.

Nice to stroll. The Passeig de Gracia is billed as the "5th Ave." of Barcelona - and it certainly is. Beautiful stores (expensive) and a few nice restaurants along the way. Just take a stroll and window shop - my wife dragged me into Gucci and Prada. And it did not cost me a dime.

Better than La Rambla. Very nice high end shopping and wide sidewalks. Crowds match that of La Rambla but nicer everything. Nice hotels too if you need a lobby washroom. Casar Battlo is right by Passeig de Gracia metro stop and is a nice sight.
Just a street. Just an expensive luxury brand shopping street. I never got anything on this street maybe other than food. We used this street walking from the gothic area and Las Ramblas.

Walk you eyes wide open. This is the street with the most extravagant constructions. And the most chic boutiques, ranging from Prada to Mont-Blanc and Lladro. Some women walking on this street wear a few thousand dollars' worth of clothes... You can have a look at the mansions built in 'modernism' style and then decide which one you will visit later.

Great street for walking on, shopping disappointing . The street is beautiful and we kept gravitation to this area however I found the shops quite spread out. I prefer stores to be back to back. Also not too impressed with the brand mix

Great area to visit!. Passeig de Gracia is a must in Barcelona, not only because of the stores or the people, but mainly because you can really appreciate the design and architecture of the city. I can say that I've spent long hours strolling around, and its deff not a waste!

Wonderful streetscape. The streetscape is just brilliant - so many different architectural styles, nice shops and cafes.
Try and visit during the day and after dark to see the facades of the building lit up.
great strret. you have to walk around to feel the vibe. clean, nice and tones of shops and places to eat and drink

Beautiful stroll... cant think of another place in the world with as enviable as stroll... with history, gorgeous architecture and culture seeping out of every beautiful building! it really is a treat for design-buffs! if you get tired there are conveniently spaced metro stations to take you off in whichever direction..
great street. a great street to walk through. Starting at plaza the catalunya and walking down. you will see the house of Gaudi and several places which serve nice breakfasts.

Not my type.. If you are the boss of "The devils e
wear Prada" you might enjoy it... Otherwise go to Raval, the Parks and the beach as this place it is a waste of time... Although very early on Sunday morning it could be a nice walk.
Shop till you drop!. From international to local designers - it's all here. Great cafes and restaurants along this street

An elegant street. Passeig de Gracia is a street with street with high end buildings along with outdoor cafes similar to many in Europe. The street is wide busy with cars and has a medium. Its nice to walk along as you go from point to point but it is not a destination

Shop, Eat, Walk, Enjoy!. Have been in Barcelona for around 2 years now and still love to take a stroll down the road in the evenings.
If someone is visiting Barcelona , he has to visit it. Walk down the road, stop for a coffee midway or have some tapas. Go around the shops. Worthy well spent afternoon.

All Those Modernista Buildings!. Exit at the Passeig de Gracia metro stop & you emerge into a Modernista extravaganza. There are four great buildings to visit here, La Pedrera by Gaudi & much further down towards Placa de Catalunya in the same block - Gaudi's Casa Batllo, Catafalch's Casa Amatller & Montaner's Casa Leo Morera. All are worth visiting. Then there are all the up market shops. Don't forget to look at the pavement. In acknowledgement of Gaudi, the Barcelona Council has paved the sidewalk in hexagonal tiles designed by Gaudi for Casa Batllo but actually used in his La Pedrera. They are a greenish grey & have a design of sea creatures.

High end shopping, great walking, dining. After a long day of Gaudi-hopping, take a stroll along this boulevard from one of his remarkable edifices to another just as the sun sets, and enjoy a stroll along a pretty, well-lit, high-traffic road, to shop, dine or just enjoy the sights.

Nice walking here. Sort of an upper east side of Barcelona, this part of the city offers a nice view, the buildings are beautiful, and you can find interesting stores here, as well as markets or restaurant.
Beautiful avenue.. If you go to Barcelona you'll have to visit it. Just start near Travessera de Gracia and go down to Plaza Cataluña and then Las Ramblas. It will be a very well spent afternoon.
The street of lights :). I stayed in a hotel in this street during Christmas and it's one of the most beautifully decorated streets I have ever seen in Europe .

Attractions, food, high-end shopping.. Whether it's attractions like La Pedrera, Casa Batllo or high-end shopping, this grand boulevard has it all. Punctuated by great restaurants along its wide sidewalks, it's a feast for the senses.

Shop All Day. A walk down the Passeig de Gracia offers all the high end shopping you will need. All the major designers are located on the street as well as the Modernista buildings, Casa Batllo, and La Pedrera.

Every luxury store you can think of. Every luxury store you can imagine, and no one in them. If you want to shop Cartier, Gucci, Prada etc. this is your place. If not, try Le Cortes Ingles, an 8 story department store on the street with everything from chain saws to Caroline Herrera and an amazing food court in the basement. Or just go to La Perdrera, also on the street.

Necressary to walk. You should walk here if you are in Barcelona. With my family one night we walk on this street amd visited also Gaudi homes. Also you can find many variant of shops to make shopping. I highly recommend here.

Walk, Eat, Shop, Drink, Rest!. Everyday in Barcelona, we came back to this street. Sure it had the designer shops, the restaurants, the buildings, people watching galore, and it was very close to our hotel. However, what kept bringing us back is that it is a very beautiful boulevard in its own right. When on the street, we just took our time and strolled from where we started to where we decided to end. Whether it was visiting Gaudi's buildings, shopping at anyone of the top name designer stores, or simply sitting outside in a restaurant patio have some food and or drinks, we enjoyed out time on the street.
LOVE THIS STREET. We walked it often enjoying the beautiful buildings, the passing crowds and all around wonderful ambiance.
Nice Stroll. I ended up on Passeig de Gracia by getting lost but enjoyed looking in the shops. Plus 2 of Gaudi's houses are on this street.

Lots of shops, several beautiful houses and lots of tourists. It's a sort of boulevard with lots of shops where you can buy any clothes, footwear and jewelry you would like to. There're several beautiful houses which will admire you among hundreds of usual Barcelona houses. From my point of view value of visiting this street with the touristic goals is overestimated

Shop, shop, shop !. Busy, main street with lots of designer shops and plenty of cafes, restaurants. Take your time and wander down it, passing two of Gaudi's buildings on the way. (La Pederera and Casa Batllo). Casa Batllo is lit up at night and is stunning.
Designer shops. Lots of designer shops here. Gaudi's La Perdera and Casa Batlo are situated here. Worth walking down this street.
Heart of Barcelona. Just go around, shop or just eat in one of so many tapas restaurants. A central Metro station and railway to connect you to all parts of Barcelona. All the buzz is right here...

The Regent Street of Barcelona but with fewewr shops!. This beautiful street contains many famous buildings by Gaudi and his pupils and copiers. Most of the very famous buildings are along it and the benches and lamp posts are also by Gaudi.You cna just appreciate them from outside or pay to go in. It leads down tlo Plaza de Catalunya - El Corte Ingles is there- and then Las Ramblas.There is an antiques archade worth a visit and shopping archades too. Eating and drinking on the Paseo is expensive. Go down one of the side streets and eat a menu del dia lunch for about 12 to 15 Euros including wine.A must- see visit

Impressive in the day but Fantastic at night. Walked by this wonderful building lots of time over the years but the best tim to see it is in the evening when its lit up. It looks wonderful. You can see it at night from the Hotel Gran Havana

Main shopping street with two Gaudi's landmark's - Casa Batlló and La Pedrera. Take a walk from Plaça de Catalunya to the north, and it will take you to Casa Batlló and La Pedrera on the opposite side. If you like shopping, you will find all top brands there.

Barcelona's Rodeo Drive. Shopping street for the high end shopper. I myself do not like shopping as I hate trying to find clothes that fit. But just to walk the street and look at the beautiful displays in the windows, the bustle of the people and enjoy the sunshine and fresh air it was fabulous. Two of Gaudi's buildings are on this street as well. I just love the architecture of all the buildings. Pedestrian friendly and although the crosswalks are not on the corners like in North America, It does not inhibit the experience in the least. Lots of coffee shops and restaurants to stop and enjoy a coffee or drink, or even a meal.

Great Shopping street. `Loved walking up and down this beautiful and massive street. lined with great shops, two of Gaudi's amazing buildings/museums and nice restaurants too! a must do on your trip to Barcelona

All the high-end stuff is here. On my bus trip from Park Guell to Catalonia Square, all I could see in Passeig de Gràcia was beautiful shops filled to the brim with expensive wares, loads of quirky and hip eateries and bars and fancy hotels. Lovely fountain that lights up at night. Tons of access to the subways and bus stations. You'll have no trouble finding a cab or a bike to rent.

Main shopping street!. You can find everything you want here, Prada, Gucci, Guess (my favorite brand here). Different range of price is available. On this street you will find 2 Gaudí buildings (Casa Mila and Casa Batlló). In the south end of the street, you can find Plaza Cataluña which can be connected with Rambla de Cataluña, which is the most famous and crowded street of BCN.

Wide street. Wide street, lots of stores, restaurants. A highlight is Gaudi's La Pedrera and Casa Batllo.A great thing about Barcelona streets is the chopping off of the corners to make the intersections more open and airy. It's great. Sometimes you have to walk a little farther to the crosswalk...
Designer shopping. This is a street full of all the big name stores. Great for shopping and looking at the beautiful architecture.

Most beautiful street. I loved Passeig de Gracia. I visited Barcelona twice and on both trips this was my favorite spot. Nice shops, restaurants and most important there is a bench on every step, so you can rest and enjoy watching the life of Barcelona. Our accommodation was just 5 minutes from Passeig and it was very convenient since there is a bus, train and metro station so you can easily reach every part of Barcelona from here. La Perdera and Casa Batlo are both on this street which adds to its beauty.
Best place to hangout. Best place to hangout in Barcelona. Do shopping. Enjoy food. See architecture. Just enjoy the company of other tourist. Barcelona I love you.
Passeig de Gracia. If you have plenty of time there, take a walk and visit whatever interest you. clean city and modest people
Beautiful avenue to shop and visit historical sites. This street has all of the nice shops and a few historical sites to visit like the La Pedrera and Casa Batllo.

Excellent shopping. What a great street for shopping. You find all your shops from ysl, valentino, to givenchy, chanel, burberry, guess, michael kors, hermes as well as the mango,zara and other ranges. It was a great place to visit. The staff are all really friendly.

A great avenue full of (not just shops) great architecture.. I joined a private guided tour about Gaudi architecture but out of my expectation, I discovered lots more beautiful architecture along this avenue. Our tour guide Albert is very informative and he knows every bit about the buildings on this Avenue. Of course there are lots of brandname shops that could keep you distracted, but not this time : there are so many magnificent buildings to see, why need to go shopping?

Awesome. The sight is wonderful, with lots of historical places and monuments. People are used to be in these place even at nights, what makes the place feel very secure. Besides the historical places, there are also lots of shops and restaurants.

Charming. Nice street to walk for window shopping and strolling through. In addition to many designer stores, you will admire beautiful buildings and even Gaudi's work. Take the time to absorb the beauty.
Pretty street for a nice walk and (expensive) shopping. Passeig de Gracia is a lovely wide street to wander. The architecture is gorgeous and the stores are very nice, albeit out of my price range.

Great shopping excellent new neighborhood. Beautiful street with amazing buildings ( Casa Mila , Casa batlò ) and designer shops .... Gucci , Prada , Saint Laurent and many others. Nice cafes and restaurants. If I'll come back to Barcelona I will definitely pick my hotel in this area.
Loved this boulevard. This is one of the main boulevards full of brand shops and two of the most famous Gaudi´s buildings La Pedrera and Casa Batlo.

Ol World style . This is the heart of old Barcelona.It is mysterious, narrow and fascinating. It takes you from the Ramblas to the Cathedral of Barcelona, not to be confused with the LA Segrada Família. The Cathedral is worth a visit on its own merit, and you may want to have lunch in one of the restaurants on this plaza.
lovely shops. We window shopped as there was no way we could afford the prices but it is interesting to see the range of shops at the high end of the market
Great street for shopping. We walked up and down the Passeig de Gracia a number of times now and it is really a good esplanade for shopping or just to admire the impressive architecture.

Shopping paradise. If you like all the big name shops, then this is the street for you. However, it's also the road in which 2 of Gaudí's most important buildings are situated. It's a road which has a real buzz about it - wide, busy and noisy!

Great Shopping. We spent a lot of time running back and forth on this trip. Best was a luggage purchase at Longchamp. And, shoes from Camper...great well known stores/brands as well as unique local stores.
Designer alley. Beautiful street safe feeling walking street lights and benches by gaudi.. Every designer you want on this street.. A favorite more so than la ramblas

A shopping heaven. A nice walk in the sun to spend some money. From the big names to the small market type stalls it have everything. This street is well laid and and kept immaculately clean. Go on treat yourself to that special gift

For real shopaholic. Shops, shops and shops! Many different famous brands of clothes, jewelry, shoes, cosmetic and parfum. Pull&bear, Mango, H&M, Stradivarius, Bershka, Topshop , Swarovski, Pandora, Tiffany & CO, MAC, Starbucks, KFC, Burger King and McDonald's, of course.
Beautiful street for walking, shopping and dining. Beautiful architecture and sites. Great shops and places to eat. Very crowded and a wonderful place to experience the energy of the city!

Great place to stay. Our apartment, rented through VRBO, was located on this street about two blocks from the Placa Catalunya. It was a great central location, walking distance to La Pedrera, Barri Gotic, El Born, Las Ramblas, Merkat, many great restaurants.

Bond Street, Rodeo Drive and Rue de Faubourg Honore, Spanish Style. Barcelona's (and probably Spain's) most exclusive shopping street runs down towards the Port of Barcelona. A broad Avenue featuring two of Gaudi's famous architectural locations and a myriad of upmarket shops. Well worth a stroll if you have a fat wallet. Beware, however, of the tapas cafes on the street. Whilst many are in keeping with the surroundings, so, most definitely, are the prices. A modest selection of tapas with a couple of drinks will easily set you back 40 - 50 Euros for two people. If your are seriously in need of retail therapy though this is your destination ...

Simply it is Barcelona's champs elysees.. Whether you will shop or not you will drop. It is a very long beautiful street with many brands shops and restaurants.
You cannot travel to Barcelona without strolling in this street.
*HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Nice for a stroll. After you finish walking the Rambla, continue through Plaza Catalunya and up the Passeig de Gracia for at least 4 or 5 blocks. There is high-end shopping here and you eventually wind up at the Manzana de la Discordia where you see the competing architecture of Domenech (Casa Lleo Morera), Puig (Casa Amatller), and Gaudí (Casa Batllo).

A must!. Sensory experience that can't be missed. Entertaining as well as exciting venue for pedestrians. So much happening, artists, mimes, arts and crafts displays, local talent abounds, restaurants and the best place to people watch.
Great Walking Tour thru Gracia. This is one of the best walking tours thru Barcelona. varied architecture and many beautiful buildings. Start at Diagonal Metro station

Beautiful wide boulevard to stroll - only downside is the traffic through the middle. A grand avenue with wide tree-lined pavements either side of the main north bound traffic route in Eixemple district from Placa de Catalunya. High end shopping and restaurants and Modernist buildings - the soul of Barcelona style. Lively day and night; plenty to enjoy for all.
The Turistic buses red and blue routes stop here.
big aristocratic street. beautiful street with lots of restaurants and coffee places and all kinds of shops.It also has the most known attractions Casa Battlio and La Pedrera!

Look up at the architectural details. It is a large boulevard with exceptional architectural details, Casa Batllo and Casa Milla, boutiques, restaurants, cafés, every building you pass by has details front the front façade to the roof, look at the Hermes store, very nice walk

Beautiful thoroughfare. The passeig de Gracia is the main spine of the city centre and is wide and bubbling with locals and tourists
There are many high end shops and two of Gaudis fantastical buildings to discover too
Hard to imagine a trip to barcelona without spending a lot of time on this street

Pretty, pricy walk. Lovely, large avenue filled with all the usual high end stores found in any large city. Lots of benches to rest on and a pretty stroll when on the way to Gaudi's Casas. Also a nice early evening stroll.
High-End Retail. This is like walking along Fifth Avenue in New York. Although there are two Gaudi buildings that are beautiful, especially at night.

Something for everyone!. A glorious shopping street with brand names from mid-range to luxury goods... something for everyone.
And great views of famous Gaudí buildings on the way!!!
Great bars and restaurants nearby...
Certainly worth a visit when in Barcelona!

Barcelona Personified. If you have only a short time in this lovely Barcelona, make sure you spend some time walking on the Passeig de Gracia. Lovely storefronts, wide sidewalks, beautiful buildings with fascinating architecture are a treat to the eye. And there's always a place to stop and sit at a cafe or bench. I could walk here again and again.
A good street to wander along. You will enjoy a stroll along this wide street with the top shops and great restaurants and architecture

Perfect evening stroll for lovers. Charming cafes....expensive restaurants...fast food....extreme high end shopping....Gaudi style places for lovers to sit and watch the evening under lovely street lamps. It is a great place for that European evening stroll. ( more charm with one tenth the people than Law Ramblas)
Great shops, plenty to buy. A very upmarket street full of designer shops. Great place for those with deep pockets, but also good for people watching.
Not to be missed. It's one of the attractions in Barcelona which you need to walk along to appreciate the atmosphere, full of cafes and shops at both sides of a wide boulevard.
Good on a sunny day. Much to see in this famous street. Two very important buildings designed and supervised by Antoni Gaudi. Plus many Designer shops.

Busy and vibrant area. Excellent area for sitting with a coffee, watching the world go by.
Plenty of quality shops near by all served by an excellent public transport system.

It's ok. . Depends on what you're after I guess.
If you want all your high end shops like Gucci etc then it's great.
If you come from Australia where the dollar is terrible then I wouldn't bother.
Very busy too.

The Fifth Avenue of Barcelona. The Passeig de Gracia has many beautiful modernist buildings like the Casa Mila, Casa Batllo, Casa Lleo Morera and Casa Amatller. The street is lined with many high end stores that are interesting to see. There are also many good restaurants in the area.

Amazing architecture and nice stores as well!. A nice walk to admire the amazing architecture of the town. The Passeig is full of restaurants and cafés and of course all the designer stores. Very nice

Beautiful square at the heart of Barcelona. This is the centre of this great city, the central circle mosaic on the floor is the actual centre, it is a beautiful testament to the industrial and rich history of Catalonia including a monument to its second republic's President executed during Franco's reign. This is what the arc de triumphed is to Paris.

This was a great area to stay in, safe and centrally located near many sight-seeing attractions. We enjoyed our stay in the Gracia neighborhood. It had great food, shopping, close to attractions, and metro/bus lines. Safe at night and a great atmosphere anytime of day. I would highly recommend staying in this area of Barcelona.

A beautiful street with excellent shopping. This is Barcelona's equivalent to NY's Fifth Avenue. Gorgeous architecture and high class shopping.
A must!

Nob doubt one of the best streets of barcelona. You don`t need to read any review, you will visit it yes or yes. So just enjoy it. Read about the arquitecture fight between Gaudi and the other arquitects on the time. Some of the most amazing buildings you can see in the world are there. If you are rich you will find your shopping here. It is a very nice place with a lotnof history. Imagine this place 120 years ago, full of chariots and horses with the more powerfull people of barcelona...very nice. It is not a good place for night party. Be carefull with pickpockets, this is one of their favorite spots, spetially metro stations.
Must while in Barcelona!. Loved this walk.. you get to see the cosmopolita city as well as the wonderful modernist buildings mixed with the classic ones. The avenue is super safe, clean and bright.

Lots of places to shop. It's a nice shopping area in downtown Barcelona with tons of shops, restaurants and Tapa eating out places... But the prices aren't cheap. They're actually more expensive compared to the US and Canada due to the Euro exchange rate.

Popular Street. Hard to know where to look, so much to see. Between Gaudi's creations, tourists and the shops, it was difficult to take everything in. This street had one of the best Gelato shops outside of Italy, it is up the top end of the street, in a quiet park, opposite a small park.
Beautiful part of town. Stumbled across this while exploring. The whole area is beautiful. Plenty of shops, cafes, and other things to do while touring.

Eixhample District. We stayed in Hotel Omm on the Passeig de Gracia/ Roselle. A treat from the family. And it didn't disappoint. Surrounded by designer shop and some of the best eating and drinking hostelries one could wish for. Our Hotel is open to the public and definitely worth a visit for oober chic and fabulous bar food. The Hotel restaurant has a Michelen star so it reflects in the bar too. Friday night is good for people watching!!!Two Gaudi wonders on the street too and easy access to all of the city by foot one metro.
Nothing special. The fountains were nice to look at, but it could have been Oxford Street in London or Park Avenue in New York.
Loved this street! . This street is great to buy and buy and get crazy buying. The best shops are here, also the buildings are beautiful and the fountain is great!
Amazing!. Passeig de Gracia - Paseo de Gracia - is Barcelona's most famous shopping street. It is the most expensive street in Barcelona and in Spain.
Beautiful!. The boulevard is lined with beautiful buildings, trees, famous stores, and restaurants. It also houses few of Gaudies famous buildings. It is fun to walk and look around.
nice architecture. walk thru this road and admire the architecture. also lots of shopping and food areas.gaudi building is there. restos good for breakfast

The Fifth Avenue of Barcelona. The high-end boulevard of Barcelona. It is a mixture of Fifth Avenue, Madison Avenue and the Champs d' Elyssee of Paris. Every high-end, luxury brand is represented. The avenue is exceedingly well-maintained. The engineering of the corner turns and traffic modes is genius (nothing like that in the U.S., alas). Street lights and ceramic tile covered benches in the fashion of Gaudi----fun to sit on and people watch. The street is lively all day; really comes alive from about 6 - 11 at night, and then people are still out and about well after midnight...although the crowds have thinned. Public safety/security is visible and evident.....I felt safe, always. The consummate walking-around town, Barcelona.
Main designer shopping street. All the major designer brands are here on this street however beware they are NOT open on a Sunday. So we missed out unfortunately.

Beautiful!. The Passeig de Gracia is a beautiful boulevard in Barcelona, housing some really beautiful buildings. There are of course the Casa Batllo, Casa Amatller, and La Pedrera, and a very beautiful building with some amber coloured domes housing high flying shops, and a whole load of others. It is also an important transport venue. You get the trains and buses to various spots from here so when in Barcelona stay in the vicinity. We stayed at the fabulous Hotel Jazz by Universitat metro stop. We walked up (or was it down) on our way back from Parc Guell and bumped into lovely little fountains and statues along the way, and a very beautiful fountain at the crossroads with Gran Via Catalunya. We just kept stopping along the way and sat on the benches to really take in the beauty of the buildings and the little squares and fountains. By the way, on one of our evening return walks we bumped into the crossroads fountain and it was all lit up, changing hue constantly. We simply loved it!Of course, one cannot go through Psg. de Gracia without stopping at one of the numerous wonderful cafes. There is the lovely cafe at Casa Amatller, and countless others. I must say, the cakes, breads and croissants we had in Barcelona are superb...the best ever!! Never had such wonderful croissants anywhere before!So traipse away, up and down this beautiful road and enjoy!

The most likable and reliable shopping street ever visited in Europe. outstanding Shopping street and it's much Elegant than Las Ramblas, I enjoyed this place a lot and would recommend it for everyone who decided to visit Barcelona ( Barthelona) ;)
Good if you want to go to Barcelona to shop. Its a nice shopping area. It contains some great shops and restaurants. But its just a shopping area.

Lovely Street. We had more than two hours to spend while waiting our turn to enter the Familia Sagrada so decided to spend the time walking down to this street. It is a street is lined with all the popular high end brands and numerous cafes. One can also see the famous Gaudi Buildings, Casa Batlo and La Pedrera.
Great for food, shopping and exploring. Lovely part of Barcelona, close to our hotel so we explored most of it. on main train route so easily accessible for all

Lovely street with shopping and restaurants. Our hotel was located on Passeig de Gracia so we were very lucky to walk out the door and enjoy this lovely street and area. Shopping and restaurants are everywhere and the architecture is amazing, with Gaudi and others showcasing their artistry.
Shopping street. Passeig de Gracia is street full of designers shops, restaurants a some of Gaudi's interesting buildings. It's place to be when you're in Barca.
Passeig de Gracia. The area is worth walking around. The high-end shopping is available but the shop decors were not as inspired as one would find in NYC, Paris, etc.

Heart of Barcelona. This is our favorite neiborhood in Barcelona. If you are there, it's noteworthy to spend an afternoon walking through this street that ends at Plaça Catalunya. Try to seat in one of great cafes there to enjoy the view.

Great shopping and restaurants. This is a lovely area in Barcelona,well worth a visit,We walk up from La Ramblas Its full of beautiful shops the roads are very wide and there are plenty of tapas bars and coffee shops if you wanted to have a rest.There is plenty of opportunity to take lots of photos.

Lovely Boulevard. This is lovely wide street. Fairly busy but not too overcrowded. It has all the high end stores and La Pedrera. It was really enjoyable strolling down the Boulevard that has lots of buzz and activity. It is a great place to shop with a large Disegual store on the corner. If you are visiting Barcelona visit to Passeig de Gracia is a must. If you do not want to shop it is a nice place to people watch and also to marvel at La Pedrera.

Nice place, nothing impressive. The place is usually crowded, there are a lot of stores, some museums and gaudi's buildings, other than that is just a busy street. still worth the visit specially if you are going to la pedrera or casa batllo.
Busy Boulevard. This is a very busy street with many chain stores. Pick side streets instead to walk to the major sites and old quarter.

Amazing. Passeig de Gracia is the street where you can find La Pedrera and also Casa Batllo,but also all the expensive stores like gucci,cartier,prada,armani and many more.This street is alway full of people...turists,people that work there,teenagers with skateboards...A walk on this street will always relax you because you can so many differents things.
Great place for shopping . Nice avenue with a lot of luxury shops. And nice architecture buildings. Must to visit in Barcelona.

Beautiful boulevard. Passeig de Gracia is one of the most beautiful boulevards in Europe to have a stroll. You will find the great buildings designed by Gaudi like Casa Battlao and La Pedrera and other famous architects of his time. You will find luxury stores and restaurants and benches to relax.

So Nice. This Avenue is the Fifth Avenue of Barcelona. Clean & not congested, even though very busy. Lots of the usual high-end stores, and all kinds of restaurants & cafes in all
categories. We stayed at the Renaissance Hotel, one block from Gracia, and recommend
it for its location if nothing else.

Walking in style. Stunning road with top end shops, like Chanell, Hermes and Saint Laurent. Lots of eateries as well as sites such a La Pedrera that are open to the public.
Especially beautiful at night with very effective lighting throughout.

Shop till you drop. Coming from Canada with a despressed economy we found the shops most impressive. Also the architecture. Full of little restaurants of cafés. Nice stroll - watch your purse and bags. We saw one man who almost lost what he had in his shopping bag and created a huge scene on the street.
Trendy fashion street. A good walking tour with lots of restaurants and tapas bars and coffee places if you want to visit La Pedrera from Plaza Catalunya

Opulent street, high end Shopping, luxury hotels, and beautiful architecture. Located in the Eixample district which connects the old town with other areas, this street with wide boulevards, and lined with all things unique and opulent is considered the most expensive street in Barcelona. As one of the major avenues in Barcelona, this street is an important shopping and business destination, containing many of the city's most interesting pieces of architecture including two by Antoni Gaudi, La Pedrera and Casa Batlló. Also check out Casa Amatller. There are also Landmark hotels including the Hotel Majestic, along with very high end and expensive shops such as Stella McCartney, Prada, Valentino, Louis Vuitton, and you will also find some affordable shops on this street. There is shopping for everyone.
a must in BCN. nice avenue (the famous gaudi tiles)lots of attractions along the passeig.still it's very nice to wander into the barri itself:to watch the architecture and find wonderful restaurants.

Great place to walk and people watch. Wide, busy street with plenty of upmarket shops, cafe's and restaurants. A good spot to change between the hop on and off bus routes. Some interesting gaudy architecture also to be found. Well worth spending some time here.
A must in Barcelona. For modern archoitecture in Barcelona this street is not to be missed as many of the famous buildings are located on that street.

Nice street. Nice street with many stores and resturant.
The location is near Plaza Catalunya at the center of Barcelona.
I am not recommend to do in this street your shopping because it's cost more so just look by walking on the street.

A Must Visit Street. This a beautiful street and is so easy to reach by Metro. The street has a special feeling with beautiful crafted seats to rest on. It has Gaudi's Casa Battlo and La Parera. Shopping is plentiful and there are also many beautiful Restaurants and Pubs

A Beatiful Walk up the Passeig de Gracia. We walked up this avenue from the Gothic Section to our Aparthotel in the Gracias area. We saw all there was to see. Mother shopping, Gaudi' s architecture and beautiful buildings
This central Barcelona, so yo must t gp and wa;lk it.... A wonderful place to walk and see the beauty of Barcelona and Gaudi...the architecture and the shops are superb as well..
The Rodeo Drive of Barcelona.. Great shopping for men or women. Unique items for all. Nice parks and resturants, coffee houses or bars along the way.

The best!. It became my favourite promenade place. Walking along this long street you’ll see some high end stores, Casa Mila end other the most famous buildings, there are restaurants, an info office, a couple of McDonalds, Apple store, a few floors of a type the Bay store. And it leads to an old town and through the old part you’ll find yourself on the spectacular water front to continue walking or go to Aquarium there. Les Ramblas is not far from an Apple store and gorgeous squire with fountains. But it’s as crowded on Gracia.

beautiful buildings ,great shops' wonderful atmosphere. The street is full of Modernista buildings including Gaudi'sLa Pedrera and Casa Batllo .There are also many beautiful shops on this street like Chanel,Gucci,Swatch,Zara etc

Fancy window shopping . The street was clean and there were lots of famous brand which you could have look and enjoy your time by walking through this street. Of course evening would be good time for that.
Shop 'til you drop. Excellent selection. You can find international luxury brands side by side with young hearted fashion apparel. This is not for bargain hunters. Rents must be very high.

High End Shopping District. Lovely, crowded with tourists, walking area. Don't forget to walk into the high end stores so that the staff can turn up their noses at you. They don't have anything else to do, so be kind.

nice neighborhood. It's really a nice street with full of shops, cafes and hotels. Casa Battlo is also on this street. One should spent at least half a day here on this street. There are also very nice restaurants both on this street and nearby streets.
Great for nice and relaxed strolling. A very nice place to stroll for an hour. Beautiful buildings and great view of of the La Pedrera's façade.
High end shopping. If you have the budget for it, and enjoy high end shopping - this is the place to be. Beautiful stroll and window shopping, too.

Handsome looking street in main shopping area. One of the main streets in Barcelona with many shops, restaurants and bars. Easily accessible by metro. Lots of beautiful buildings to look at, definitely worth a look for free.

Filled with jaw dropping boutiques. Must be the most fashionable street in all of Spain, with high end boutiques stacked one after the other! It was fun peeking through the windows ... don't worry, there is a Starbucks where you can meet and catch up with your friends! Have fun!

A nice stroll. Not as busy as Las Ramblas with a lot of high end shops and some cafes. Also a beautiful fountain that changes light in the evening. From here you can also find Casa Battlo and La Pedrera architecture.

Not to be missed. If you are into high end shopping (clothing, jewelry, shoes, etc.) then this is the place for you. Even if you are not, you still want to go for the Gaudi architecture and several houses that can be visited.

Best on a working day, Sunday mornings are very slow, most shops and restaurants are closed. beautiful street with plenty of shops, restaurants, two modernists buildings - it goes uphill from the place Catalunyia so it is better to walk the street from top down to the sea

Stroll the Paseo at least once when in BCN. A stroll down Barcelona's most infamous boulevard is a must when in town. Window shop at luxury stores such as Chanel and Louis Vuitton. Visit one of Gaudi's house and admire the architecture.

More relaxed and less touristic than las Ramblas. Passeig de Gracia is an upmarket version of las Ramblas, less noisy and with less tourists. There are a lot of high end shops along the road and a few nice restaurants wehere you can have a nicecold or hot drink, though, in my opinion, you will need to go elsewhere if you are looking for quality drinks and food.

Scenic walk. The Passeig de Gracia is a lovely street to walk down. We started from the Pedrera after our visit there and walked to Placa Catalunya. In the Passeig de Gracia you will find the really expensive designer shops (we didn't even feel comfortable going in to look!). The Casa Batllo is a pretty sight to see. Not many cafes - you have to go down side roads, but it's a lot less busy than Las Ramblas and you can walk in a straight line to the waterfront.

Wander and stroll for hours. The Passeig de Gracia area is not to be missed as it has some of the most beautiful places to visit in the city such as the Gaudi duo of Casa Batilo and La Pedrera. The street is long but well worth a walk as you pass so many shops, cafes and sights such as one of the best fountains in the city that you should ensure you have a stroll both day and night to see the buzz of the city.
beautiful. One of the most famous avenue of the city. Many shops, people walking around. very beautiful buildings around! very nice to walk not depend on time.
Just a great area to visit.. This is just a great area in which to spend time. We love to walk and there is much to see and do on foot.

Window shopping mostly. Strolling here is encouraged and very enjoyable. Not the frenetic pace of Las Ramblas. Lined with most upscale chain stores found in most large cities but fun to window shop and good to buy when the Euro is weak.

Great Part of Barcelona to Visit. A more upscale part of town that Barri Gothic, this area also has a couple of the key Guadi residences you can visit. When we did, we picked out a cafe on the street near Casa Batllo and spent 4 wonderful hours, drinking eating and especially people watching. Great part of town to do that. Felt like I was in Paris at a cafe. Warm staff, good wine and beautiful people.
shopping. great avenue, clean, elegant and top shopping. enjoyable and not crouded. good to unwind from a very busy Barcelona
Modernism. A beautiful neighborhood. With amazing buildings back from the early 1900s. Gaudi really has amazing buildings. Very beautifull even to just pass by.
Beautiful area. The Passeig de Gracia area is beautiful, with so many wonderful buildings, shops, cafes and restaurants. Don't miss the Gaudi duo of Casa Batilo and La Pedrera.

Great location to stay at, shop, sightsee and eat!. We stayed on this street and there is a great map available...they call it the Luxury Promenade. Gaudi's Casa Batillo and La Pedrera are on this street as are great stores and restaurants.

Nice window shopping. Well it is worth walking just to see the price of cloth no one would want to be seen wearing, well most of them... It's a must do and worth the walk, what I would suggest is that you walk over diganol... Some lovely shops and buildings...that side that most people don't see...

Great place to visit!. It is wonderful with its boutiques, modernism houses, wide boulevards! Both La Pedreda and Casa Ballio are situated on this street, I can highly recommended to go there and feel the atmosphere, it is far away better than La Ramba. Here there is a stile and grace!

Better to use the sightseeing buses. We walked this street in a rainy day, the street is quiet long and encompasses good dress brands, both Spanish and others. Also there is the house of the reputable Spanish painter. I suggest you take a sightseeing bus and go around all the city. There are two routes, one goes to this street and another to the other half of the city especially Barceloneta area, near the port and Mediterranean sea.

Great Location. We stayed in a hotel on the Passeig de Gracia, and it is wonderful shopping, if your budget is up to it. Most of the world's famous fashion houses are located on this street. Regardless, it is a very pleasant to stroll up or down this street, possibly visiting Gaudi's famous attractions that are located on or immediately adjacent to the street.
Great Shopping and Dining in Barcelona. Fun Shopping and eating tapas in-between visits to La Pedrera and La Sagrada Familia. I had a great time
Best street for Delicious food and shopping . It is the greatest street for shopping and restaurants that i found in barcelona . You can find all well known brands and

Beautiful Avenue in Barcelona. This is a beautiful wide avenue with many interesting shops and buildings. People that we met who stayed in a hotel situated on this avenue loved it. There is a large Metro station present so it is readily accessible.
Don't miss!. One of the most beatifull "calles" of Barcelona.Just walk or have a seat or shopping you will feel the catalunians athmosphere!

Barcelona's Champs Elysees. Luxery boutiques, famous Gaudi buildings and broad boulevard with countless little restaurants and tapas place. Fantastic to start your trip and gettting city to know. Go up to Catalunya place and then to Ramblas, have a glass with little tapas here and there - pleasure guaranteed!

This is what Las Ramblas wishes it could be.... Our first day in Barcelona, we walked down Las Ramblas, and I was really dismayed at how tacky it felt in parts. Passeig de Gracia, on the other hand, is a great place to stroll, window-shop, and people-watch. Gorgeous architecture, broad avenues, some excellent tapas places--hard to beat it as a place to while away an early afternoon.

Incredible architecture to be enjoyed on this avenue.. I don't enjoy shopping, but there is something on this street for everyone. I was dazzled by the architectural masterpiece lining this avenue, including some of Gaudi's masterpieces. Even if you don't have time to go inside, just seeing them from the street is worthwhile.

Classy end of town. We've stayed on the Passeig de Gracia a few times now and spent the majority of our time on and around its streets. The shops are amazing and there are some really nice cafe's and bars.
good street. On this street is everything and it is beautiful every day i used to visit this street to get to plaza Catalonia

Such a lovely boulevard. This is such an amazing place to walk in Barcelona. Is quite large, with shops all around and wonderful buildings. On this boulevard you can find Casa Batllo and Casa Mila-La Pedrera by Antony Gaudi. It connects Plaza Catalunya with the Gracia Barrio which is one of the most beautiful "Cartier" in Barcelona. Once you've seen it once you will come back again and again just for a relaxing walk. It is quite crowded during the day but early mornings and evenings is the perfect place to be.
Lots of shopping!!!. If you love high end fashion and shopping, this is your place to be...Beautifully lined with restaurants, hotels and lots of shopping!! Zara , mango, diesel etc.

The city tour bus trips, architecture everywhere is just stunning topped with a visit to the beach BARCELONA has it ALL!. We had the best holiday ever here , loved the place the city the beach Barcelona has it all and will be back soon x

Wonderful modernista architecture. We didn't go to Passeig de Gracia for shopping as many do, but for the architecture and eateries. The sight of Gaudi's Casa Batllo with Cadafalch's Casa Amatller next door is extraordinary, and there are other buildings just a few doors down with beautiful modernista façades. Casa Batllo was well worth the visit, but unfortunately we were too late for a tour of Casa Amatller.We enjoyed people watching while having tea on one of the café's terraces. The previous evening we had had dinner at one of the restaurants on the street, but it isn't the best area for dining.

El famoso paseo. As fancy as all the reviews that write about it. Very good examples of modernista architecture (La Pedrera, Batllo). Easily reachable using public transportation. A bit of a tourist trap as naturally, all tourist flock to it.

One of the most beautiful boulevards in Barcelona. One of the main streets in Barcelona with most of top designers shops from Chanel to Diesel. It is very pleasant just to walk along and watch the gorgeous buildings and well dressed citizens and tourists. There are also plenty of good restaurants (pricey, naturally). This is also the street where are situated gorgeous Casa Batllo and La Pedrera.

Fine architecture. Architecturaly rich part of Barça, with many magnificent buildings.
Very nice for relaxing walk.
Also, good for shopping.

People Watchers Paradise. Beautiful wide boulevard with amazing architecture and character buildings. Some of the shops are definitely high end, including Loewe, Armani, laboutin etc. For those of us with smaller budgets there are more affordable shops but not many in the middle budget range. There are plenty of cafes to stop at and enjoy an ice cream, pastry or a glass of something cool. The point of the place is strolling and soaking up the people and the atmosphere.
A designers' dream spot. Lovely for shopping and browsing & people watching & we were lucky we were staying there too! Not 1 but 2 buildings designed by Gaudi, an easy walk to La Rambla.
Shopping Heaven. It has all the shops your heart can desire, from Zara to Jimmy Choo.It also has great places to eat something whether it be lunch or dinner or just a snack.
