Barcelona's Champs Elysee. It's with no doubts the most elegant and classy street in Barcelona. an endless very wide street just off Catalonia Square which homes the high end brands shops. Lots of restaurants and cafes are nestled there too. So if you're opting for brands shopping this is your go to place. You may enjoy Gaudi's works as this street hosts two of them. The street is really chic even if shopping is not your goal you may still enjoy a walk or even a drink or a meal. A must visit area.
Nice stroll. Pleasant walk down this street of interesting buidings and expensive shops, no real need to go into either to enjoy the experience.

Great place to potter. A classy street in Barcelona! Tree lined with loads of eateries on the way. Marvellous shops including the very expensive. A great place to amble on a sunny day and visit amazing attractions on this route.

Classy boulevard. Well designed major blvd with all the top designer shops - busy with traffic but very manageable as it's generously wide & has lots of trees. Includes the two Gaudi houses & other impressive architecture but on a grander scale than the adjacent streets such as Rambla de Catalunya which has a more relaxed character.

Have plenty of money. If you want to find any thing and you have a deep pocket with plenty of money this is the place to go to. The best jewels can be purchased here. Also, gorgeous buildings planned by Gaudí will accompany you while you are carrying your shopping bags

Shopping. Wonderful for shopping and eating but make sure you have plenty of euros with you it is not for those on a budget, although if you fancy pushing the boat out the El National is well worth it for dinner or even for drinks the atmosphere is amazing in there.
Loved it!. Was the most impressive boulevard in Barcelona. Great window shopping for Chanell and Gucci and fun people watching. A VERY clean street too! Lots of space for Europe!

Great area. Our hotel was located in this area so we spent a lot of time here. It has many high end shopping retailers and grrat cafes and restaurants. It also has a fair share of expensive, poor quality restaurants, so I'd recommend you read reviews before you pick a place to eat.Gaudi's Casa Mila and Battlo are located on this street and are beautiful, worth a visit!

Art and shopping. This is the answer from Barca-City to any famous shopping road in the world! Here you find any top-brand-store worth while visiting! Spiced up with Gaudis buildings! A happy day with art and shopping.

Nice place but expensive. It is a really good place for walking around, but prepare to spend money if you want to visit the monuments that it has.The restaurants are varied, you can find very different ones.

Cash & Credit cards gladly accepted!. Shopping along Barcelona's grand Passeig de Gràcia means being right in the heart of the center of town, where you'll be taking in a breathtaking modernist building one minute and the next dodging others out for a walk, in a hurry to get somewhere, or doing their own spending. From the biggest brand names to the most affordable, from the exclusive shops to those open to everyone, you're bound to find a treasure to carry home that suits your taste and fits your budget.
Shopping paradise. A shopper's paradise...!!! Brands, names, firms...big...bigger... Expencive shops but also cheaper ones. Variety of styles and qualities. You will surely find what you need here.

GREAT PEOPLE WATCHING IN THE HEART OF BARCELONA. The most elegant shopping street in Barcelona! Be sure to bring your credit cards...Lots of elegant shops and great restaurants..Excellent people watching

Shopping. Very large street with all kind of luxurious shops. Sart at, for example at the left, go all the way, eat at a restaurant or bar and go back at the right side of the street. And do not forget the two Gaudi houses!
Try not to run into people while looking up ;-). Rivals the Champs Élysées. Beautiful architecture and wide sidewalks make this street worth the walk.
Great place to spend your day. Love this place. We would sit for hours hanging out and watching everyone pass by. Dont forget great shops and food. Ah the food!

There were two entrances. There were two entrances in this building, one is for those who purchased online ticket or for those who willing to take long queue to purchase for tickets. Another entrance is priority lane, you just pay a little extra and you can save your time in queueing for ticket.

Passeig de Gracia. Passeig de Gràcia is one of the major avenues in Barcelona and one of its most important shopping and business areas, containing several of the city's most celebrated pieces of architecture
Shopping. If u r shopping addict and search for high end fashion brands .. it is ur district !! Elegant street with many many stores to shop
Pg de Gracia. Long, beautiful avenue with many architectural sites to regard. Beautiful store fronts with lots of sidewalk restaurants, tree lined and quite clean.

A Spanish Regent a Street. A popular street, the Barcelona equivalent of regent street, it isn't quite Oxford Street (Las Ramblas) but it's still worth a look and bustling with designer and high street labels.
Day or Evening visit. Everything on this Major avenue draws you to stroll and visit. Attractions line the street restaurants, shopping, bars, and great people watching.

Elegance on a wide avenue. Oh happiness. This wide avenue is lined with elegant shops,a Gaudi-designed house the crowds line up to visit, and has an air of refinement. It also has a shop we would love in the U.S., Zara Home. Amble about and into the shops.

A must to get the Barcelona experience. It's just basically the high end avenue full of stores and cafes, all of the fancy boutiques are on this street. While it includes mostly international high end boutiques, it's still a very nice shopping experience and most importantly, the architecture is beautiful. Some gorgeous buildings on Paseo de Gracia.

Don't Miss Gracia Community. Gracia is such a wonderful friendly neighborhood and we were lucky enough to be there for all the celebrations on Aug 15-22 every year when all the streets compete in decorating the area! Great street party!
Barcelona 2014. Shopping around this place was fascinating. I would recommend for any serious tourist to ensure they see this place.

Beautiful architecture. Incredible architecture in both sides of this Avenue. Nice to see during the day and at night. During the day hours you will be able to see the details of the buildings and do some window shopping ot real shopping. Go in the mall called Boulevard Rosa. It has lots of littile designer' stores with amazing stuff! Great clothing, shoes and complements!;-) At night this avenue is magical with all the buildings lit up. There are also lots of restaurants and tapas bar. Have dinner in one of them. Sit outside like a truly Barcelonian! We love terraces!;-)

Passeig de Gracia...where all the beautiful people go to be seen. If like me you like shopping and looking for something special , then this is the place to be. Love it ! Got everything going for this location, restaurants, shops , it's own quieter and classy La Rambla, called La Rambla Catalunya.

Go for a walk. This is a nice street to walk and shop, maybe stop and eat. There are a ton of big shops, you might not necessarily find something local and unique but if you're in the mood for some retail therapy it's a great place to go.

Shopping, shopping, shopping!!!. So many stores, so little time and money. I had such a fantastic time going into many of these stores. I found that even in the high end stores, we were treated nicely which was a nice change from some other places we've visited.

if you have time to walk in Barca, go there and you won't be disappointed. every street of Barcelona is worthy to see. But especially this place! you'll find everything you want: from restaraunts to cafes, lux shops and souvenir stores

Wonder along this lively street with all the top shops and we stopped at the Perfume Museum and the Casa Batllo.. The design of the buildings all along this area is unique and we'll worth seeing. We walked down to Placa Catalunya and then through El Gotic

Rodeo Drive of Barcelona?. There a number of high end stores and too many restaurants to count! Two of Gaudi's houses (fee required) that are open to the public for touring are on this street. Definitely worth checking out the shops and people!

Amazing street. The Passeig de Gràcia is a must-visit. The street starts at the Plaça Catalunya and continue north until the Diagonal. It is lined with shops, restaurants, and historic sites. I especially like the block with the Casa Batlló, an incredible Gaudí house, and the Casa Amatller, another gem of architecture. The street seems busy all the time, even at 3am! It should be on anyone´s list of sites to see in Barcelona.
Small but nice. Gracia is a small area in Barcelona compared to some of its counterparts but there is still history and things for everyone to enjoy and explore.

The Grand Boulevard of Barcelona. Great People watching and beautiful architecture. Shops for every desire, & fancy Hotels. Stops for sightseeing buses, connections to the subway system & great bike paths.

The Barcelona version of Oxford street. This is the Main Street for designer and chain shops , including zara, mange and nike. It is a pleasant walk from the main square up a wide street, so easy to stroll along. The street also takes you past the gaudi buildings, which you can't miss due to the many tourists taking photos
Passeig de Gracia. What a wonderful street, and the most expensive in the whole of Spain. I just love walking up and down here.
Overcrowded. Nice street to walk, very beautiful. But when it becomes overcrowded, it can feel annoying trying to make your way into the mass of people

The heart of Barca. All the top brands are along this stretch, the beautiful tree lined streets and breeze, hop on hop off buses are available here,makes for a happy stroll. If you're up for a long but enjoyable walk, go all the way down to Plaza de Catalunya and keep going until you reach the sea..Its worth it.
Shopping. As we were with our two daughters, I can say they were very happy to stay just off the passeig de gracia and the shops benefitted from them too!
Window shopping - or not!. Stroll along Barcelona's gracious Passeig de Gracia admiring the designer clothes and goods on display. Stop for coffee or glass of wine and watch the world go by.
Shops and more!!. Great for shopping and strolling along down to Plaza de Catalunya and also seeing the Gaudi building.
Nice shopping. Good selection of high end shopping and a nice mix of eateries across the wide walkways. If you want shopping, here's a good place.

Passage De Gracia. Awesome place to be in and around also. So much to see and do. Eating , walking, touring, chilling, shopping. It's all there.
Bus tours and cycles. Fab restaurants everywhere also. Great culture. No pickpockets anywhere to be seen. We were warned of this but never ever saw any goings on regarding pick pockets.
Fab place to be in.
Best place to stay. The main street with plenty of shops, restaurants and plenty of walking. 15 minutes away from the Rambla and gothic area. Close to everything.

Large, impressive, hosting Casa Mila and Casa Battlo. The large boulevard hosts shops of the luxury brands, banks and luxury hotels. The cleanliness is impressive with all the tourists. There are a lot of impressive buildings (e.g. Gaudi's Casa Mila and Battlo) you can visit.

Passeig de Gracia, Barcelona, is a party!!!!. Passeig de Gracia, is a central avenue, in a extremely well located part of Barcelona. Fany stores, charmiing Hotels, great places to eat, having a tapas dinner, and see beautiful people, and also to be seen. I hardly recomend Magestic Hotel and Condes de Barcelona Hotel. Beth cozy, clean, excelent service, and cair prices.
shopping paradise. nice area. good shopping places. you cannot miss this area. fantastic for shopping and some quick snacks in between
Paris in Barcelona. This is a beautiful street, with high end shops and hotels, which illustrates the great planning the architects did when they redesigned how they wanted Barcelona to be.
A must-stroll while visiting Barcelona!. A nice walk, stunning architecture and fabulous shopping. . . Definitely a must-stroll while visiting Barcelona!
enjoable walk. it was on the corner of our avenida palace hotel. we enjoyes walking and looking the nice building and shops.
Brands. I call it brands Street basically it has most of the brand companies and restaurants between them.nice avenue to walk in and do some shopping

If you love shopping.... If you love to visit the expensive fashion shops, take a walk in Passeig de Gracia, and jump from Armani to Guess. You can find the glamour and the charm of Barcelona, and you can diacover emblematic shops as well.
Nice. Wear comfortable shoes and just enjoy walking and sight see at Passeig de Gracia. Twice we did this and it' s not same . There is always something to discover each time.
great to walk around. Great stroll for people watching and window shopping. Lots of nice boutiques and chain stores to choose from.

Cool shopping with some gorgeous landmarks along the way. We walked up and down the main street a few times, and it has a commerical feel to it, but accented with beautiful landmarks (fountains, sculptures) along the intersections. Worth a visit on your first trip to Barcelona, or worst several if you're there to shop :)

Luxury !. This big and wide street has everything , all the luxury of the world is there !
Restaurants and shopping. We enjoyed walking this street!
High End Shopping. If you are looking to shop for the top name brands than this is your kind of place. Plenty of designer brand shops and restaurants.

The luxury face of Barcelona. All big international brands are located on this big street. Very good restaurants, Cafes.Also La Pedrara and Casa Battlo is on this street. At one of the end begins the Gothic center. Don't dismiss.

Shopping area. Starting from the entrance of Passeig de Garcia metro station and going all the way down to Placa de Catalunya there are a lot of shops and boutiques. You can find here everything from Armani to H&M. Nice restaurants on your way so you can treat yourself after the shopping.
The center of it all. This street has everything from designer shops to restaurants and an amusement carnival. You want to be close to it and connect to all areas of town!

Big street, big brands. Most of the major brands are on this street. I really enjoyed walking around Passeig de Gracia because of the very wide sidewalks. It was also very interesting to venture into the sidestreets where there's plenty of other shops and cute coffee places.

How is your wallet?. Remember: don't walk here with your woman...too many places to finish your money by shopping....For me it was like Champs Elyses in Paris: the same shops, the same prices, the same luxury...

Breathtaking architecture. A long, wide boulevard that features some of the most famous buildings of Barcelona, some by Gaudi. The architecture is colourful, magical and full of vibrant colours, definitely a must-see for all art lovers.Passeig de Gracia is also known as a great shopping place, but shopping too posh for an average visitor ;) However, don't be afraid to stop over for coffee somewhere along the way - the prices are the same as in other areas of Barcelona.

Nice wide boulevard. Good for a nice walk from Plaça Catalunya with interesting buildings along the way, ranging from the Casa Batlló, Casa Milà to the Majestic Hotel with a nice rooftop view. The view by day and by night are quite different, so feel free to walk up and down twice!

A street to spend time to enjoy. This street is similar to 5th Ave. in NYC, a lot of high end stores to shop or window shop. Gaudi's famous buildings are also on this street. There are also good side walk cafes to stop and enjoy Tapas and drinks.

Stroll along the avenue. Our VRBO apartment was one block off Passeig de Gracia so we walked down this avenue many times. There seemed to be something new to see everytime. The trees provide shade there are lots of high end shops, interesting mosaic seats and lamp posts. The Gaudi buildings as well as the other fabulous buildings and balconies make it a pleasant stroll. Take time to sit at a cafe and people watch. They are mostly tourists, but from all over the world and walks of life.

High end shops, magnificent architecture. Strolling from north to south on this very wide boulevard, you will see almost every high-end fashion retailer on either side, some in unique storefronts or buildings, and you also have some classic Barcelona building styles and a few by Gaudi as well. Worth a half-hour, connects near Las Ramblas at Plaza Catalunya.

You have to walk this area, but don't expect to see many locals. Great for a casual stroll. Be sure to stop and have coffee or wine and tapas along the way. Tends to be full of tourists and the shops and restaurants tend to be geared at the tourists more than the locals.
Good for shopoholics and achitecture buffs. If you have the time wander down this strip. Great architecture, shopping that will make you drool and great cafes. You can do it in about an hour.
..... Best place to stay. Lots to see and do. See review of City Hotel. Really close to Gaudi designed house and on the City bus tour route.

A great mixture of bars, shops, interesting buildings and restaurants. The street seems to combine some of the finest fashion brand stores seamlessly with great street bars and restaurants and a couple of very popular Gaudi buildings. It does get very busy at peak times but its a great place to sit down, buy a cold people and just watch people passing by.
Touched by God!. Amazing that Gaudi had such a vision! To see it come so far in 15 years is just amazing!Could only buy tix online during high season August

PASSEIG DE GRACIA IS THE STREET OF GAUDÍ. The Paseig de Graia Avenue is the street more commercial and cosmopolitan Barcelona. You will find the best shops in the city and several buildings of the important architect Gaudí. Paseig de Gracia combines the atmosphere of the avant-garde and tmodern Barcelona with the Barcelona in early 20th century. It is the stately union of Diagonal full of cars with the crowded Plaza Catalunya. A leisurely stroll down this street is missed if you visit Barcelona.
Great. We stayed at the hotel, eat at the restaurants, visited musuems and Guadi artworks, took the sub, took bus and shop shop shop, all on this Minutes away street !
Central Location. Great area to visit, in a central location with plenty of shops, restaurants and beautiful buildings.

Beautiful and busy walk way. We traversed the Passeig de Gracia many times and there was always something new to see. Lovely trees with good shade, interesting mosaic seats, lots of fabulous buildings and balconies. Plenty of eateries, shops and souvenir stalls.
Nice place. Specially in august if you are lucky you can see the festivals they decorate streets and stay all night singing walking in parades

Cannot speak highly enough, Superb !. We were pleasantly surprised by the quality of this hotel, our room, a Junior suite, was magnificent almost to the point that we were reluctant to leave and enjoy the rest of the city.

Every building is an architectural marvel. Is totally absurd and delusional that every building you see on the Passeig de Gracia, no matter how mundane its purpose, say, a bank, a restaurant or a house of government, are true wonders of architecture and works of art.

Pretty street. Barcelona in itself already has a beautiful architecture. When we saw Passeig de Gracia, it was what we expected. Classy street. The shopping area with a touch of Antoni Gaudi. Lots of food places as well. Very picturesque and a nice place to frolic. I was just glad that I have already done my shopping in Paris, so I didn't get to do any damage in this street.

What can i say !!!!!!!!. A beautiful place to soak up a number of things.... if you like shopping it's great, architecture is great, just absorbing the history is great ..... you should go ..... it's GREAT
Good shopping and great arcitecture. Apart from shopping, this is where you go to see Gaudis work. Also I just afore the art nouveau benches with the lampposts.

One of my fav streets in the world.. One of my favourite streets in the world with its particular paving and beautiful light posts. Wander along and whether you are in to brand shopping or not, it is just the gorgeous atmosphere of old Barcelona and the stunning architecture that can be found on this street. Stroll arm in arm with one of your favourite people to make it even more memorable.

A great street to visit. Passeig de Gracia is a great place to visit for both the Gaudi buildings and architecture as well as the shopping. Its the shopping alley of Barcelona with most of the brands normal as well as high end.

Lovely wide street with lots of designer shops, cafes etc. Very lively street day and night.. We were staying on this street so very convenient and lucky enough to have sales on during our stay. Very busy during July and August

A long, but leisurely walk. What can you say? Great Gaudi buildings intermixed in world-class designer stores. Continue down to the funkier Les Rambles, and with a detour into the Gothic Quarter, and you get a real flavor of Barcelona in one long walk. Take the Metro back ;-)

Very nice. The street preserved all the street lights from the great age of the Belle Epoque, which are really nice, and there are so many nice buildings to see and visit there (the three houses Batllo, Amatler and Lleo Morera, and others) that this street is really worth a good visit.

Pretty European street. It's a typical street that has a charming European feel to it. I personally prefer it at night as it has such a romantic and quiet aura to it with all the fancy hotels and the cute ceramic seats for passerby pedestrians.
Everything about Barcelona is gorgeous.

Cool, chic ambience. Come here for a) upmarket shopping, b) Modernista architecture, c) cool, chic ambience. There are two main Modernista sites: Casa Batllo and adjacent buildings, and la Pedrera. Both are within 10 minutes walk of Placa Catalunya. Even the pavements have Modernests tiles. There are very classy shops here, and an atmosphere of elegance and luxury. If you get too hot or tired, either retire to one of the many bars, cafes, restaurants on the Passeig itself, or walk a block over to the West to Rambla de Catalunya.

When in Barcelona, don't miss the Passeig de Gracia. This is a must when you visit Barcelona. Look at the nice shops, look at the people walking by at have a drink and a snack or a coffee and a cake at one of the many terraces and let it all sink in.This is just a great experience.
Fantastic !. Really nice avenue with lots of shops and restaurants!! Highly recommend ciudad condal for local tapas!! Probably the best in town...
Amazing shopping. Delightful street to walk through with every designer shop imaginable.You can visit La Predrera here and see other Gaudi inspired buildings. Easy access via the metro.
Interesting. We went on Sunday morning, which was the best time to go. There were not many people about so we could walk freely

Excitment abounds!. Shopping, sights, and food, food food! An entire day could be spent exploring Gracia. With high end stores and beautiful buildings lining the street, there is plenty to see and do on this lovely, albeit crowded, avenue.

High End Shopping Area. One of the Mail thoroughfares in Barcelona. This is an upscale street with cafes everywhere, high end stores, banks and hotels. Some very nice restaurants tucked in too. Definitely a nice area to walk around and easy to navigate. Comparable to London and Paris (though much smaller), as al the same stores, so not much that seems authentic to Barcelona.
Normal. Big avenue going tO Plasa de Cataluna...nothing special to say...may be, not to forget to have a look to the two buidings built by Gaudi...

Full of life and style. If you want to go shopping, or admire the arhitectura of the city, this is the right place to go......a lot of passing by-ers, and a lot of shopping establishments, almost for every pocket
The place to be !!. If shopping is your aim,make this part of your day !! Great stores,people watching, a cultural melange. It's all happening here.
Shopping district. This area is great for people watching, it has a lot of the stores you would find in any large american city.

Bonito, pero ajetreado/ Nice, but busy. Es una calle muy bonita, con edificios preciosos, así como amplia para pasear, pero hay taaaaaaanta gente en ella entre turistas y gente de compras que, a veces, agobia.
It's a pretty street, with really nice buildings, as well as wide sidewalk for walk, but there're soooooo many people there between tourists and shopping addicts that, sometimes, it's stifling.

A nice visit. The area is nice for shopping, strolling around, seeing architecture, or just people watching. This is one of the stops on the metro, so it's easy to get to if need. There are several floors' the it is an interesting experience and is worth the visit!.

Must walk it down!!. One of the most beautiful streets in Barcelona. Beware of toursists, especially if you drive: they don't care if the lights are red and if they are invading the cicling path. Also they stop in mass in front of art nouveau buildings (especially gaudi's ones).If you have time, have a glass at the roof terrace of Condes de Barcelona Hotel, terrific views of the Pedrera House.
Fashion, Gaudi Masterpieces, and a Charming Boulevard. You can' t miss Paseo de Gracia, it' s the art of the shopping, of Casa Batlo and La Pedrera, 2 incredibles, out of the box Gaudi Buildings.

Very nice shopping street. It is a very nice shopping street. You can find wide street and a huge path to walk around.The shops are the usual brands that you can find around the world.The only mall that it is really Spanish specific is El Corte Engles that you can find at the end of the street.

A good place for some retail therapy. This grand street makes for a very pleasant, if traditional, shopping experience, in contrast to the winding lanes of the Old City. Both sides are lined with shopping opportunities, familiar and new. Along the way look out for a couple of Gaudi's creations, one on each side of the street. Just look for the tourists with cameras! Break up the visit with lunch at one of the many fixed-price restaurants, offering three courses for very reasonable prices. Some are located in the streets parallel to Gracia, within a few blocks. There is easy access from the subway.

Pleasant to stroll. But be sure to keep your wits about you-situational awareness! Interesting architecture and shops and cafes. We had a mediocre gelato- I am sure there are better. Enjoyed meandering.

Shopping and Gaudi. Over a kilometer long, this tree lined, upmarket street is one of the major shopping streets in Barcelona. Furthermore, one can visit two of Gaudi's famous buildings, Casa Mila and Casa Batelo, which are just off the Passeig de Gracia.
Great district. A beautiful street with all those Gaudi houses and amazing shops. A beautiful area to just walk and watch.
Beautiful street. What a lovely street to walk, stroll or shop. The wide tree lined street with it's Gaudi inspired street lamps was reminiscent of the Champs Elysee.
Full with shops and restaurants. It was close enough to our hotel. my friend and i stayed in Granvia hotel. It's a nice area full with shops and restaurants. You'll find everything you need.
Amazing area. Best area to stay in...high end shops are there.. Resterants.. I think it's the best place to stay in.
Enjoyable & Relaxing. We really enjoyed our time strolling the avenue. Great shops, sidewalk food & beverage and people watching.

Shopping area. It's basically the shopping area of Barcelona where you'll find the designer stores. Similar to Michigan Ave in Chicago. But you'll also come across Gaudi's La Pedrera. Wear comfortable shoes and watch out for cars.
A nice place to slow down and take a walk.. A long and wide street with cafes and shopping. There are different tourist sites to visit on this street. The architecture you will see is unbelievable.

Hold on to your pockets. Nice, beautiful area but both my husband and brother almost had their wallets removed from their pockets. Both men caught them before they were removed all the way but the young people got away. It kind of puts a damper on the evening.

Passeig de Gracia is cool and police in Barcelona is lazy and useless.. Be careful in the evening and after dark. Do not allow anyone in your company to carry a backpack in Barcelona.Be aware of any people behind you, and those who get on the scooter. The most common attack is when they roll scooter with motor off at a distance behind you so you are not aware that they are approaching and than very close to you turn o the motor, cut out or grab your backpack and yank it out off you draging and throwing the holder to the ground. Of course police in Barcelona is useless and even if oyu see them most likely they are not going to help you. If you go to the police station be prepared to be told to come back tomorrow because a person that speaks your language is not there at the moment. They will not allow you to fill a police report because it will look bad on Barcelona statistics.
Lovely place for a walk. This place is amazing for a walk, but if you get really near to la Rambla, better be careful, it's a crowded place and the locals say that is a good place for pickpockets.
Great shops and nice street. I'd suggest eating a little away from this street, but it is great for a quick drink, browsing fancy shops and checking out major chain shops too.

Stroll on the side alleys. Sure, Passeig de Gràcia has the more known and expensive brands but the street also inhabits various kinds of architecture. Starting from moderne, to old, to very detailed ... everyhing is side by side.But if you intend to go shopping, sure, you can go there, but I would rather suggest the side alleys for more spanish brands you didn't know before. Strolling aside never hurt nobody. Just try it and you won't be disappointed.If you don't buy anything, the Passeig de Gràcia doesn't cost you anything ;-)

The key address in Barcelona . Passeig de Gracia is a very long and wide street with various restaurants/cafes and shops. There's all type of shopping from high end to low end. There's a few must visit sites on the street itself and they're done by the famous Catalan icon, Gaudi. Casa Mila and Casa Bastlo are not far from one another and do get crowded.I would advice staying at Passige de Gracia of not staying by the beach, and two great hotel choices are Mandarin Oriental hotel and Hotel Omm

Magnificent. This is where you understand the competition between Madrid and Barcelona as far as the beauty of the city is concerned! I was going somewhere else and I luckily got lost ending up on this boulevard. When I realised how beautiful the place was, I was so grateful I got lost... I was so caught in the beauty of this place, that I didn't even remember where I was going before making a mistake with the map!
Nice Street. Very nice street full of shopping stores. You will find most the high quality brand here but of course the prices are pretty high
Great shopping street. We spent our last day in Barcelona at Passeig de Gracia. It's a great area for shopping and less tourists than other places like Rambla or Catalunya.

Shop till you drop. All the international brands are found here, this street also has many top Spanish brands and ateliers. Combined with interesting and great restaurants, you will not waste anytime if you are time challenged when visiting Barcelona.The architecture of the buildings and the street life makes it an interesting walk. It is also safe!

Better than Las Ramblas. For an excellent stroll in Barcelona, look no further than Passeig de Gracia. This is probably the most beautiful street in the city, with all the main attractions, like Casa Mila and Casa Battlo situated on it, in the most beautiful neighborhood of Barcelona of Eixample. I personally preferred a stroll down this street more than any other, and certainly more so than Las Ramblas, which runs parallel to it, but in the more southern part of the city. It is a big street, with some space for bicyclists, and not too crowded (like the tourist trap Las Ramblas). If you are into taking pics, this street is not to be missed.

Nice shopping street. If you like to shop, this is the best place and for your secret info that the rolex here is the cheapest in west europe so don't miss out. i will sure come here again for my next rolex. hahaha!

The right amount of perfect!. I loved this street! It's Barcelona's Champs-Elysees, but more fun, in my opinion. Start at the Ave Diagonal and walk down to Les Ramblas/Barri Gotic. So many designer shops, brand shops, cafes, restaurants, and of course, the architecture by Gaudi and his contemporaries. The block between Carrer d'Arago and Carrer del Consell de Cent is called the Manzana de la Discordia where you have four buildings designed by Modernista architects including Gaudi. It is also very nice to take a stroll in the evening when Casa Batllo's lights are on.

Pass time Pleasantly on the Passeig de Gracia. We enjoyed many evening strolls down the gracious, wide boulevard that is Passeig de Gracia. We also visited Casa Morera and Casa Batllo and would have visited La Pedrera if we had had more time. A tour guide advised that shopping prices were a bit steep in the many shops that line the road so we spent our time visiting its architectural gems instead.
An Elegant Street to Meander at Night. Just a elegant street at night with modern shops but such elegant architecture. Were some street traders but were quickly dispersed by police.

Wow. We stepped off the metro station at Av Diagonal to walk Passeig de Graciana and just couldn't believe the sights. Don't just look up at the beautiful buildings encasing the likes of Tiffany, Hugo Boss etc, look at the pavements, the lamp posts, it's all wonderful, right down to the most minute detail. Yes it's busy, yes it's touristy but great fun to people watch and take in the splendour of the beautiful city. If you walk down to the bottom it brings you into Placa Catalunya which is the heart of the city and where you will find metros, Rodales and buses.

Shopping, eating and people watching. This is street north of the famous Las Ramblas and the Placa de Catalunya and it is full of high end shopping and a variety of food. It also contains many of the Gaudi buildings of interest. Note that shops close relatively early compared to restaurants and bars, and things are very slow in the morning. Note the places that serve breakfast if you want to eat out in the morning.

Wonderful street. The street is beautiful with many small surprises here and there (look for details!!). Unfortunately, I used all my time there in shopping and I regret now. There are many shops there with many lovely brands. However, I recommend everyone to just walk down the street and take it all in, instead of shop like I did! It is a wonderful street.

Always fun to walk along Barcelona's most upscale avenue!. Starting at Plaza Catalunya and designed by Gaudí, this tree-lined avenue, with its ornate wrought-iron lamp-posts and tiled benches, connects the Ciutat Vella (old city) with the quaint neighbourhood of Gràcia (formerly a town on the outskirts of the city). While reminiscent of the Champs Elysées, with its sidewalks lined with designer shops, fancy hotels, and upscale eateries, the exquisite façades and ornate balconies of its beautiful buildings are fabulous examples of Catalan Modernisme at its most impressive -- especially the "Manzana de la Discordia," the block between Consell de Cent and Aragó streets, which boasts Gaudí's Batlló House next to Puig i Cadafalch's Casa Amatller and Domènech i Montaner's Lleó i Morera house on the corner, all vying for grandeur and well worth a visit. Gaudí's La Pedrera is only a couple of blocks away, on the other side of the street. It is worth going into some of the shops just to admire the beautifully designed interiors. Located in the heart of the Eixample district, a leisurely walk up and down Passeig de Gràcia is mandatory, at least once.

Upscale Shopping and Overpriced Sidewalk Cafes. I love Barcelona but this is not my favorite part of the city.Like one reviewer called it Barcelona's version of the champs elysees of Paris. I agree. Tourists bumping into each other, high end stores you can find all over the world and very high priced sidewalk cafes. And I was there in April!Yes, there are the Gaudi buildings, great access to the underground metro and trains....it's city central. Our B%B was located right off the blvd. on Mallorca. a much quieter location so we walked this ave. every day.

GREAT PEOPLE WATCHING!. Loads of fancy shmancy shops, little cafe's, restaurants and stores, great place to just sit back and relax and watch people pass by, love the very European looking wide avenue, and perched on a double decker bus it was more intriguing! Reminded me of 5th Avenue in New York but with prettier architecture!

Barcelona love. I love the architecture you find all along the promenade of Passeig de Gracia. If you like Gaudi you will love the little pop up surprises along the avenue, benches, lamp posts, and of course the famouse Gaudi buildings.

Barcelona's version of champs élysées. If you like champs élysées in Paris then you'd love this or if you haven't seen that then see this. All major brands and retailers are here and it's very high class. A great place to walk around and admire the beauty and a great place to meet up. From here you can travel to anywhere in Barcelona as it has good connections and metro. Would recommend visiting it. Case mila and casa battlo are here too.
High End Shopping. Great street for shopping. A lot of high end shops and also some museum homes to visit. A lot like the Champs-Elysees in Paris.
Fun street to stroll!. Just walk down it and take in the sights, sounds, shops, people, and architecture of beautiful Barcelona!
BEAUTIFUL Passeig!!!. The shop are soooo great here . many many beautiful building . the road are so clean and the air from the sea bring new energy for continues buying !!!

The heart of the city. Our train from Castelldefels brought us here and this is the station we used as our hub to explore the city. From here you can go almost anywhere you need to. And above ground the Passeig de Gracia is a wonderful thoroughfare boasting modernist architecture, great restaurants and shops. Leading down to the Placa de Catalunya and La Ramblas beyond, this was an area we kept coming back to to soak up and enjoy the atmosphere of Barcelona.

A Grand Avenue. Although the designer shops and jewelry stores are internationally known and located everywhere in the world, Passeig de Gracia is still a grand avenue to walk, to people watch and to admire the architecture of Gaudi and others.
Posh. This is where you will find all the expensive shops of Barcelona. High fashion, high prices. All the global brands are here.

As per my teenage daughter "Barcelona's Champs Elysees". This is a great street with all of the high end shops you can imagine. My seventeen year old daughter was in heaven. It was clean and a nice walk.

a great shopping mile. we were at first a little worried about thieves but we just clung to our bags and nothing happened. though we were not robbed it might be clever not to take a risk and watch the members of your group to make sure nothing is stolen. but then you can have real fun!

Great Street. Passeig de Gracia was our favorite street in Barcelona. We preferred it to the congestion of La Rambla. It's very wide and grand with many cafes and high end stores. It's also the location of two of Gaudi's great buildings; Casa Batllo and Casa Mila (La Pedrera). They are only a few blocks from each other. The south end of Passeig de Gracia take you right into the Gothic Quarter.

Wish I'd booked a hotel here rather than La Ramblas. Wish I'd booked a hotel here rather than La Ramblas which felt like the Vegas strip to me. Next time I'll look up where the high end stores are (like here) and find a hotel nearby. This is the vibe I was looking for.
One for the shopaholics. Lovely long avenue with all the designer and high street shops you could want as well as restaurants and bars. Look out for the Gaudi houses along the way!
A lot of good shopping their. A lot of good shopping their. All the nice shops are their.A lot of things are on sale in july. Bring enough money with you
Not to be missed!. A visit to Barcelona is not complete without a walk up the Passeig de Gracia to rubber-neck at all the modernista buildings.

Busy, exciting place. Busy street but really is the Champs Elyse of Barcelona with some heavy duty shopping. All the big names are represented here but at better prices than I've seen elsewhere. Summer sales are on at the moment so the bargains are there to be had.Great place to stroll and take in some tapas and a cool beer during the evening

Hot Spot. This is the best spot to live in Barcelona! It's central and just a few blocks from most of the historic cites and yet it has a peaceful charm about it. It is what made me fall in love with Barcelona!
cool area to hang out. very central area. large square that is very busy late into the night. we found a great gelato place and nice places to sit and have a beverage while people watching.

Lovely to spend time and absorb the culture. Lovely street in Barcelona where art nouveau architecture abounds and high culture. shopping, and galleries flavors the atmosphere. Restaurants on the side streets offer traditional fair and fresh produce markets abound. Gaudi architecture with other art nouveau flavors the setting. High end designer shops and art galleries peppered in creates a lively atmosphere.
a busy hub of activity. a busy hub of activity lots of shops and places to admire places to eat and drink and soak up the atomosphere
de Gracia. Excellent shopping and great cafes to sit, have a cold beverage and people watch. We went there several times during out stay in Barcelona and would go back in a second.

Upmarket shopping street with gaudis iconic landmarks. It's a fantastic stretch for shopping. Never realized that we would do so much shopping in barcelona. All the top brands (American and European) have their exclusive stores here. Sale is on in the month of July. Great deals in every store. Specially Mango, Desigual, Zara and Geox. Zara home is really nice. It's not yet there in Asia. U can find some great stuff there. It's full of tourists. In the evening found some people selling fake MK handbags on the street side. Lots of restaurants offering Spanish and italian cuisine. There is something for everyone . U can also spot Gaudis iconic landmark while shopping. Apple store looks cool. It is housed in an ancient building with modern interior. U can see lots of hop on hop off buses doing rounds if this place. Be careful and keep a tan on bags and purses. Pickpockets can spoil the fun. Better to wear/carry cross shoulder bags.Wear sun hat and carry a bottle of water. Must visit for everyone locals and tourists alike. Loved the reel if it. Sangria served at restaurant is a perfect treat on a sunny hot day.
Elegant street.. Very elegant street just up from the main Plaza Catalunya. Gaudi houses to visit, posh shops, lovely (if pricey) restaurants.
Shopping!. The widest avenue in Barcelona full of the best stores you can ever imagine! There's no shop you're gonna miss, from Zara to Chanel.
Excellent location. Central location for all venues. High end shops, nice restaurants. Can be a but pricey though. Easily accessible from airport.

Shopping and Architecture. Our hotel was located just off Passeig de Gracia where it terminates at Placa de Catalunya. Along with La Rambla, this is the street we most visited. It has shopping and restaurants plus it is the home to some of Barcelona's prized architecture, La Pedrera and the Block of Discord. Maybe not as unique as La Rambla but still essential to Barcelona visit. Please note these are your main and top of the line retail. There were not as much local or deals as other areas.

Shop, eat, drink and people watch in the sun.. One of the main thoroughfares of the city, street restaurants, tapas bars, shops. Beware of bikes, they come from all directions!Lots of the things to see are on this street.If you want to travel around the City, go to the tourist information kiosk and buy a bus pass for a couple or three days, it's convenient and cheap, get a bus map as well, you will need it as the routes can be a bit confusing!

Shopping Galore!. Location, Location, Location. This is probably one of the most transited location in Barcelona. Lots of shopping at this location. A metro by the same name makes it a very convenient location to go to and shop, shop, shop.
cash and carry. this is a very long shopping street with plenty to offer mainly to the ladies yuong and youmger . a very llong walk for their companions.

Nice walking street but keep your credit cards in your pocket!. This is the most expensive shopping area in Barcelona. It is a nice wide street with many well-known stores. There aren't many locally made clothing stores. Love that Casa Mila is integrated onto the street along with many other wonderful architectural details.

Main Arterie of Barcelona. Passeig de Gracia is kinda of the tourist mecca of Barcelona. The tourist busses depart and arive here, the airport shuttle bus's last stop before all the major hotels and is known for high end shopping and eating.

Walk the Walk. I doubt that those with trouble walking or those who don't care for walking would enjoy the Passeig de Gracia but we felt it was a great time to just absorb the people watching and see all the many shops and things going on. You are never far from a cold beer or glass of wine and tapas.

The Rodeo drive of Barcelona. If you want upscale fancy Prada, Jimmy Choo, Versace, Michael Kors etc this is the place to go. Of course i could only afford to window shop but it is good for people watching. There are some restaurants, tapas places along the way which I didn't try but it is fun to walk down here and window shop!

Fun street to walk up and down. A very broad boulevard that has several of Gaudi's more famous houses (La Pedrera and Casa Batlo). It is easily walkable, safe, with lots of people. The 2 hop-on/hop-off bus lines also have multiple stops along it.

Great for (high end) shopping and strolling. It's like one of those main streets in New York, like 5th Ave with high end shops, but just nicer. very pleasant if you just want to go for a stroll or stop at a café and pass the time.

Lots of designer shops!. Enjoyed several walks down Passeig de Gracia. Stopped into both Chanel and Prada just to say I did... Lovely street to walk down, especially if you plan to visit Casa Batllo or Casa Mila. Worth a visit!

Beautiful wide streets. Do love the wide bollivards of Barcelona and this are is particularly attractive with the trees and surrounding buildings. Charming with lots of upscale shops and cafes. Trendy.
perfect spot for shopping :). the most famous place to shop :) you are gonna love it if you are shopaholic :D the most famous brands are located on there.
We stayed on this street!. Lovely Main Street .... Great location ... Great shops ... Restaurants ,museums, etc .... Beautiful street

A lovely street. It is a lovely, wide street with lots of designer shops on both sides, good restaurants and people watching. Both Gaudi masterpieces, Casa Batllo and Casa Mila/La Pedrera, are located on Passeig de Gracia, so enjoy strolling along.

Excellent Road for Shopping. Excellent Road for Shopping, very original high standards brands
very good discount, nice chairs to rest and very clean road
Big shopping street in Barcelona. A main drag through Barcelona, with many top stores and boutiques. Not unlike many other shopping streets, though with all the high end makers from Spain.

Beautiful Passeig de Gràcia boulevard. Walk up the elegant Passeig de Gràcia, where you see the most famous Gaudi houses, casa Batlló and La casa Mila (La Pedrera) as well as other majestic buildings of the Modernism era. High end shopping stores.
Quality shopping. A wide road lined with good shops situated north of las ramblas.. less busy! The main station is here, accessed via the metro. Look out for an "R" on the metro notices.
Shoppers delight!. This long tree lined avenue had it all. Sidewalk cafes, for a café con leche to the Mandarin Oriental.. Very touristy, again look to watch people? It's free!!
avoid metro station. This place has the longest transfer between metro stations, try and avoid in hot weather's it's really hot down there.
Shop till you drop cuz you'll max out your Credit Cards. All the high end shops your heart desires...it's Rodeo drive in Barcelona. Wear comfy shoes because it's a lot of walking!

Great for a late afternoon stroll. Honestly, I didn't come to Barcelona to shop though I did find a lot of shops that were selling great clothes. Maybe next time, but Passeig de Gracia, which was very close to where I was staying, offers more than just shopping - it has some of the most inspiring architecture.

The chic artery of Barcelona's heart.. Enjoy the long walk up and down passengers de Gracia both day and evening as the mood is quite different and the experience worthwhile. Don't forget to look up and take in the sights - Gaudi is everywhere!
Shops. Expensive shops. Nice arcitektur. You can find the train to the Airport from this Place. We had only afford to windowshop :-)

Stands for "Passage to Spending $$$". This street, which is what "Passeig de Gracia" is, is adorned by some beautiful stores, some of the most elegant and high end stores that you would see in other world class cities, of which Barcelona is definitely one of them. You will also find Gaudi's Casa Batllo and Casa Milla (La Pedrera) on this street, which is one of the major North/South streets in the city. It is a very busy street, so be careful when crossing-careful of cars, but also careful of scooters and bikes. Some roads just look like sidewalks. Men, be careful leaving your significant others from your watch. Have money, will spend. Just one other area/street that enhances the beauty of Barcelona. Ole
Lovely walking street!. If you like Rodeo Drive, you will love Passeig de Gracia! It is such a lovely walking street, filled with designer boutiques and charming cafes.

The heart of Barcelona. Passeig de Gracia is the main street that runs from the Expedit (designer area) down to the las ramblas. If you walk from expedit region you pass the designer shops i.e. chanel then the main square in the middle where there is a shopping centre with approx 10 floors .If you go to the restaurant at the top of the shopping centre then is a viewpoint. Las rambles is a more lively area with a large food market ,restaurants , street sellers ect if you keep walking down you will reach the marina where there is more restaurants shops ,boat tours and markets ...loads to do. Hope to go back soon

Great Place to Shop. This is one of the best shopping streets in Barcelona. Shops range from the usual chains-Mango, Zara, etc to high end like Mont Blanc and Burberry. Spanish fashions are showcased in beautiful surroundings. There's a good selection of cafes and restaurants for weary shoppers.
Great Location. Our apartment was situated on Passeig de Gracia in the Eixample area which was fantastic. Being able to walk out the door to all the fabulous shops and restaurants was fantastic.
Picasso. This is where you can see 2 different museums.....We went to see the Picasso museum which again left me speechless
Loved this street. Beautiful area..wide sidewalks,great architecture..great shopping...land of Gaudi..his home is a must see and tour

Lovely and Lively. This is the Champs Elysees, if you will, of Barcelona, and accordingly busy. Nonetheless, it was a lively place to stroll and eat or people watch and should not be missed on a visit to the city.
all the designer names plus a couple of goudi sites. a safer area with broard streets cafes and tapas houses not the cheapest place to be eat or stay though

Beauty at every turn. The most lovely street ever, if you like beautiful buildings and even pavement that is a work of art. Top tip, buy a T10 and take the number 24 bus from placa cataluny up to gracia. You can see the lovely long road for cheaper than a tour bus.
Large!. It is full of tourists, jampacked with people so watch out for snatchers. But it is a wonderful place to shop specially during Rebajas months!
great shopping area. beautiful shops, plazas. Low buildings make the sun bright and it is a lovely place to walk and shop. convenient and clean.
ELEGANCE. A very elegant street for walking, shopping and fine dining. If you like walking, you can walk until Plaça Catalunya as well!
Stayed here for 2 weeks. Lots of places to eat walking distance to beach and la rambla lots of shops too great place to stay. We stayed in great airbnb next to metro
Shop till you drop. Lined with some of the best known names in expensive shopping, the Passaig de Gracia is off the Placa de Catalunya. Polish up the credit card!

Grandeur is still there. The posh area of the City, most multinationals of banking, insurances and fashion bought the commercial spaces and transformed this strip into a very wide showcase of power and style.

Nice - Fun. If in Spain you must at some point come here . Lots to see . Many people are there . The stores are more expensive but beautiful to see .. kind of like rodeo drive in Spain. The architecture AMAZING ... DO NOT MISS

Elegant wide tree lined Avenue.. Passeig de Gracia, although busy, is an elegant wide tree lined avenue. There are so many different styles of architecture to see, buildings like Casa Batllo and La Pedrera designed by Gaudi or Casa Lleó Morera by Lluis Domenech i Montaner. There are restaurants and cafes, plenty of shops ranging from high end to more affordable brands. My preference is to take an early morning stroll before it gets too busy, it's just delightful.

Strolling ! . This is the perfect place to just stroll and not only take in the architecture but also a bit of people watching. It's cleaner than las ramblas and not quite as packed so a pleasant change
Amazing. This is another place to admire the genius of Gaudi. It is incredible. You must go and walk around here in Barcelona. This is why Barcelona is one of the best cities in the world.
Fun Place to stroll. Enjoyed strolling along this area after dinner. Lots of stores to shop (or window shop), the "Block of Discord" buildings to see, and of course just people watching.
LOVABLE. A beautiful señorial alameda, with known brands shops, and - what's more important - La Pedrera and Batló's and Ametler houses. Good restaurants and tapas houses.

Great Boulevard to walk around. If you're into architecture, then this is the place to go in Barcelona. There are a lot of Modernisme buildings in this area. Most famous: Casa Milà and Casa Batlló (both Gaudi), Casa Amatller and Casa Lleó i Morera. There are also beautiful benches and lanterns. It's a very nice walk which shouldn't be missed.
Great wide avenue with good restaurants. Not as busy as 'downtown' so very pleasant to stroll & window shop - all the top range of shops here like Louis Viton etc!

Golden mile, golden culture. Passeig de Gràcia is very well known by the expensive fashion shops there, but you can find the a summary of the best patterns of the Modernism. A collection of buildings, urban furniture and street lamps will lead you to the first years of the 20th century while you breath, melt and deep into one of the most cosmopolite and modern streets of the world.
Good shops!. All the top designer shops in one street, Versace...Gucci..Chanel...go shop and enjoy.Excellent service, good location
The main artery into the city. If you like grand avenues, this is for you. Wide pavements with lots of cafes and shops. Just be careful crossing the road!

Shopping,walking,loving. This road have stores that allows you to find almost everything. It is a dream of your mind to walk in there even you buy nothing. A lot of building that is characteristic of Barcelona, two of the most beautiful buildings of Gaudi and people..people and more people of any ages. You have to visit this road
Nice boulevard. I nice place to walk. Lots of shops and good bars / restaurants. Some historical buildings are on route.
good for people watching. this is a very vibrant part of the city - lots of shops, bars and restaurants and lovely hotels. well worth the trip to the area to enjoy. it is busy but ....
Great Walk. Walk down and see beautiful buildings, clean roads, architecture, amazing shopping and not to miss the entire pavements are in Gaudi's tile work design.

Perfect daytime. This area is very nice and you can walk along the shops and restaurants all day. Its very busy so you need a lot of time to see all the daily life. Its a safe area and many good spots.
what a lively boulevard. there's just so much to see! i would recommend that the visit be in fall rather than summer though. it's much more pleasant.
Pretty avenue for strolling, shopping, and eating. There is some beautiful architecture along this avenue. There are also some big name stores and a good restaurant called La Consentida.
Lovely avenue. This is the Madison Ave of Barcelona. Lots of lovely shops. including famous designer shops. Very safe and clean. Gaudi buildings and other interesting architecture.

Nice street with very high end stores. Worth walking if you're staying in the Eixample area. It is loaded with high end stores. We liked the wide streets, fine restaurants and window shopping at some of the most expensive designer shops.
Fancy!. Barecelona's buildings are so charming and artsy and this entire area shows that! Its a great walk and it houses very large designer stores!!! A Must see!

interesting buildings, street packed with tourists. A wide avenue with very interesting architecture from the late 19th and early 20th centuries. Many restaurants but non of them really typical but more of generic tourist hangouts.
Busy shopping street. Whatever your budget you would definitely find something to buy in one of these shops along this wide tree lined street
High end shopping street. Everything from Chanel and Gucci to smaller boutiques. Some interesting Gaudi landmarks nearby, as well. A picturesque walk with tons of photo ops.

Pleasant stroll between Sagrada Familia and the Barri Gotic. This walk features some great architecture and is located between the Sagrada Familia and the Barri Gotic. Presuming that one is in reasonably good physical condition it's a nice way to get around the city while taking in the architectural gems and generally pleasant vibe of the city. If you are into shopping there are lots of options for this too.

Wide avenue with upscale boutiques and architecture. Very pleasant walk. Big trees, two Gaudi icon houses and many other exemplary buildings.From one nice roundabout with beautiful fountains to an obelisk that looks out of place I enjoyed the visit and visited few nice designer stores.This is a nice walk where you will see great architecture, glamour and financial institutions. It is a MUST for visitors. Not a long walk, little less than a mile, my guess. If you are in the old city, las Ramblas or plaza Catalunya, you just walk in opposite direction the The sea and you will be there, in one of the most visited streets of Barcelona.
Walkable ceremonial boulevard with high-end shops. Recent upgrades have changed the taxi/bus lanes into bike/pedestrian spaces, and it looks much better.

Antoni Plàcid Guillem Gaudí i Cornet. The great Master is still alive. His spirit lives in the houses he built and the streets of Eixample. Passeig is the widest and most beautiful of them - if you want to see Gaudi's mastepieces just take a walk down from Catalunya to Diagonal. You will see Casa Mila, Casa Balio and lot of others. Boutiqes, restaurants can be found in a large variety
Shops, Shops, Shops!. Great place to visit if you want to do some clothes shopping. So many great brands from high end boutiques to high street shops. Definitely recommend to any shopaholics!

Elegant Tree Lined Flamboyant Avenue. This is where you'l find the best examples of modernisme.This is one of the most beautiful streets in Europe. If visitingduring the summer it might be a good idea to go there after6.00p.m.

A must go. My wife and I ended up there every time we went to Barcelona as if there was a magic spell that pulled us back there each time. We truly enjoyed walking around the area which indeed has a lot to offer, if you do not mind the long walk and noise of the big city. but on the whole great. Well recommended.

Great for Shopaholics. Well it's a very nice road with loads of brand names to shop from adding to that the street is full of very nice architecturally beautiful buildings. Those buildings are just so fascinating to watch and visit, especially the works of Antoni Gaudi.I can't stress enough on how much this street is heaven for the shopaholics. So enjoy and go crazy :)

A beautiful classy part of Barcelona. Great shopping mile with all the famous brands being represented. A fews great hotels are located there as well in the midst of beautiful architecture.Lots of traffic though.

Shops galore. Any luxury brand, it can probably be found here. As someone without that sort of money, it was enjoyable for window shopping. Lots of over priced cafés, if you walk five more minutes prices will halve.

Lots to see and do!. Here, you have a great range of great stores to shop and places to eat. It does not matter whether you are shopping to buy, or just window shopping, a stroll along this street is a must. You also have wonderful modernist architecture along the way-What's not to like? Some shops have terrace cafes that are fun to rest your weary legs or just stop at one of the cafes right on the center of Passeig de Gracia and watch the world go by...
Beautiful street. You can spend hours walking this street, you have all the shops you could wish for, from designer to high street and thrown in you have the most stunning Gaudi architecture.

Fabulous Shopping & Magnificent Architecture !!. This avenue is the heart beat of Barcelona ... It's packed with all the relevant department stores and stand alone outlets you could possibly wish for ... Shoppers paradise !However it is also an architectural wonder - the street scape is just amazing with gems like Gaudi's house & museum.The wonderful buildings and Art Deco iron works that line this beautiful avenue are a sight to see Looking upwards as you walk along is a feast for the eyes !
Shopping paradise. Love the panoramic historical buildings along the streets, with greeneries and chic cafe. And the highlights were of course the premium branded flag stores.

Superb shopping and lively street life.. The range of shops is broad and interesting.....from the luxury brands found in Paris, L.A. and Toronto's Bloor Street to unique one-of-a-kind craft and souvenir stores. A new Longchamp store had opened the week before we arrived, and it's selection of the very latest high tech travel bags, purses and other great finds was impressive, even if just for window shopping! The grand hotels, iconic architecture and good restaurants, the broad pedestrian areas, flowers, trees and comfy benches make this street truly charming. Best of all, people from all walks of life take time to meet here, share a meal or a drink and talk. Lots of lively chatter everywhere. A great urban scene in a truly "walkable community".

Good high-end shopping, iconic Gaudi buildings and over-priced cafes.. Given that this is not a national capital it is surprising that Barcelona has attracted so many top luxury brands to open up shops but here they all are - which is fine if you like to look around expensive shops and who doesn't? The only downside is that it pushes the rentals sky high so that even very ordinary cafes and restaurants have to charge exorbitant prices for very ordinary fare in order to make a profit. A very pleasant walk- especially if you are going to look at the Gaudi buildings anyway - but have a coffee before you hit the street and plan to have lunch in the much better restaurants - and better value - eateries elsewhere in the city.

Excellent shopping. Love this street - some of the best shopping in Europe, minus the attitude that you find in other places (Paris). All the shops are here, from Zara to Louis Vuitton, and everything in between - plus great places to stop for a coffee, drink or dinner.

Shopping paradise for women ☺. It's indeed a shopping paradise for the ladies. It's like the Champs Elysee of Paris and Fifth Ave of New York. I understand things are cheaper here compared to Singapore. Like the Prada classic bag BN2805 - Tessuto Gaufre is Euro 1350...In Singapore, it is S$2790. After tax refund and conversion, it's almost S$1000 cheaper here than Spore. Also the Prada shop is right in front of a Barca attraction, Gaudi's La Pedrara. It is also beside Longchamps.

a must for all tourists. It is a wonderful street - great for shopping or just for a stroll. Wide, with many places to sit and the famous Gaudi buildings to see. But if you prefer quieter places - you'd better not go there - it is a really busy street ;)

Connecting Metro to Rodalies Trains. This can be a bit confusing, leaving you open to pickpockets and bag thieves so know where you're going!From PDeGracia Metro follow the signs to GREEN LINE L3 Trinitat Nova-this takes you through a really long underground walkway-then walk along the actual GREEN LINE L3 platform until the end then take the stairs for SORTIDA ARAGO. Once up the stairs turn right through the small metal gates. Follow the tunnel into the main Rodalies Station. If travelling on the Metro do not put your bag on the floor-mine was stolen as the thieves slide it out from behind the seats at a station ( I got it back).

Barcelona escapade. This street is closer in the city center..historic and nicest place can be found in this street. A place that there's a lot of shopping store for those who love shopping. Easy to find just only few minutes from cataluña.

Wonderful shopping. It was a great area for shopping with some sight seeing to see some of Gaudi's work. The street was tree line making it awesome to walk around especially on a hot day. There were lots of designer shops.

Here are many shops. We spent more time here than in Ramblas. Passeig de Gracia is full of luxury shops but others as well. Clothes, restaurants, ice cream, cafes, lots of people. Nice, busy though, atmosphere and nice to walk, sit down, have coffee and see the shops, if you like. If you start from the beginning of Passeig de Gracia you can end up to the shore to the end of La Rambla and Maremagnum. It's not too long a walk. Maybe another day for the old town.
high end shopping. Like to shop. Place to stop. Lots of international stores. I'm not a shopper, but if I were........ We ended up walking here quite a bit getting places so you will see it.

The street with all high end shopping stores and Casa Mila. Our hotel was walking distance to this street, Casa Mila is nice to see both in day and night when they light it up. All the high end stores are in this street. If you want to shop or just walk in a nice street or sit at Star bucks and people watch, you can go there.
Not to be missed!. And no excuse to miss it since the stroll is free. People-watching is a much fun as seeing the architecture!
Good shopping and still in the center. Very big offer of brand names for shopping here. The street is very wide and the combination of shopping and cafes is good.

The most elegant avenue in Barcelona. The best avenue to stroll with high end shop and it also two famous residents build by famous Architect Gaudi can be enjoyed on this Avenue. Much nicer than las ramblas

Many good fashion shops. To the lady's fashion lovers. This is a must to visit in Barcelona. Just out from Metro station, you shall find many interesting shops, The apartment designed by Gaudi just near by too. Compared to La Rambla, this is a much more to see.

Excellent central point to stay in. I'd never been to Barcelona, and was a little put off by all the things I read about petty crime and pickpocketing. I decided to stay at the Hotel Sixty-Two, and it was a great place to be as a central point from which to walk to a huge number of interesting places in Barcelona. This is a big shopping area, and is full of Gaudi architectural gems. It's close to Las Ramblas, the Gothic Quarter, and public transportation points.
great street. our hotel- majestic hotel was on this street,beautiful hotel!! this street is so nice, very wide with great cafes, restaurants and shopping

shopping for all budgets. cheaper shops at the plaza catalunya end, designer as you walk up the avenue. cafes are reasonably priced. lots of gorgeous architecture of course. side streets even more interesting though with lovely cafes for lunch and museums like the Art Deco and Egyptian.

Stayed on this street - in my opinion, best place to be in Barca!. We stayed at the Hotel SixtyTwo which is on Passeig De Gracia and I firmly believe this is the best road to situate yourselves for a holiday in Barcelona. It has all of the designer shops one could wish for, tonnes of restaurants and bars and it is such easy walking distance to all the main areas around it such as Las Ramblas, Barri Gotic and the port. If you want to venture to the sea, its is only a 8 euro cab ride - cabs galore on this road.

Great Shopping. This street is great for shopping .. they have everything from H&M to Michael Kors, Gucci, Louis Vuitton .. I found one really nice place called Punt O Roma .. beautiful clothing. Lots of colors and great sizes.
Great for shopping and Architecture. If you like all the high street names coupled with some of Gaudi's greatest work then Passeig de Gracia is the street for you.
Nice walk. Our hotel was on the main road and - left or right - the shops and restaurants and attractions were all interesting and intriguing. Busy street full of tourists.
Just another commercial, touristy, shopping street...... Just another commercial street with many international brand names.....very touristy and you need to watch out for your purses.

Original. Again a must see place in the city,try to plan your walks before you hit the city a great way to get around is by the very efficient metro system tickets can be bought for one trip,ten or days
Passeig de Gracia. We took both the metro and a train to and from Passeig de Gracia. It was in a very convenient location for us.
Interesting shopping street. There are lots of interesting shops along this street and very interesting architecture. It is a great venue to walk and window shop and just experience the city.

A Shoppers Paradise. You can find all you can't afford on this beautiful street but window shopping, browsing and dreaming is all free.
Spend the entire day walking both sides of the street stopping for a coffee or tapas at many of the sidewalk restaurants.
It's crowded, but the journey is worth it.

Posh shops and Gaudi houses. de Gracia is a wide street boasting a whole host of gilt edge stores,some with their own armed guards. If you walk away from Catalunya square the most famous Gaudi houses are on your left. Admission can be obtained but prepare to queue. Further along is another Gaudi building with huge windows seemingly unable to support the structure above. Don't miss the famous chimneys of almost scfi design by guess who?A refreshing fountan punctuates the street and really that's as far as we went. Grag a Sangria at one of the many pavement cafes.
As good as it looks. A really glamorous street with fabulous shops like fifth avenue!Casa batillo is a real high point. Lovely benches and places to walk and hang.
A lovely road to walk down. Plenty to see and do here with some Gaudi buildings to admire and plenty of opportunities to stop for refreshment.

Such a wonderful part of the city!!. We stayed at the The Plaza Catalunya III Apartment rented from Friendly Rentals. It was the perfect location. We ate most of our meals at venues on Passeig de Gracia and went for evening walks. Very safe and beautiful!
shopping street... Do you like Shopping?This is your street in barcelona!the most famous designers in 1000 meters!This is a good trip for barcelona center, very clasic and history street.
A Huge Mall at the Street. Do you like to shopping? This is your place! The best stores are there, you will walk and shop, walk and shop, walk and shop!!! And the street is beautiful too.

Great if you have money and love shopping. Lots of shops - but not for the bargain-hunter! Be prepared to spend big money of you visit this street. Although the frozen yoghurt with strawberry sauce was wonderful and only cost 3 Euros.

Very nice. Restaurants, high-end shops, interesting buildings. A wide avenue, one of the main streets in Barcelona. All kind of transport, metro and bus, leads to Placa Catalunya. Even the street lamps are fantastic

Shops shops shops.. Wonderful street with amazing shops. Would have loved to go to Prada and LV but closed on Sunday and then closed again on Monday as it was a holiday. Of dear no purses to take home.
unusual yet beautiful. another unusual and unique building in Barcelona. very futuristic for the time it was built. absolutely beautiful!
lovely :) i love this city. you should walk down this road, enjoy the buildings,shops and athmosphere!!paseo de gracia is a must-see when you come for a visit .

Nice neighbourhood. It's just a normal street, but nice neighbourhood. And it's not far from Eixample with many bars and stuff. Also not far from Placa Catalunya and Les Rambles. So yeah, it is centrally located, with a big station that connects you to everywhere... even to airport and Girona as far as I remember

High end shopping with a nice walk. If you're here, you're probably here for shopping. If you're not, it makes for a wonderful place to just walk around and enjoy the architecture. I was here for the latter and it was still pretty fun.
Shopping paradise. If you're looking to go shoppng in Bcn, this is the street! Bars to have a beer outside to have a break from shopping, and lux-shops

Shopping walk. Shopping is the best word to define this avenue, you will find lots of different shops and variety and it is also a nice large wide avenue with lot of green trees around.
You have farmacies, toy shops, bookshops, fashion shops, etc, all you will need you will find it walking this avenue.

High end shopping & Gaudi atchitrcture. If you like luxury brand shopping you'll enjoy strolling down this 1.5km street. It also sports 2 of Gaudi's famously designed buildings, Casa Batlló & La Pederera ~ Casa Milà. As far as shopping goes you'll find these same brands on most main luxury shopping boulevards of the world. I thoroughly enjoyed my time on this street. Although i enjoyed shopping on many of the side streets as they're filled with boutique shops and much better places to eat, in my opinion.

Don't know why I'm reviewing this?. If you have a very deep pocket book you can shop here! Very expensive stores line the street. We did pick up some cheap souvenirs for freinds at a corner stand. Avoid the creepy beggars.
Buzzy, vibey, easy access to transport links. We stayed close to here. Lovely little coffee shops where people are living la dolce vita. Very easy to catch buses and the metro.
Nothing special, unless you are here to shop. Large upmarket street with lots of high end shops. Nice for a stroll through. If you are here for clothes, bags etc you will be in heaven!

hotel was on the strip. Many great restaurants and faboulous shopping. Many stores like The Apple Store, ARMANI, Zara my favorite, HM and Mangos are located on this strip. Very clean touristy with a great water fountain that lights up in different colors throughout the evening.
Wide, tree lined avenue for shopping. Commercial except for wonderful Gaudi designed homes. Brand name stores you can find in most big cities. Good benches to watch the street scene.
A stroll in beautiful Barcelona. What a great street. It is really well laid out and fun and safe to walk. A great way to see some key Gaudi's buildings.

Lovely road. This road is beautiful with its fountains and clean patterned paving. It has fantastic restaurants and designer shops. If the designer shops are too pricy you can always get a fake Prada or Gucci outside from the street sellers for around €20! But you better be quick or they will be on their toes!

Lovely to take a stroll and see the architecture... and also window-shop. This is an elegant area and has some expensive boutiques - great to do some window shopping. But for me it is seeing the beautiful buildings and art nouveau light posts that makes walking up this street a true pleasure.

If you like 5th Avenue and Rodeo Drive ..... This is a very, very upscale street with all the famous name boutiques. If you like looking at the most expensive clothes, jewellery and other toys, then you will like Pg. de Gracia. I am not a big fan of the Passeig itself, but if you go onto the side streets off the Passeig (even 50 meters) then you can find some interesting and affordable restaurants.

One of the most beautiful and elegant area in Barcelona. It is worth a visit at any time of the year, elegant building, expensive boutiques and just really nice for windows shopping with an incredible amount of terraces, bars, tapas bars and so on. Highly recommended
Wander through the posh. Very e pensive window shopping, great architecture, especially near the diagonal, people watching , great cafes and good farmacias
Another street of expensive stores. if you come from a big city or travel a lot you have already seen these expensive stores. Still, a nice walk but no charm.
Beautiful walk. This is Barcelona's Champs ´Elysées, but with fewer cheap mall stores. Several beautiful Gaudi buildings, elegant stores for window shopping.

Upscale all the way and a must for shopaholics.. Any upscale boutique you can think of can be found here! It reminds me of the Champs Elysee. Wide sidewalks lined with trees and palm trees. Immaculately maintained with workers sweeping up trash throughout the day.

Try to stay here for your visit. Passeig de Gracia is one of the most expensive road in Barcelona. This is the same lane which was able to afford to hold some of Gaudi's creation. Gaudi's two of main creation La Paradeta and Casa Batilo are in this road. in this history it has been said that, as Barcelona was growing the rich used to live in the area and eventually they could hire someone like Gaudi to design some of their buildings which became UN heritage today.It is center to lot of places and you will find easy access to bus and metro.
Shop till you drop. That's exactly what I did. I shopped till I dropped. I hit up Zara, Adidas, Mango, small shops, etc.
